line: Actually he doesn't like the crust. And Squidward, the ketchup should be under the patty. And Squidward, the pickles should be on the left side. And Squidward, you should... And Squidward... And Squidward... And Squidward... And Squidward...

speaker: Squidward
line: Here, one of everything! No cheese, no crust, pickles to the left, four squirts of ketchup, wheat buns, non-dairy lettuce, and farm-raised tomatoes carnival-style! [sets a bigger ferris wheel on the table] And if there's anything else I can do, please hesitate to ask.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: That was delicious! Money's on the table, Mr. Krabs! [Mr. Krabs waves]

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: So long, boys! You see Squidward, the restaurant game is all about service. The customer is always right. Remember that, lad, and you'll be as successful as me one day.

speaker: Squidward
line: Oh, you're right, Mr. Krabs. I learned my lesson. And by the way, Bubble Buddy picked up the tab. [hands Mr. Krabs a $100 bill made of bubbles]

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: What's this?

speaker: Squidward
line: Bubble money. [$100 bill pops. Squidward shows his hand full of bubble change] At least he left a tip! [all the bubbles pop as Mr. Krabs and Squidward get angry. Scene cuts to Goo Lagoon]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Here we are buddy, Goo Lagoon. There are lots of ways to have fun here. [Scooter runs up to SpongeBob]

speaker: Scooter
line: Dudes, bury me! [laughs]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: See what I mean?

speaker: Scooter
line: [buried under the sand] All right!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Bubble Buddy, you dig him out while I get us some cotton candy.

speaker: Scooter
line: Don't just stand there dude, the tide's coming in. [laughs. Water reaches him] Dude?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [places Bubble Buddy inside] My friend's in there.

speaker: Harold
line: Congratulations.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [goes to the music and he dances along] Woo! Shake it! Shake it! Yeah! Shake that bubble butt! Yeah! [everyone looks at their behind and they leave in embarrassment]

speaker: Pearl
line: It's the world-famous surf punk, Grubby Grouper!

speaker: Grubby Grouper
line: Later, groupies! [shakes Pearl's hand] Grubby's got to go catch some gnarly pounders. Ahoo!

speaker: Pearl
line: [looks at her fin which is dirty now] Oh, I'll never wash this flipper again. [SpongeBob walks up with Bubble Buddy]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Hey Pearl! Shake hands with Bubble Buddy! [rubs Bubble Buddy's hands on Pearl's dirty flipper, her flipper is now clean. Pearl sobs. Scene cuts to the port-o-potty] It's his first time on his own.

speaker: Harold
line: Once again, congratulations. [later, the line is longer. Picture scrolls over to where we see a sign that reads '45 minutes from this point']

speaker: Man
line: Popcorn! Peanuts!

speaker: Lou
line: [sounding desperate] Ice cold drinks!

speaker: Harold
line: [camera stops on Harold and SpongeBob as SpongeBob whistles and Peterson struggles to hold it in. unable to take the wait anymore] Two hours is long enough! That's it! [opens the port-o-potty door to see a bubble]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Hey Bubble Buddy, you're finished! [takes Bubble Buddy away, leaving everybody to glare at them]

speaker: Francis
line: He kept us waiting for a bubble?

speaker: Larry
line: That's nothing! He called us fat! [along with others, begins crunching on celery stalk]

speaker: Pearl
line: [crying as she shows her clean flipper] He washed my flipper!

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: [storming up] He owes me money!

speaker: Squidward
line: [following Mr. Krabs] He made me provide excellent service!

speaker: Scooter
line: [appears with a halo and angel clothing on] Dudes! He made me experience high tide! [floats up towards the surface while laughing]

speaker: Tom
line: He poisoned our water supply, burned our crops and delivered a plague unto our houses!

speaker: Protesters
line: He did?

speaker: Tom
line: No... But are we going to wait around until he does?

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: I say we tip something over! [all yelling]

speaker: Lifeguard
line: Hey, hey, hey! [everyone tips the lifeguard stand]

speaker: Protester
line: Now what?

speaker: Protesters
line: Get the lifeguard! [they go to the lifeguard, but Squidward stops them]

speaker: Squidward
line: Wait! Don't waste this senseless violence on him! It's that stupid bubble of SpongeBob's that's causing all the problems! [holds a needle] Who's with me?

speaker: Protesters
line: [all hold a needle] Pop the bubble! [all yelling]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [everybody surrounds them] Hey everyone! Have you met my friend, Bubble Buddy?

speaker: Protesters
line: Yes...

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Hey, is this one of those sewing circles?

speaker: Protesters
line: No... [group steps in closer]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Would you mind not getting so close with those pins? Pointy objects make Bubble Buddy uncomfortable.

speaker: Larry
line: SpongeBob, that bubble's got to go.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Oh no, he already took care of that, but thanks for your concern.

speaker: Pearl
line: No. "Go" as in... [blows a bubble gum till it pops]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [screams] Why?

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: You and that bubble have been nothing but trouble! It's time to end it!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: No! I won't let you! blows Bubble Buddy until they begin floating] Here we go! You'll never catch us now! Never! Ha! Never! [both start to get lower to the ground and the group surrounds them both again] Never...

speaker: Squidward
line: Enough sea-horsing around, SpongeBob! Give us that bubble!

speaker: Protesters
line: Pop the bubble! Pop the bubble! Pop the bubble!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: No! You can't! He's not just a bubble, he's a Bubble Buddy! He's my friend and I love him! Haven't you ever had a very special friend?

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Oh, Nickel Buddy, I'll never spend you!

speaker: Sheldon
line: Funny Muffler...

speaker: Larry
line: Jerky Pal...

speaker: Harold
line: Boo-boo Keys...

speaker: Man
line: Snake Eyes... [together with Harold] We love you! [burst into tears]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: So, what do you say?

speaker: Protesters
line: [look at each other, then they bring out their needles] Pop the bubble! Pop the bubble! Pop the bubble! [throw SpongeBob away]

speaker: Squidward
line: Let's get this over with so I can go home and play my clarinet!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Noo... [Squidward charges his needle towards Bubble Buddy in a slow dramatic manner, while SpongeBob begs them to stop. But then suddenly Bubble Buddy grabs ahold of Squidward's hand before the needle reaches the former]

speaker: Bubble Buddy
line: Whoa! [all except SpongeBob gasp] Hey, don't I get a say in this? I'll see you later, SpongeBob. Things are getting a little weird around here.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: So long. [Bubble Buddy gets into a bubble taxi and it floats away as it drives off]

speaker: Bubble Buddy
line: Happy Leif Ericcson Day!

speaker: Squidward
line: He's... alive?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Of course! Otherwise he couldn't tell such funny jokes! [laughs as everyone walks off muttering and agreeing with Bubble Buddy's departure] Seems like only this morning that I held his bottle. [sniffles] They blow up so fast. [weeps tears of joy while blowing his nose and runs off. A bunch of bubbles pop near Squidward except for one]

speaker: Squidward
line: [thinking bubble is alive like Bubble Buddy] Uh...hi?

speaker: [One day, Squidward is dressed in island clothes and playing the piano on an island. He hits one of the notes but realizes it's a sour note and he keeps hitting it. The sound is coming from SpongeBob hitting a bell]
SpongeBob
line: Order up, Squidward! [Squidward wakes up from his dream while his alarm clock goes off. Cuts to Squidward driving to work. Zooms in on one of his bumper stickers that reads "Don't Ask Me About My Day." Squidward blearily looks up from his steering wheel to prepare himself for the day ahead. walks up to the front doors and SpongeBob follows him from inside, smiling. Squidward walks inside]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Hey, hey Squidward, did you see me? [Squidward walks inside without saying a word] Okay, see you later, Squidinator.

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Good morning, Mr. Squidward. [Raises his eyebrows; Squidward sticks out his tongue] So, are you ready?

speaker: Squidward
line: To go home?

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: No, to exchange gifts for Employee Brotherhood Day.

speaker: Squidward
line: Mr. Krabs, you pay me to stand behind this register and take orders and give change. But you could never pay me enough to act brotherly towards... [points at SpongeBob] ...that guy. [SpongeBob is washing a table with a buffer. He scrubs his face and gets it scrambled. He laughs]

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: That attitude of yours is precisely why we're having this little shenanigan. Now pay attention, the lad's got a surprise for you.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Squidward, in honor of employee brotherhood, I present to you a gift. [holds up a sweater] Ta-dah. [zooms in to show it's a picture of a heart with Squidward's face on it]

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Try it on, Mr. Squidward! It's got you written all over it. [laughs as Squidward has a hard time putting the sweater over his head]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: I wasn't sure how big to make the hole for the head, so I used a watermelon for size. [Squidward gets the sweater over his head] Do you love it?

speaker: Squidward
line: [starts scratching the sweater] It's a little itchy. What's this thing made of? [cut to SpongeBob with no eyelashes or eyebrows]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Eyelashes! [Squidward throws the sweater at SpongeBob, causing him to whimper]

speaker: Squidward
line: Now may I resume to my minimum-wage duties?

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: After you present your brotherhood gift.

speaker: Squidward
line: I'll buy the little twerp a gum ball.

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Oh, no, no, no, no, lad. You know the rules; you have to make the gift.

speaker: Squidward
line: [walks to the doors] The only thing I'm making is for the exit. [opens up the door to see SpongeBob with a new sweater made out of a clear liquid]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Is this any better, Squidward? I made this one with my tears. [sniffs. Squidward sighs and walks towards the kitchen]

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: I knew you'd come around, boy. Make something nice.

speaker: Squidward
line: Why can't I just buy something for the little weirdo?

speaker: Captain
line: Heave-ho! [Squidward looks and sees some pirates outside carrying some pies onto the ship] If you drop one single slice of me booty, I'll have... your booty!

speaker: Squidward
line: Hi, there. Those homemade pies sure look good.

speaker: Pirate
line: Oh, these aren't homemade. They were made in a factory... a bomb factory. They're bombs.

speaker: Squidward
line: Oh, well, that's too bad. I thought they were pies and I wanted to buy one. [holds up money]

speaker: Captain
line: Wait! [jumps down off the ship] We were just kidding about all that bomb stuff. That'll be 25 bucks, please.

speaker: Squidward
line: So, what flavor is it?

speaker: Pirates
line: [all talking at once] Cherry. Apple. Raspberry.

speaker: Squidward
line: Well, if it'll get old man Mr. Krabs off my back. [Squidward gives the pirate the money. Cut to Squidward placing the pie on Mr. Krabs' desk] Okay, here it is, Mr. Krabs, fresh from the oven. I'll be returning to my life now.

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Not yet. I got to make sure you did it right. [about to put a piece in his mouth] Wait a second... this would go great with some milk! [while walking to the milk, he trips over a book and the piece of pie flies into the milk, causing an explosion] So, you tried to kill me over a little new aged management, eh?

speaker: Squidward
line: But, Mr. Krabs, I had no idea. I can explain! [cut to inside Mr. Krabs' office]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Mr. Krabs, are you okay? I heard a... wow! A pie! [looks at the card attached to it] It's from Squidward. [reading] "To SpongeBob... Well, here you go."

speaker: Squidward
line: And that's what happened.

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: 25 dollars? A bomb?

speaker: Squidward & Mr. Krabs
line: [loudly] In the Krusty Krab?! [both run back into the office but the pie is not there]

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: That's where you left it.

speaker: Squidward
line: It's not there.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Hey guys. [licks his fingers then rubs his belly] Thanks for the pie, Squidward. [sings] La, la, lalalalalala. [skips out]

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: You had to kill him. The boy cries you a sweater of tears and you kill him. How are you gonna live with yourself?

speaker: Squidward
line: Kill him? [Squidward imagines SpongeBob taking a tray to a customer]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Here's your order, sir.

speaker: Customer
line: Thanks. [SpongeBob explodes and pieces of SpongeBob fly everywhere]

speaker: Squidward
line: No, no! What we got... we got to call the hospital!

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Won't do any good. I've seen this before. When that pie goes up to bat, I mean, hits his lower intestine... boom!

speaker: Squidward
line: You've seen this before?

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Eleven times as a matter of fact. [Squidward runs over to a phone and dials the hospital]

speaker: Squidward
line: Yes, hello, doctor? Hospital? It won't do any good? Eleven times? [hangs up] Oh, he's a goner. How do we tell him? [both look out the window and see SpongeBob cheerfully wiping off a table, apparently having forgotten about the earlier incident]

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Don't tell him. That'll only make him feel worse. The way I see it, he's only got till sunset. Why ruin his last day on earth? The lad deserves to enjoy his final hours. [walks away]

speaker: Squidward
line: [tears up] You're right, Mr. Krabs! [sobs] I'm gonna make SpongeBob's final hours the best he's ever had. And this time, there's going to be love... so much, he's going to drown in it. [opens the door then turns around, smiling] Drown in it! [walks out]

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: [writes on a notepad] Note to self Watch out for Squidward. [Cut to Squidward walking over to SpongeBob, who is singing happily and wiping the table]

speaker: Squidward
line: Uh, SpongeBob?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [sing-songy] Yes?

speaker: Squidward
line: I forgot to tell you, there's a part two to your gift.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Part two? [bounces up and down] Part two, part two, part two, part two... [Squidward grabs him]

speaker: Squidward
line: Please, don't do that.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: What's the part two?

speaker: Squidward
line: Well, what's the most fun thing you can think of? [SpongeBob takes out a list]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Actually, I keep a list of the fun things I like to do. I call it my friendship list.

speaker: Squidward
line: Great. Uh, let me see it. [looks at the list]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: The things that are extra fun, I've written in red.

speaker: Squidward
line: Everything's in red.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Yeah, I know.

speaker: Squidward
line: We'd better start now if we want to get through this list before you die... of anticipation.

speaker: Squidward
line: Uh, yeah. Let's take a look at that list.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Well, the first thing I want to do is show my best friend Squidward to everybody in town. [cut to SpongeBob and Squidward talking to a businessman] Hi, there, this is my best friend, Squidward. [cut to SpongeBob and Squidward talking to some kids] Hey, kids, check it out! This is my best friend, Squidward. [one of the kids throws a rock at Squidward's head. Cut to SpongeBob and Squidward walking up to a fish sitting on a bench] Hi, I want to show you my best friend, Squidward.

speaker: Squidward
line: Hey, Frank. [montage ends] Glad that's over.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Good, cause we're onto our next activity.

speaker: Squidward
line: Which is...?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: I'm going to show my best friend Squidward to everybody in town wearing a salmon suit.

speaker: Squidward
line: You're going to be wearing a salmon suit?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [laughs] That's a good one Squidward. [cut to Squidward in a salmon suit in front of some kids. All the kids throw rocks at Squidward. Cut to SpongeBob checking off the item on his list] Next. [SpongeBob and Squidward sit by a rock] Knock-knock jokes! Hey Squid, knock-knock.

speaker: Squidward
line: Who's there?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: I am! [laughs]

speaker: Squidward
line: [laughs weakly] Oh, yeah... [SpongeBob checks the knock-knock jokes off his list. Cut to SpongeBob and Squidward walking backwards]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [imitates the beeping of a back up alarm] Look out, everyone, friends in reverse! [continues beeping. SpongeBob checks off this item off the list. Cut to SpongeBob and Squidward making noises with their tongues out of their mouths while moving their hands back and forth in front of their face. SpongeBob checks the item off his list. Cut to Squidward walking with SpongeBob as his face]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Turn left, and... stop. See, that's what it would be like if you had me for a face.

speaker: Squidward
line: [muffled] I can't breathe. [SpongeBob checks that off his list. Cut to SpongeBob performing open-heart surgery on Squidward]

speaker: Squidward
line: Are you sure you should be poking it like that?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Who's the doctor here? [heart squirts blood. SpongeBob checks his operation off the list as well as some other items while he laughs] The last thing on the list is...

speaker: Squidward
line: [with a bandage over his heart] Does it involve more dismemberment?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Watch the sunset with Squidward.

speaker: Squidward
line: Sunset? [thinks about what Mr. Krabs said earlier in a thought balloon]

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: The way I see it, the lad's got until sunset before that bomb hits his lower intestine.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Hey, it's Mr. Krabs! Hi, Mr. Krabs. [Mr. Krabs cries and runs off] Okay, see you later.

speaker: Squidward
line: C'mon buddy, you want a sunset, you'll get a sunset.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Ah, underwater sunsets sure are beautiful. Eh, Squidward?

speaker: Squidward
line: Yeah.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Yeah, this is great, just the three of us. You, me, [a brick wall is shown between the two] ...and this brick wall that you built between us.

speaker: Squidward
line: Yeah. [laughs nervously]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Sunsets always remind me of bowls of fruit. What do they make you think of, Squidward? [Squidward imagines SpongeBob exploding]

speaker: Squidward
line: Explosions... I mean, erosion.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: You know, if I were to die right now in some sort of fiery explosion due to the carelessness of a friend, well, that would just be okay. [Squidward tears up. SpongeBob burps] Wow, it feels like something just dropped into my lower intestine. [smells the aroma] Hey, smells like cherry. Or maybe grape. Blueberry? [the sun starts to go down] Here it is, the sunset! I always love to count it down. Five... You do the rest, buddy.

speaker: Squidward
line: Four... three... two... one... [nothing happens]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: I guess we started too early. Let's start again.

speaker: Squidward
line: Five... four... three... [an explosion is heard from behind the wall] two... [cries] o-o-o-one... Well, at least I was able to make his last few hours meaningful. [he sighs] I am such a good person. [another explosion is seen behind the wall but this time, it knocks the brick wall down on top of Squidward. SpongeBob is blowing some bomb-shaped bubbles]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Hey, Squidward, check this out! [Squidward gets up and mutters] Squidward, we already played babble like an idiot.

speaker: Squidward
line: Why are you still here?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Well, since we finished everything on the list, I thought I'd make up a new one. [holds up a book that says "Friends 4 Ever"] I already filled up this book of ideas. We should be able to finish by January.

speaker: Squidward
line: [slaps book away] Forget the book! I spent the whole day with you, doing all kinds of ridiculous things, because you were supposed to explode!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: You want me to explode?

speaker: Squidward
line: Yes! That's what I've been waiting for!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Um, okay, I'll try. [grunts and then yells] Gary! You are gonna finish your dessert and you are gonna like it! [laughs] Now it's your turn.

speaker: Squidward
line: [yells and stomps on the ground] That's not what I meant, you barnacle head!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Oh, good one.

speaker: Squidward
line: No! You were supposed to explode into a million pieces! [he flaps his arms]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Why would I do that?

speaker: Squidward
line: Because the pie you ate was a bomb!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: What pie?

speaker: Squidward
line: The one that I left sitting on the counter this morning that I bought from pirates for 25 bucks and I didn't know it was a bomb, and you ate it... th... that pie!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Pie...pie... [takes out a pie] Oh, you mean this pie! I was saving it in my pocket for us to share. Let's eat! [walks forward and trips on a rock] Oops! [pie flies into Squidward's face in slow-motion causing an explosion the size of an atomic bomb, which is a clip of test Baker, just offshore from Bikini Island]

speaker: Squidward
line: [now in the destroyed town] Ouch. [fade to black, episode ends]

speaker: Narrator
line: Ah, the Krusty Krab. Home of the Krabby Patty, with its top secret formula, known only to those who are brave enough and intelligent enough to comprehend its culinary complexity. [SpongeBob is balancing a spatula on his nose behind the register]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Look Mr. Krabs. I'm doing it, I'm doing it!

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Quit fooling around, SpongeBob, we got customers.

speaker: Narrator
line: But wherever there's a secret recipe, there is someone who wants to steal it. [Plankton laughs evilly while standing in the head of a robot fish. The head falls down]

speaker: Plankton
line: Ouch! [robot's arm turns into a mirror] And now for the final touch. [puts on a mustache] Perfect! With this disguise, that formula is as good as mine. [laughs then wheels himself into the restaurant]

speaker: Fish Robot
line: Are you SpongeBob SquarePants? [SpongeBob looks in a mirror]

speaker: Fish Robot
line: Then you've just won one million dollars! [SpongeBob gasps] You just have to answer one question. What is the Krabby Patty secret formula? [SpongeBob inhales] Yes? [SpongeBob inhales more] Yes? [SpongeBob inhales even more] Yes?!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [speaking rapidly fast] The Krabby Patty formula is the sole property of the Krusty Krab and is only to be discussed in part or in whole with its creator, Mr. Krabs. Duplication of this formula is punishable by law. Restrictions apply, results may vary. [SpongeBob smiles, the mustache falls off the robot, then Plankton crashes through the teeth]

speaker: Plankton
line: [growls] That's it? [jumps on SpongeBob's nose and holds his eyelids] You'd better cough up that secret formula or else!

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Plankton!

speaker: Plankton
line: [Looks at Mr. Krabs] Krabs!

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Plankton!

speaker: Plankton
line: Krabs!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: SpongeBob. [Mr. Krabs grabs Plankton and a straw then puts Plankton in the straw]

speaker: Plankton
line: You can't do this to me, Krabs! [Mr. Krabs blows Plankton back to the Chum Bucket] I went to college! [Plankton crashes into his restaurant] Ouch.

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: That Plankton is a clever beast. You've got to keep a sharp eye out for him, SpongeBob. The Krabby Patty law must be enforced. The future of the Krusty Krab depends on it.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Don't worry Mr. Krabs, as long as these pants are square, [grabs himself] and this sponge is Bob, [lifts his arms up] I will not let you down!

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Uh, SpongeBob? [shown holding Mr. Krabs] Could you let me down? [cut to later, at the Krusty Krab]

speaker: Fish
line: Man, these patties sure are delicious. I wonder what's in that secret formula. [siren goes off. SpongeBob slides down the pole from the crow's nest]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Code twelve, code twelve! [SpongeBob bounces off a trampoline and grabs the customer's head] Your disguises can't fool me this time, Plankton! [pulls the head off to reveal a smaller head on the customer; everyone gasps]

speaker: Fish
line: Everyone at the head enhancement clinic said nobody would notice. [runs off crying]

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: SpongeBob! You're scaring away me money!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Sorry Mr. Krabs, I was just trying to protect the secret formula.

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: That's no reason to rip other people's heads off, boy! Just remember the most important rule.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: No free napkins?

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: No, the other most important rule. Regarding the secret formula.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Only discuss the formula with Mr. Krabs.

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: As long as you do that, the secret is safe.

speaker: Squidward
line: I always thought the most important rule was "why do today what you can put off till tomorrow?" [laughs]

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: What is today, but yesterday's tomorrow?

speaker: Squidward
line: Huh? [cut to Mr. Krabs and Squidward in a storage room]

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Today, I want you to take inventory on everything in here; every last pickle and patty must be accounted for.

speaker: Squidward
line: Aye aye, captain. [Mr. Krabs leaves. When Squidward walks over to the stock, glowing eyes appear] Two boxes of buns. Three pounds of patties.

speaker: Imitation Krabs
line: [mechanical voice] Mr. Squidward...

speaker: Squidward
line: What now, Mr. Krabs?

speaker: Imitation Krabs
line: That's right, I am Krabs.

speaker: Plankton
line: Your boss, your ruler, your master! [laughs evilly]

speaker: Imitation Krabs
line: Ha, ha, ha. [exhaust smoke spurts out]

speaker: Squidward
line: You're not Mr. Krabs.

speaker: Imitation Krabs
line: Hey, why don't you take the rest of the day off?

speaker: Squidward
line: [chuckles and runs to the door] Well... whatever you say, "Mr. Krabs." [laughs] Whoopee! [runs out as SpongeBob walks in]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Hi, Mr. Krabs.

speaker: Plankton
line: Oh, sweet domination. This is it!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: No sign of Plankton, yet. Gosh, Mr. Krabs. You don't look so good. [touches his body] Ooh, you're so cold. [knocks on his pants]

speaker: Imitation Krabs
line: That's just my metal suit. I made it to protect the formula.

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: SpongeBob! SpongeBob! [second "SpongeBob!" echos]

speaker: Plankton
line: It's that thick-headed Krabs! He'll ruin everything!

speaker: Imitation Krabs
line: Look, a jellyfish. [SpongeBob takes out his net and runs around]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: I got it, I got it! [Plankton presses the "Abort" button. When he does, Imitation Krabs shrinks into a toaster] I got it, I got it! [Mr. Krabs enters]

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: SpongeBob! [SpongeBob stops and looks at the toaster, which releases its toast, then looks at Mr. Krabs]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [knocks on Mr. Krabs' pants] Hey Mr. Krabs, what happened to your metal pants?

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Don't get all loopy on me, boy. I need your help. And where in the high seas is Squidward?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: You gave him the day off.

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: [pupils get smaller] Day... [bellows] Off?! [Mr. Krabs is so mad that he makes steam come out of the chimney] I don't know the meaning of them horrible words!! Now quit your laying around SpongeBob, and take out that garbage! It's starting to give me a rash. [exits]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Yes, sir, Mr. Krabs, sir! [puts a clothespin on his nose is going to take the trash out but Imitation Krabs stops him] Hey Mr. Krabs, just taking out that garbage.

speaker: Imitation Krabs
line: Never mind that. I need to talk to you. [takes the trash bag and vaporizes it with his laser eyes]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Whoa-ho, Mr. Krabs! I didn't know you had heat vision!

speaker: Imitation Krabs
line: Never mind. I need you to tell me...

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: SpongeBob!

speaker: Imitation Krabs
line: Yoinks! [runs off]

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: SpongeBob, I'm not paying you to stand around. [gives him a spatula] Get back to the kitchen!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: But I thought you wanted to ask me a question.

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Yes... why aren't you working harder?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [slowly] I don't know, Mr. Krabs... I don't know. [both walk out]

speaker: Plankton
line: I'll never get that formula with that pest Krabs popping in and out like that. I've got it! I've been saving this for a rainy day. [holds up a penny] It looks like an ordinary penny... because it is an ordinary penny! That fool Krabs is too greedy to ignore you, my little pretty. [laughs evilly. The penny pops out of the nose and rolls around into Mr. Krabs' office]

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: That sound, it sounds like... the pitter-patter of... [sees the penny] money! [squeals] Hey, where you going, beautiful? [SpongeBob knocks on Mr. Krabs' door]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Mr. Krabs... [the penny slides out of the office] Wha... [Mr. Krabs busts down the door on top of SpongeBob]

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Stop! Please! [the penny slides between the crack of the doors and rolls away with Mr. Krabs running after it] Wait! [Robot Krabs is hiding behind the sign pole]

speaker: Imitation Krabs
line: Nothing stands between me and that secret formula now. [snaps off some of the Krusty Krab sign pole. As he laughs evilly, the sign falls on top of him] Ouch! [cut to SpongeBob, who is scrubbing the floor]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Scrub-a-dub-dub, I love to rub. [Robot Mr. Krabs rolls by] Hey Mr. Krabs, just doing a little scrubbin'.

speaker: Imitation Krabs
line: Hello SpongeBob, it is me, Mr. Krabs. [exhaust pipe smokes] In the flesh. [exhaust pipe smokes again] Standing right in front of you. [pipe smokes again] With no one else around.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: I can see that, Mr. Krabs.

speaker: Imitation Krabs
line: I thought we might discuss the Krabby Patty secret formula. [a microphone comes out of Imitation Krabs]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Isn't that a microphone?

speaker: Imitation Krabs
line: What? Why, yes it is. [puts microphone back inside his body] I must get this shirt cleaned. Alright, now tell me the secret formula.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: But sir, we haven't done the secret handshake yet.

speaker: Imitation Krabs
line: Oh yes. Here, let's shake.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [chuckles] We don't shake with our hands, remember?

speaker: Imitation Krabs
line: Uh, right, why don't you start?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: We stand on one foot. [they do] Balance a glass of chocolate milk on our heads and sing the Bikini Bottom National Anthem. [they do]

speaker: Music
line: "Bikini Bottom National Anthem"

speaker: Oh, Bikini Bottom, we pledge our hearts to you, As faithful, as deep, as true, as blue, Bikini Bottom, we love you!
Imitation Krabs
line: Formula time?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Almost.

speaker: Narrator
line: Six and a half hours later... [Plankton grunts frantically as he gets Robot Krabs into a cannon which spits him out, through a flame ring, and onto a chair at a table. He opens up the robot's belt buckle and dumps some spaghetti in there]

speaker: Imitation Krabs
line: Yum yum, this spaghetti sure is good. Belch!

speaker: Music
line: "The Spaghetti Song"

speaker: Meatball. Meatball. Spaghetti underneath. Ravioli. Ravioli. Great Barrier Reef! [They clap]
Imitation Krabs
line: Okay, now let's hear that formula.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Sorry, [takes off his chef mustache] no can do, Mr. Krabs. [Robot Krabs' eyes are on fire]

speaker: Imitation Krabs
line: What?!

speaker: Plankton
line: [exploding in rage] But we did everything you said-- I followed all the rules! I even ate 105 black licorice jellybeans through a straw!

speaker: Imitation Krabs
line: Now why can't you tell me the formula?!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: It's your rule. Never speak the formula. You told me to keep it in...this bottle. [holds up a bottle with a piece of paper in it]

speaker: Plankton
line: [Imitation Krabs opens its eyes, Plankton is overly excited and tense] This is it, Plankton. Gently, now... [pushes on a lever that makes Robot Krabs' arm stretch out more. A penny rolls through the door and Mr. Krabs comes in. Everyone gasps, including the guy on the penny]

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: [Gasps]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [Gasps]

speaker: Guy on the Penny
line: [Gasps]

speaker: Imitation Krabs
line: Gasp!

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: How could you do this, SpongeBob? Giving me secret formula to this imposter?!

speaker: Imitation Krabs
line: Don't listen to him, SpongeBob. Remember Ravioli, ravioli, give me the formuoli.

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: SpongeBob, no! Don't listen to him. I'm the real Mr. Krabs.

speaker: Imitation Krabs
line: Don't listen to him. He's obviously a robot. [exhaust pipe smokes]

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Well, if I was a robot, which I'm not, at least I'm well put together. Not some rusted-out, steam-driven piece of junk!

speaker: Imitation Krabs
line: Who are you calling steam-driven...?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [unable to handle the pressure, explodes in frustration] Quiet! [SpongeBob is holding a giant hose in his hands and his eyes bloodshot] Until I know who the real Mr. Krabs is, nobody moves, [it is soon revealed that the hose is attached to a large tartar sauce machine] nobody gets hurt.

speaker: Mr. Krabs & Robot Krabs
line: Tartar sauce?!

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Take it easy with that thing, son. [SpongeBob squirts some tartar sauce at Mr. Krabs causing him to jump into Robot Krabs' arms]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: I'll do the talking around here. I think I'll just ask you two a couple of questions. Questions only the real Mr. Krabs could answer.

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Okay then.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: First question What time does the Krusty Krab open?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Right. [to Mr. Krabs] That's one strike, Mr. Fake.

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: But...

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Nuh-uh-uh! I'm running this quiz show, I'll ask the questions. If there's gonna be any 'buts,' they're gonna be from me. Okay, question number two How much does a Krabby Patty cost?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: On Wednesday...

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: That's an easy one. You just...just... let's see... if its..uh.. if it's January... with...with vanilla pudding...you...uh...pass? [Mr. Krabs is shot out of the Krusty Krab with tartar sauce into a fry basket] Wait, SpongeBob! Give me another chance. [Rolls away in the basket] No!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: So long, Imitation Krabs! Buh-bye! [walks back inside] I knew it was you all along Mr. Krabs, here you go. [holds up the formula bottle]

speaker: Imitation Krabs
line: Thank you, SpongeDupe. [grabs bottle and laughs mechanically. SpongeBob sees a penny on the ground]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Oop! Don't forget your lucky penny. [puts the penny inside a slot on Robot Krabs that is labeled "Self-Destruct 1 cent"]

speaker: Imitation Krabs
line: Yoinks.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: This must be your lucky day. [laughs]

speaker: Karen
line: The self-destruct coin slot has been activated. Ten seconds 'till detonation.

speaker: Plankton
line: Coin-operated self-destruct? Not one of my better ideas. Help! [screams as he wheels back to the Chum Bucket but explodes when he gets inside. giant hand comes down on top of him] Ouch. [the formula bottle rolls back to SpongeBob]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: If that was Plankton... Uh-oh!

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Help! Get Away! No!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Mr. Krabs! [runs to Mr. Krabs, who is still in the fry basket]

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Back you Hungry Hand, back! Help! [SpongeBob wheels Mr. Krabs back to the Krusty Krab safely]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Gee, Mr. Krabs. I'm sorry. I thought you were a phony.

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Phew, that's okay, me lad. Long as the secret formula's safe again. [takes the bottle] However, that penny's coming out of your paycheck. [both laugh]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Really?

speaker: Narrator
line: Ah, Sandy Cheeks is going out of town and has asked SpongeBob and Patrick to do a little pet-sitting for her. [inside the dome are a few animals in cages and/or jars]

speaker: Patrick
line: Pet-sitting? Won't that hurt them? [SpongeBob and Patrick walk up to a bird cage]

speaker: Narrator
line: Perhaps she should have asked someone else. [Patrick whistles at the bird]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Gee, Patrick, I didn't know you spoke bird.

speaker: Patrick
line: No, that's Italian, SpongeBob. [Sandy puts a big sack down]

speaker: Sandy
line: Okay boys, this here is Birdy's food. Feed him twice a day.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: This whole sack?

speaker: Sandy
line: No, just a cup's worth. [all walk over to a cricket] This here's my cricket. [the cricket makes noises] He's saying hello to you. Ain't he cute?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Sorry, but I don't speak Italian.

speaker: Sandy
line: And this here's Snakey. [holds up the snake that has a mouse in it's belly]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: What's that lump in its belly?

speaker: Sandy
line: Well, that's his dinner. [SpongeBob pokes it, mouse moves] Well, I guess that's it. I gotta go. [walks off with a suitcase] See you guys in a couple of days.

speaker: SpongeBob and Patrick
line: Bye, Sandy! [notices the worm in a jar]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: ['gasps] Wait! You forgot about this pet!

speaker: Sandy
line: Oh, that's only Wormy. He don't eat much. [walks out]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Look at him Patrick, isn't he great? Hey, little fella.

speaker: Patrick
line: Kitchie-kitchie koo, koo.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Aw look, isn't he just precious? Let's take him out to play. [cut to SpongeBob playing hide-n-seek and counting] 998... 999... 1000. Ready or not, here I come! [turns around and takes the table cover off of Patrick's head]

speaker: Patrick
line: You found me! [both look for Wormy, who is on a leaf]

speaker: SpongeBob and Patrick
line: There you are! [cuts to Sponge and Pat hiding behind a tree. Wormy pops up behind it] He found us! [they laugh]

speaker: Patrick
line: Gee, SpongeBob, I don't want today to end ever.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: I know Patrick, days like today only come once, maybe twice in a lifetime. Savor every moment. And it's all thanks to Wormy. I made this for Wormy. [puts a 'Best Friend' ribbon on Wormy] Our new best friend. [puts Wormy back in his jar] Until tomorrow, new best friend. Don't be sad, little buddy, we'll be back first thing in the morning for frolic and fun.

speaker: Patrick
line: Why must the sun set on this perfect day? Sleep well, Wormy. [Patrick cries as they both walk off]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Aw, don't be sad, Patrick. It's only until tomorrow.

speaker: [day turns into night. Ominous music plays as Wormy makes a cocoon and turns into a butterfly. Cut to dawn when SpongeBob wakes up]
Here I come Wormy! [Patrick pokes his head out of SpongeBob's alarm clock]
Patrick
line: Me too! [both run off to Sandy's with their water helmets already on] And then we're gonna play tag and then we're gonna color and then we're gonna build a house of cards!

speaker: SpongeBob and Patrick
line: We're back, Wormy! Wormy, Wormy! [holds up the jar with the butterfly]

speaker: Patrick
line: Wormy? Where's Wormy? What's that thing?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: He's gotta be in here. [opens up the jar. The butterfly flies out onto SpongeBob's jar] I think something bad happened to Wormy. [the best friend ribbon is still in the jar]

speaker: Patrick
line: He left his "Best Friend" ribbon behind! [the butterfly flies onto SpongeBob's helmet. Cut to a close-up on butterfly. SpongeBob and Patrick scream and run behind a table]

speaker: Patrick
line: What is that thing?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: I don't know, Patrick. But whatever it is...it must've eaten Wormy!

speaker: Patrick
line: [In tears] Why does this keep happening to me?!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Quick, Patrick! We need to make a run for the door! [They start to run to the exit but the butterfly flies on the door] Noo! Patrick, he's blocking our only exit! [They begin to run backwards to the back of Sandy's tree]

speaker: Patrick
line: Now what? We're trapped in here with that...that--"Best Friend Eater."

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Let's not panic. We just have to stick together. Remember it's two against one. Right Patrick? Patrick? [He sees Patrick gone and the butterfly in flying at him and screams] He's eaten Patrick! [He runs away and jumps in a barrel and we Patrick in it] Patrick, you're alive!

speaker: Patrick
line: I am?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Patrick, we can't leave this horrible monster in Sandy's house. It might eat Sandy's other pets!

speaker: Patrick
line: Or worse, it might eat Sandy's pets.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: No it might eat Sandy! We go to get it out of here!

speaker: [We see SpongeBob and Patrick hiding behind a Sandy's table and Sandy's phone in a jar to trap the butterfly and the phone begins to ring]
Patrick
line: It's for you! [The butterfly begins to fly by the jar]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: It's working. He's gonna answer it... [But instead the butterfly just flew pass the jar and the lid closes]

speaker: Patrick
line: Tartar sauce.

speaker: [Then we see Patrick on a plate with an apple in his mouth]
SpongeBob
line: You look pretty appetizing Patrick. Now just stay here and wait for the monster. I'll go get the net. [He walks off and the butterfly begins to fly by and land on Patrick's butt which makes Patrick feel scared]

speaker: Patrick
line: [Whimpering, spitting out the apple] SpongeBob! Hurry up with that net!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Hold on Patrick. [He searches through Sandy's trunk for the net.]

speaker: Patrick
line: I really don't taste that good, Mr. Monster. [Wormy crawls down Patrick's helmet. Patrick sees the butterfly close-up and runs off. SpongeBob runs by with the net]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: I'm coming, Patrick! [Patrick goes right through the net, tearing it up, and crashing into a tree. SpongeBob sees his broken net as Wormy corners him] No, Mr. Monster, please don't eat me! No, no, no! Spare me, I don't taste good, no! No, no, please! Wait a second. [takes out a bottle of bubbles and blows one to get Wormy stuck in one] Yeah! [Wormy flies out of the treedome, still in the bubble. Patrick shuts the door behind Wormy] We did it, Patrick! Sandy's gonna be so proud of us. We got that horrible monster out of her house and best of all her pets are safe. 'Cause that horrible creature is now...[Wormy flies to the Krusty Krab]...heading straight for the Krusty Krab! [both run off] It's going in the front! Let's use the secret entrance. [both go inside a rock and then appear inside the Krusty Krab in another rock. They gasp as Wormy flies toward Squidward and Mr. Krabs, who are taking pictures]

speaker: Squidward
line: Okay hold still.

speaker: Patrick
line: He's gonna eat Squidward and Mr. Krabs! [both jump at them]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Hit the deck, Mr. Krabs!

speaker: Squidward
line: Say "money."

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: "Money!" [Squidward takes the picture. It reveals SpongeBob and Patrick jumping on top of Mr. Krabs]

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: What's the meaning of this, SpongeBob?!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: We're in serious danger. There's a-a-a...a monster out there.

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Is he a paying customer?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Oh no, Mr. Krabs. It doesn't want to eat Krabby Patties. It wants to eat YOU!

speaker: Patrick
line: [crying] Just like it ate Wormy!

speaker: Squidward
line: Um, Wormy? [SpongeBob and Patrick cry]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Why? Why? He was so young.

speaker: Patrick
line: I'll never forget you, Wormy.

speaker: Squidward
line: Well, if Moron Theater's over, I'm just going to take a look at this monster. [Wormy flies in a bubble] That's the monster?

speaker: Patrick
line: Pretty scary, huh?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: A living nightmare!

speaker: Squidward
line: I should have known. [walks away] Well, that's it. I'm getting off the Looney Express.

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Now just 'cause you swabs haven't seen a creature like this doesn't mean it's dangerous.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: We tried to warn them. I can't watch. [pushes his eyes into his head]

speaker: Squidward
line: Get a load of the scary monster. [laughs] Monster.

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Aw, it looks harmless.

speaker: Squidward
line: It's kinda cute.

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: It reminds me of money.

speaker: Squidward
line: Monster. [both laugh until they see the butterfly up-close and personal. Their teeth and eyes fall out and they both run away]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Squidward?

speaker: Patrick
line: Mr. Krabs? [SpongeBob screams when he sees their underwear and hat only]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [screams] It ate them! And there it goes! [Wormy flies out of the Krusty Krab] First Wormy, then Squidward, Mr. Krabs! [has three finger puppets for each person] That flying monster has eaten three friends too many. We must warn the citizens! Evil has surfaced. The fate of Bikini Bottom is in our hands, Patrick. Now let's roll.

speaker: Patrick
line: Aye-aye, captain. [pushes a lever to make the boat sail out of the Krusty Krab. Cut to SpongeBob and Patrick on the streets]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Okay, Patrick, now this is a very delicate situation. It must be treated with great care and sensitivity.

speaker: Patrick
line: Gotcha.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Run, everybody, run!

speaker: Patrick
line: Monster on the loose!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Monster! [everyone runs away screaming. SpongeBob and Patrick give each other a thumbs up. Cut to SpongeBob and Patrick putting up a sign of the butterfly saying "Beware" when a crowd of citizens runs by screaming. Wormy flies by and SpongeBob and Patrick hide in the bucket of glue and bounce off. Cut to SpongeBob inflating a balloon but then inhales the air in the balloon so he can float in the sky]

speaker: Patrick
line: [using a megaphone] Attention, Bikini Bottom! There's a flying monster that's going to eat you! [everyone screams and runs away. Cut to SpongeBob waving his arms and pointing at Wormy flying by. The whole town is on fire]

speaker: Realistic Fish Head
line: Attention, attention! This just in! [TV shows a real butterfly] A giant monster is attacking Bikini Bottom. [a man watching the announcement swallows his eyes and has them appear in his mouth when he screams. He runs through the wall]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: We did it Patrick! We saved the city. [In the background, an explosion went off] Just think what might of happened if we didn't tell everyone about the monster.

speaker: Patrick
line: About the what? [just then, Wormy flies by. SpongeBob, Patrick, and everyone else runs away from Wormy but they still being chased all over town by the butterfly no matter where they go. Cut to black, then, a bus drops off Sandy]

speaker: Sandy
line: Shoot! Looks like a twister hit this place. Where is everybody? [Wormy flies by] Oh, hey there Wormy. [puts him in a jar] You weren't supposed to change till I got back. That oughta hold ya, little guy. [everyone runs up to Sandy] Howdy, SpongeBob.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Sandy caught the monster! [everyone cheers and picks up SpongeBob and Sandy and bring them into town]

speaker: Sandy
line: I didn't know I'd be missed so much. Golly, maybe I should go out of town more often.

speaker: [Episode starts with the Krusty Krab. We see inside, it is dirty and covered in cobwebs. Squidward is seen covered in dust and cobwebs. He blows himself the dust and webs off and the register. SpongeBob dusts off a cobweb on on of the tables with a feather duster. A spider comes down and makes a new web. SpongeBob dusts it off, but the spider comes back and makes another one. Mr. Krabs is seen covered in dust against the wall. He sneezes the dust off.]
Mr. Krabs
line: Ah-ah-achoo! [sighs] 36 days without a customer.

speaker: Dave
line: So...hungry...

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Ah! Mr. Krabs, a customer!

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Ah!

speaker: [Krabs squeals in delight, revealing a spider web growing in his mouth. A spider crawls all over it]
Dave
line: No food... 3 days...

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Hold on, me bucko! Food's on the way! [He is about to call into the kitchen, but then has a second thought] Uhh... You got money, right?

speaker: Dave
line: Yeah...

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: SpongeBob! Bring this guy some grub before he keels over!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Here you go, sir.

speaker: Dave
line: Oh. Krabby Patties, huh?

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Finest under the sea!

speaker: Dave
line: Yeah, yeah, sure. But where's the pizzazz?

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Huh?

speaker: Dave
line: Look at this place. I mean, what is the theme here? Underwater? It's boring! [He turns and crawls away] Food! Water! Atmosphere!

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: No one goes to a restaurant for atmosphere. They go for food!

speaker: [He looks out the door as Fred and Tom see each other on the street]
Fred
line: Hey, Tom!

speaker: Tom
line: Fred! Hey, you wanna eat at the Krusty Krab?

speaker: Fred
line: Nah, I'm going to the Shell Shack. They've got a talking dog!

speaker: Tom
line: Great! Say, what's a dog?

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: [Gasps] Money walking! I need to think up a gimmick like that to bring customers back in here!

speaker: [SpongeBob peek through Mr. Krabs' eye stalks]
SpongeBob
line: I have an idea! [Mr. Krabs' eye stalks pull back together, chopping SpongeBob in half]

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Wait! I've got an idea! [Cut to outside the Krusty Krab, where a marching band plays, and a crowd gathers around Mr. Krabs] ...And so ladies and gentlemen, be sure to buy plenty of Krabby Patties as I bury myself alive! [Everyone cheers and confetti shoots up from the ground as Mr. Krabs wields a shovel. He digs a hole, and then hops into it] No free refills. [scene cuts. Then, he pats the dirt in around him, leaving himself underground with no trace of him. Fred runs up to on top of where Krabs was buried]

speaker: Fred
line: Hey, everyone, listen! The talking dog at the Shell Shack is singing! Come on!

speaker: [He motions for everyone to follow, and they do, leaving Mr. Krabs alone, under the ground. Cut to the inside of the Krusty Krab, where it has been cleaned out]
SpongeBob
line: Mr. Krabs, I have an idea!

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: What am I going to do? If I don't think of an idea, I'll go out of business!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Mr. Krabs, I have an idea!

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Why can't someone give me an idea?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Mr. Krabs, I have an idea!

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Great Neptune in Heaven, I need an idea!

speaker: [A divine light hits Krabs, and SpongeBob comes down, playing the harp and dressed like a angel]
SpongeBob
line: [sings] Mr. Krabs, I have an idea!

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: What in the name of money are you waiting for, boy? Tell me!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: OK. Prepare yourself, Mr. Krabs. Don't bother sitting down, Mr. Krabs, because you'll just stand up when you see this! [makes a Pretty Patty] Ta-da!

speaker: [Shows Mr. Krabs a green Krabby Patty]
Mr. Krabs
line: Great Barrier Reef! That patty's spoiled!

speaker: [He knocks it off of the plate and onto the ground, where he burns it with a flame thrower. Once the fire is gone, SpongeBob appears in a fire-retardant suit and laughs]
SpongeBob
line: Mr. Krabs, it's not tainted meat. It's painted meat! [Fire once again overcomes him, and he emerges in regular clothing, with an artist's pallet in hand. On the palette, Krabby Patties lie in different colors] Pretty Patties! Available in 6 designer colors.

speaker: [Mr. Krabs laughs, and SpongeBob looks broken-heartedly at his own creation]
Mr. Krabs
line: Mr. Squidward! Come look!

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Don't that look appetizing?

speaker: Squidward
line: Mmm, mmm! Good, sir!

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Wait! Gimme an orange patty... with extra purple!

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: What's next? Sequin milkshakes?

speaker: [Holds up a milkshake cup with sequins and encrusted into it]
Squidward
line: Bow-tie French fries?

speaker: [He holds up a French fry with a bow-tie on]
SpongeBob
line: [Welding with tears] No...

speaker: Squidward
line: Pretty Patties, Pretty Patties!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [Crying] Stop it! [SpongeBob becomes indignant] I know this is a good idea. I'll show you! I'll... I'll... I'll open my own restaurant! [He runs out of the Krusty Krab] You'll see!

speaker: [Squidward and Mr. Krabs look at each other. Then, they continue laughing. Cut to Conch Street, where SpongeBob passes his and Squidward's house to get to Patrick's house]
SpongeBob
line: Hey, Patrick, are you angry, too?

speaker: Patrick
line: Yeah.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: What's the matter?

speaker: Patrick
line: I can't see my forehead. What's your problem?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: I have a good idea, and no one else thinks so!

speaker: Patrick
line: Me too. [He pulls a cord on his own Hawaiian shorts, causing them to inflate and lift into the air a few feet. Patrick is now upside-down] Inflatable pants! What's your idea?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: I'm gonna open up a restaurant and sell Pretty Patties!

speaker: Patrick
line: Forget my dumb idea, that's great!

speaker: [Cut to later, where SpongeBob has constructed a purple stand that says "Pretty Patties". Patrick is behind a second one to the left of SpongeBob that is brown and says "Pay Here"]
SpongeBob
line: Are you ready for the big rush, Patrick? [Patrick pulls up his purple-and-green trunks and gives SpongeBob the thumbs-up] Pretty soon those hungry customers will be lining up, because we are open! [He puts up an "Open" sign. Cut to him at the stand] I'm ready! [We see him as an adult with the same camera angling. He has glasses on, and brown hair] I'm ready. [We see him as an old man with a long, gray beard. His pineapple wilts and dies] I'm ready... [We see his gravestone behind the stand, that says "R.I.P. I'M READY". There is a vacant spot where his pineapple previously was. SpongeBob wakes up at the stand and sees that that was a dream] Patrick, how long have we been standing here?

speaker: Patrick
line: [He looks at the sloppily-drawn crayon marks on his wrist made to look like a watch] Awww! I gotta draw a new battery for this.

speaker: [He scribbles on his wrist with a blue crayon]
SpongeBob
line: What if Mr. Krabs was right? Maybe my idea is dumb.

speaker: Patrick
line: SpongeBob, sometimes we have to go deep inside ourselves to solve our problems.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: I'm scared.

speaker: Patrick
line: Then I'm going in for you!

speaker: [He climbs into SpongeBob's head through one of his pores. Then, SpongeBob blows up like a puffer fish]
Patrick
line: Sorry. Stupid inflatable pants!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Did you find anything?

speaker: Patrick
line: Huh?

speaker: Harold
line: Hey, do you sell food here?

speaker: [He is creeped out as SpongeBob and Patrick giggle]
SpongeBob
line: Yes, sir! We sell Pretty Patties!

speaker: [He holds out a green Pretty Patty]
Harold
line: That thing's green! [He starts laughing hysterically] Green!

speaker: [He laughs more. Patrick joins in, but doesn't laugh hard at all.]
Patrick
line: Green. [SpongeBob cries]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Mr. Krabs was right! What am I going to do with all these?

speaker: [He holds out the palette of Pretty Patties]
Harold
line: [Stops laughing] Hey, is that one purple? Purple is my favorite color! [He tries it] This ain't half bad! Hey, world! "Pretty Patties" is the best idea ever!

speaker: [Cut to Mr. Krabs in his office, eating popcorn and watching a movie, crying. A spider dangling from its web cries as well]
Rick's Wife
line: [On TV] Oh, Rick, how could you? Together we were one!

speaker: Rick
line: [On TV] That was before. But now, I'm splitting us up.

speaker: [Onscreen, we see an amoeba split into two amoebas. All of a sudden, it turns to a Bikini Bottom News emergency broadcast. Johnny talks at a desk. Behind him is a bamboo screen showing a crowd of Bikini Bottom citizens cheering]
Johnny
line: We interrupt this program to bring you a special news announcement! This wild crowd behind me is screaming for Bikini Bottom's latest culinary sensation. Let's take a listen.

speaker: All
line: [Chanting] Pretty Patties! Pretty Patties!

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Pretty Patties? [The spider comes down and steal Mr. Krabs' popcorn]

speaker: Johnny
line: It's easy to see Pretty Patties are popular, but what is it about them that drives Bikini Bottom feeders wild?

speaker: Millie, Sadie [has hair], and Evelyn
line: They match our purses!

speaker: Scottish Man
line: [With Scottish accent, kilt, and bagpipe] They remind me of home.

speaker: [He holds up a plaid Pretty Patty, and Larry the Lobster runs up]
Larry
line: Pretty Patties rule!

speaker: Johnny
line: Mr. SquarePants, how do you explain all this success?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Uhhh... I don't know.

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: How can you make money with such a stupid idea?

speaker: Johnny
line: And how can you not make money with such a brilliant idea?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [laughs] At first we didn't know what to do with all the money. We tried burying it...

speaker: SpongeBob
line: ...shredding it...

speaker: SpongeBob
line: ...and burning it!

speaker: [Mr. Krabs's eyestalks burst and fly around like a balloon with a hole in it as he screams]
SpongeBob
line: But in the end, we decided just to give it all away.

speaker: [We see Patrick at this stand that now has a bamboo "$" and says "FREE MONEY". He hands a filled paper sack to Nathiel]
Patrick
line: Come again, sir!

speaker: Nathiel
line: I'm getting back in line!

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: I don't believe it!

speaker: [He runs out of the office and across the dining area]
Mr. Krabs
line: I've got to see this for me self!

speaker: [He runs out the door and into Sandals]
Sandals
line: Hey! Watch it, buddy. I don't care how much you want your Pretty Patty. You're gonna have to wait in line like the rest of us.

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: I've never had a line.

speaker: [At SpongeBob's stand, the "Now Serving" sign flips to 46,853]
[There is an excited roar from the crowd. Mr. Krabs makes his way to the front of the line]
Mr. Krabs
line: I never had 46,853 customers.

speaker: [SpongeBob hands a patty to Unknown Anchovy]
SpongeBob
line: Here you are, sir. Stay pretty. [laughing] All right. Mr. Krabs is that you? Isn't this great, Mr. Krabs? The Pretty Patties are a big hit!

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: They sure are, boy. You're doing pretty well for yourself. I guess you've completely forgotten the Krusty Krab.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: No, sir, I haven't. Sometimes I really miss the old days back at the Krusty Krab.

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: I bet you miss Squidward... and the grill. And the crow's nest.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Yeah. Yeah! But do you know what I miss the most, Mr. Krabs? That tiny squeaking sound you get when you rub two pickles together. You know what I mean, Mr. Krabs?

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Uhh... Yes. Yes, I do, lad. Well, the Krusty Krab's only a short walk away. Why don't you head on down. For old time's sake.

speaker: [He takes SpongeBob by the hand and starts to walk away, but SpongeBob's arm expands and he just stays in the same place]
SpongeBob
line: Oh, I can't leave, Mr. Krabs. What about the stand?

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Don't worry, lad. I'll watch the stand for ye. [SpongeBob retracts his arm]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: You will?

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: No! I've got a better idea! I'll take this old roadside stand off your hands. For keeps. An in exchange, I'll give you the Krusty Krab. With Squidward, the grill, and all those squeaky pickles!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [In a trance] What did you say, Mr. Krabs?

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Here's the key to the Krusty Krab. She's yours now.

speaker: [He hands him a key, composed of two golden "K"'s and a ring]
SpongeBob
line: Thank you. What should I do now, Mr. Krabs?

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Run to her, boy. She's waiting for ya.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: I can't feel my legs, Mr. Krabs.

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Don't worry, boy! I'll fix it! Get this to the Krusty Krab on the double! Good luck, lad!

speaker: [He tosses SpongeBob to the crowd, who holds him above their hands and passes him down. While crowd-surfing, SpongeBob's surroundings turn into a pink sky with clouds]
SpongeBob
line: Dreams do come true!

speaker: [The crowd throws him on the ground in front of the Krusty Krab, where he floats up and kisses the building. We see him cheer in the dining area, kiss the floor, throw buns up into the air in the kitchen, laugh over the phone in Mr. Krabs' office, and stand at the ordering boat, the whole Krusty Krab cleaned and refreshed. Cut back to the Pretty Patties stand, where Mr. Krabs holds up a patty]
Mr. Krabs
line: Ladies and gentlemen! "Pretty Patties" is now under new management! Who's next?

speaker: [He waves a patty in the air. We see a sea-level shot of the Bikini Atoll Island. It turns from night to dawn. Cut to Mr. Krabs at the stand beside SpongeBob's house. The "Free Money" stand has been disassembled]
Mr. Krabs
line: I'm ready! I'm ready! For me money. [A crowd gathers around him] Welcome to Pretty Patties! May I take your money?

speaker: Franco
line: We want a refund, Krabs!

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Wha-!?! Who? What?

speaker: Bill
line: Your dumb Pretty Patties turned my face purple!

speaker: Scottish Man
line: Look what I got under me kilt!

speaker: [He raises his kilt to reveal a plaid body, and white underwear.]
Clay, John, and Frank
line: And look at our tongues!

speaker: [We see a yellow tongue, a speckled tongue, and a pink tongue. Krabs refers to Frank's]
Mr. Krabs
line: What's wrong with you?

speaker: [Frank turns off a light to reveal his tongue is glow-in-the-dark, and is pulsing green]
Frank
line: We want our money back. All 46,853 of us.

speaker: [He turns the light back on, but Krabs is nowhere to be seen]
Harold
line: Hey, where'd he go?

speaker: [Cut to Krabs running away, and the crowd chasing them, a rainbow trailing behind them. Mr. Krabs slams into the Krusty Krab door, but it is locked, so he searches for his key]
Mr. Krabs
line: My key! Where's my key? [Recalls he gave it to SpongeBob, and presses himself against the door to get SpongeBob's attention]SpongeBob! Let me in! SpongeBob! Let me in! SpongeBob!

speaker: [SpongeBob is in the dining area, and cannot hear due to his pickle-squeaking. Krabs is chased left and right by the mob, still yelling. It uses like this Squeak!. Squeak!. Squeak!. crowd muttering angrily]
Mr. Krabs
line: [screams] SpongeBob, let me in! SpongeBob!

speaker: [SpongeBob is standing on a hill looking at his grandma's house]
SpongeBob
line: There it is! Grandma's house! What wonders await me today? Fresh-baked cookies? Story time? A sweater with love in every stitch? Aw, what am I waiting for? [runs down the hill] Grandma, Grandma, Grandma!

speaker: Grandma
line: SpongeBob!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Hi, Grandma! [hugs her as the two walk into the kitchen]

speaker: Grandma
line: Come in and sit for a while. [gives SpongeBob a plate of cookies] Have a cookie, SpongeBob!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Grandma, you make the best cookies in the deep blue sea. [grabs a cookie and dips it in a glass of  milk] Oh yeah... [eats it. His eyes turn into cookies] Grandma's cookies...

speaker: Grandma
line: Now, who wants to lick the spoon? [SpongeBob raises his hand]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Me, me, me! [cut to Grandma telling SpongeBob a story while he licks the spoon]

speaker: Grandma
line: ...and then we drove all the way home with all the windows down in the freezing cold.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Tell me another story about when I was a baby. [cuckoo clock strikes three. SpongeBob gasps] Three o'clock? I'm gonna be late for work!

speaker: Grandma
line: Hop in my car, I'll drop you off. [cut to Grandma driving up to the Krusty Krab]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Thanks, Grandma! [hops out of the car]

speaker: Grandma
line: SpongeBob, you forgot your kissy-kissy! [SpongeBob turns around and heads back to Grandma. Squidward is watching from the window]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: I sure did. [Grandma gives him a kiss, leaving a pink print on his forehead of her lips] Bye, Grandma, thanks for the ride. [Squidward opens the door for SpongeBob] Thank you, Squidward. [walks inside while whistling to some laughing from everyone] Isn't this great? Everybody's in a good mood today.

speaker: Squidward
line: I love bursting your bubble, SpongeBob, but they're laughing at you, not with you.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Did I do something funny?

speaker: Squidward
line: Your forehead. [points to the kiss]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: My forehead is funny?

speaker: Charlie
line: Hey, hey, Grandma's boy? Kissy-kissy-kissy! [everyone laughs]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: No, you're wrong! There's nothing wrong with getting kisses from your grandma.

speaker: Charlie
line: No, especially if you're a big baby who wears diapers! [everyone laughs] And sucks his thumb, and plays with dolls, and, um... [soon, everyone stops laughing] ...wears pajamas with feet in 'em, and carries his, um... blankie around, and...

speaker: Customers
line: All right already!

speaker: Squidward
line: Cheer up, SpongeBob. I know someone who still likes you.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Really? You do, Squidward?

speaker: Squidward
line: Yeah, your grandma! [everyone laughs. SpongeBob tries getting the kiss off with his hand and a mop but nothing seems to work. Everyone is still laughing at him]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Stop it...! [everyone stops] I have been publicly humiliated for the last time! [runs home crying. Fade to SpongeBob's house]

speaker: Patrick
line: I'm sorry that happened to you, SpongeBob.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Me, too.

speaker: Patrick
line: You're the most adult person I know.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Thanks, Patrick.

speaker: Patrick
line: You know how grandmas are, they love babies. You just can't act like a baby around her.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: You're right, Patrick.

speaker: Patrick
line: Have I ever not been right? [cut to a picture of SpongeBob on a giant red firecracker, a picture of SpongeBob with a giant funnel in his mouth while Patrick holds a giant pumpkin, and a picture of SpongeBob and Patrick in black speedos while a wolf whistle is heard in the background] You're a man now, SpongeBob, and it's time you starting acting like one.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Yeah! Oh, but I'm not sure I know how.

speaker: Patrick
line: Allow me to demonstrate. First, puff out your chest. [SpongeBob obediently puffs out his chest] Now say "tax exemption."

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Tax exemption.

speaker: Patrick
line: Now, you must acquire a taste for free-form jazz. [jazz music plays] Okay, SpongeBob, you're ready! [cut to both walking up on the hill facing Grandma's house] This is it. What are you going to tell Grandma?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: I'm a grownup.

speaker: Patrick
line: No ifs, ands, or buts about it.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: A man's gotta do what a man's gotta do.

speaker: Patrick
line: And then you get behind her and I'll push.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Patrick, we didn't say that.

speaker: Patrick
line: Oh yeah, right.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: All we need now is the icing on the maturity cake. [takes out a suitcase] I've been growing these babies for years. [opens it to reveal sideburns. Both of them take a pair and put them on]

speaker: SpongeBob & Patrick
line: Sideburns. [SpongeBob knocks on Grandma's door]

speaker: Grandma
line: [opens door] Oh, hello, SpongeBob. What a nice surprise. Come here and give your Granny her kissy-kissy. [as she is about to kiss him, SpongeBob puts on a helmet to block it]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [removes his "Kisses Not Allowed" helmet off his head] Sorry, grandmother, but the kissing has to stop.

speaker: Patrick
line: Tell her like it is, SpongeBob, no more baby stuff.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: He is right, Grandmother. Kisses are for babies, which I am no longer. I have grown up. It is nature's way.

speaker: Grandma
line: Oh, you are absolutely right.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: I am? I mean, of course I am.

speaker: Grandma
line: You will definitely not be treated like a baby around here anymore ever again.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: I am glad you see it my way, grandmother. [puts on a hat]

speaker: Grandma
line: Well, I'm glad that's settled. [holds out a tray of cookies] But what am I going to do with all these fresh baked cookies?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [chuckles] Sorry, grandmother, we adults don't partake in the consumption of sweets, right, Pat... [notices Patrick isn't there] ...rick? [cut to Patrick sitting at the kitchen table]

speaker: Patrick
line: Keep 'em coming, Granny! [scarfs down the cookies as SpongeBob watches from a window]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: So much for no more baby stuff.

speaker: Grandma
line: And don't forget the cookie-eating hat! [puts a red hat with springs attached to yellow smiley faces on top of Patrick's head. They both laugh]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Hey, that's my cookie-eating hat! I mean it was when I was a baby.[growls in frustration] [knocks on the door. His Grandma opens it]

speaker: Grandma
line: Well, look who's here. It's my big old adult grandson.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Grandmother, I need to have a mature conversation with Mr. Patrick. [runs up to Patrick, who still eats his snack] [whispering loudly] Patrick, what do you think you're doing? Cookies? Warm milk? A bib? [points to it, which reads "I heart Grandma"] Is that a kissy mark on your forehead? We are supposed to be adults! [bangs on the table]

speaker: Grandma
line: Oh, oh, no roughhousing with a full tummy. [tickles Patrick] Who's the baby?

speaker: Patrick
line: I'm the baby, I'm the baby, I'm the baby! [SpongeBob clears his throat] Being grown up is boring. I love being a baby. Besides, I don't get jazz.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [chuckles] Poor Patrick. I almost feel sorry for you. [takes out a pipe and blows bubbles from it] Trapped in the awkward phase of diaper days... never to know the rich rewards of being a grownup. [Grandma comes back with more cookies]

speaker: Grandma
line: Here's a fresh batch of cookies.

speaker: Patrick
line: All right! [inhales them] Rewards, huh?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Well, yeah, there's, eh... [sees Patrick eating cookies with his mouth open] well, let's see, we... [a cookie rolls over to his side] We went over the jazz... [Patrick grabs the cookie and eats it]

speaker: Patrick
line: Oh, Grandma, I'm full. [Grandma sets down another plate of cookies]

speaker: Grandma
line: More cookies! [Patrick uses his mouth like a vacuum and eats all the cookies. One of the cookies rolls over by SpongeBob's side. He whistles for a brief second, then checks his wristwatch]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: It appears to be my lunch hour. Grownups have to eat to. I guess this will have to do. [Grandma takes the cookie away]

speaker: Grandma
line: Oh, you don't want this baby food. How about a big piece of steamed coral? [gives him the coral]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Oh yeah, uh... great. [takes a couple bites of it] Nutritious.

speaker: Grandma
line: Storytime! [Patrick runs to Grandma]

speaker: Patrick
line: Oh boy! Storytime, storytime, storytime!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Storytime? [Patrick is sitting on Grandma's lap, ready to hear a story]

speaker: Grandma
line: You'll enjoy this, Patrick. It's a wonderful story about a magical sea leprechaun. [SpongeBob walks in] Oh, SpongeBob, you wouldn't be interested in this baby book. [drops a giant book on the floor] Here's the technical manual on routine active maintenance.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Oh, uh... great. Yeah. [opens the book] Fascinating. No pictures, just the way I like it. [while eating a cookie, Patrick bites his finger leaving a big red bruise]

speaker: Patrick
line: [acting like a 2-year old] D'oh! My wittle finger! [sobs]

speaker: Grandma
line: Hold still, hold still. [kisses his finger] All better?

speaker: Patrick
line: [talking normally] Sorta.... [holds up his other finger] this finger hurts a little bit too. [Grandma kisses his other finger]

speaker: Grandma
line: How about I give you a present?

speaker: Patrick
line: Oh, boy, I hope it's cookies! [opens up the box to find a sweater but puts it on his head] Alright, another hat.

speaker: Grandma
line: No, Patrick, it's a sweater?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Huh?

speaker: Grandma
line: With love in every stitch.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: No... [imagines himself in the sweater instead of Patrick. The sweater tears in half] Don't I get a present, Grandma?

speaker: Grandma
line: Oh, I almost forgot. [hands him some office supplies] Here's some office supplies. I didn't wrap them. I knew you wouldn't mind. [cuckoo clock strikes three again] Uh-oh, three o'clock, time for adults to go to work. Bye-bye, SpongeBob.

speaker: [Patrick gets the sweater on] I'll bet you'd fancy a nap, huh, Patrick? [Patrick yawns] You still here, SpongeBob?
SpongeBob
line: Uh, I don't need to leave yet. I can be late for work.

speaker: Grandma
line: [puts a blanket over Patrick as he lays on the couch] No, no, no, that wouldn't be the adult thing to do.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Alright, I guess I'll be going. I've, uh, got a lot of adult-type business to take care of, so, uh, I'll see yah later.

speaker: Grandma
line: Okay, thanks for stopping by, SpongeBob.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Yep, that is it. Here I go.

speaker: Grandma
line: Come again if you get the chance. [SpongeBob opens the door]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Out into the cold, grown-up world alone without a sweater.

speaker: Grandma
line: Toodleloo.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: I don't know when I'll be back.

speaker: Grandma
line: I know how busy you are.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: So, uh... that's it. [Patrick is sleeping]

speaker: Grandma
line: Shh, he's asleep. [SpongeBob slowly closes the door]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Soo long... [closes the door but then opens it with sad eyes. His sideburns fall off of his head. He starts throwing a big tantrum] I don't wanna grow up! [holds up a giant chocolate chip cookie and snaps it in half in front of his face] I want cookies! [holds up a giant baby bottle with milk inside] and "milkie"! [wears a sweater] I want a sweater with love in the stitches! [runs around wearing a diaper with a blue pin on it as he's putting powder in the diaper] I wanna wear "diadies"! [rides in a wagon] I wanna ride in my wagon! [holds his giant teddy bear] I wanna cuddle-wuddle with Mister Stuffykins! [rides his old rocking horse with a sailor hat on and a lollipop] I wanna rocky-rock on my seahorsey! [holds up his bruised finger] And I want kissy-kissy on my boo-boo! [SpongeBob cries this instant as he falls on the floor in his front body, slamming his fists on the floor as if a kid was throwing a tantrum. He then rolls like a wheel. Grandma is shocked and sad for him. SpongeBob, sitting, sprays his tears in his mouth. Grandma thinks for a second. He ratchets like a lawn sprinkler, almost spinning around and sprays tears everywhere. He spins even faster and floods the whole house]

speaker: Grandma
line: Take it easy, SpongeBob. [picks up the still-crying SpongeBob] SpongeBob. SpongeBob! [SpongeBob starts gasping after each cry. Grandma holds his lips, stopping SpongeBob's crying] You don't have to be a baby to get ol' Grandma's love.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [sniffles as he starts to feel a bit better] I don't?

speaker: Grandma
line: Of course not. [pulls the plug under the tears to drain it] No matter how grown-up you get, you'll always be my little baby boo. [Grandma tickles SpongeBob, then kisses his forehead] And remember, you can kiss your grandma and still be an adult. [hands SpongeBob his sideburns and a chocolate chip cookie] Here you go. [SpongeBob puts on his sideburns and eats the cookie]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Thanks, Grandma. [bites the cookie] Uh, Grandma, could you not mention this to the guys down at the Krusty Krab?

speaker: Grandma
line: No problem. [she hugs SpongeBob. Outside, Squidward and everyone else are laughing]

speaker: [SpongeBob walks up to Patrick with a package in his hand]
SpongeBob
line: Patrick, look. I got my... [he notices Patrick has the same package. He unwraps his to show a reef blower. Patrick unwraps his to show a flower vase. SpongeBob laughs] I'm sorry, Patrick. [he wipes away a tear from his laugh.] It's just for a second I thought... [notices Patrick has the same reef blower as he does]

speaker: Patrick
line: Hey, you got the same reef blower as me! [Patrick blows at SpongeBob] Tag, you're it. [SpongeBob laughs. Both run around tagging each other. Patrick blows away a can while SpongeBob blows away a sand sculpture of himself. Patrick switches the blower to 'suck' and sucks off the lines of SpongeBob's pineapple]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Patrick, you made my house sparkling clean.

speaker: Patrick
line: Sure did.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: We haven't improved Squidward's day yet. Let's do his house! [Patrick sucks up the nose on Squidward's house and laughs] My turn. [SpongeBob sucks up one of the windows. Squidward opens up the other window]

speaker: Squidward
line: What is going on out here?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: We're playing with our new reef blowers!

speaker: Squidward
line: Playing with a reef blower? That is the most childish thing I have ever heard of.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: But it's fun!

speaker: Squidward
line: Fun?! How could playing with one of those over-sized hair dryers possibly be fun?

speaker: Patrick
line: Like this... [Patrick sucks the window up. Squidward pulls his nose out of the wall]

speaker: Squidward
line: [rubs his nose] Chafed. [opens his front door] Alright, that's...! [Patrick sucks up the door]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Let's do your house, Patrick.

speaker: Patrick
line: Yeah! [the two walk to Patrick's rock, and they see Squidward digging a hole up to the surface, seeing as how he couldn't exit his house any other way. He jumps out of it, fuming]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Squidward, you're steaming! You're like a steamed vegetable, only smarter.

speaker: Squidward
line: Put my windows back!

speaker: Squidward
line: SpongeBob, this is the final straw. I am going to move so far away, that I will be able to brag about it. I would- [he is hit on the head with a rock] I would rather tear out my brain stem, carry it into the middle of the nearest four-way intersection, and skip rope with it, than go on living where I do now. [the TV falls to the ground and turns on. On the television is an octopus, who looks like Squidward, but with a hair piece. He is in a suit and stands in front of a rainbow]

speaker: TV Octopus
line: Hi there! Is this the final straw? Do you want to move so far away, that you can brag about it. Would you rather tear out your brain stem, walk out into the middle of the nearest three-way-

speaker: Squidward
line: Four-way!

speaker: TV Octopus
