[Gary stops right next to some mud] Do not go near that mud puddle! Gary, the snail, do you hear me? I am giving you three seconds to get away from that mud puddle. One, [Gary moves closer to the mud] two, [Gary moves closer to the mud] two and a half...[Gary leans over the mud] don't make me say three! [Gary leans further over the mud] Gary! Gary! Gary! GARY! [SpongeBob falls out of the tree and into the mud] I'm a dirty boy.

speaker: Gary
line: Meow.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Yeah, yeah, Gary. I'm getting behind my ears. [Gary grins]

speaker: [The Krusty Krab at night. The lights are still on]
Mr. Krabs
line: Come on SpongeBob, it's quittin' time. [the lights turn off and Mr. Krabs and SpongeBob walk out] I've got a card game tonight. [he locks the doors]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Who're you playing cards with, Mr. Krabs? [we see the Chum Bucket across the street, with its lights still on]

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: I'm going over to the Chum Bucket to play with Plankton. [SpongeBob gasps]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [Gasps] Plankton! [a thought bubble appears over SpongeBob's head with Plankton inside] But Mr. Krabs, he's your arch-enemy. [he picks up a Krabby Patty] He's been trying to steal the Krabby Patty formula for years. [the Plankton in the thought bubble sees the Krabby Patty and goes to get it, but SpongeBob swats him with a fly swatter]

speaker: Plankton
line: Ouch. [the thought bubble disappears]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Why would you play cards with him?

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Between you and me, Plankton is the worst card player in Bikini Bottom! [cut to him and Plankton holding cards and a giant stack of money on the table] Why, I've been taking him to the cleaners every Thursday night for fifteen years! [Mr. Krabs puts his cards down on the table and rakes in his money with his claws. Back to the present, Mr. Krabs' eyes have turned to dollar signs] I never lose! [the two start laughing and walk off their separate ways. Cut to morning where Mr. Krabs walks to work crying, and SpongeBob walks in laughing]

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: [Sobbing]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Taking him to the cleaners, that a hot one! [Mr. Krabs leans against the Krusty Krab doors] How'd the card game go last night, Mr. Krabs?

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: I lost.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Barnacles, Mr. Krabs. How much money did you lose?

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: I didn't lose any money. [he sheds away a tear] I lost...

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Don't tell me you lost the Krusty Krab!

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: I lost... [SpongeBob grabs him]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Mr. Krabs, please tell me you didn't lose the Krabby Patty secret formula!

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: I lost... [he points to SpongeBob] you!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: What?

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: I bet your contract and I lost. [SpongeBob stares blankly, then laughs]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Good one, Mr. Krabs. Well, I got to go make those Krabby Patties. [he begins to walk to the door, but Mr. Krabs' claw stops him.] [after continually walking and getting nowhere, he falls to the floor]

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: I'm afraid you don't work here anymore. [Squidward runs out the door to the two]

speaker: Squidward
line: Please tell me this isn't a joke.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Go on, Mr. Krabs. Tell him. Tell him all about your cruel, sick joke. [Plankton walks over]

speaker: Plankton
line: As much as I love cruel, sick jokes, I'm afraid he's not joking. [he points at SpongeBob] You work for me now, SpongeBob! [he whips out a bucket with the initials "CB" on it] Time to put on the official Chum Bucket bucket helmet. [Plankton jumps on SpongeBob's head, kicks off the Krusty Krew hat, and puts the bucket on his head. SpongeBob screams and runs to Mr. Krabs, knocking Plankton and the bucket off]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: But Mr. Krabs! I don't want to work for him! [he tugs at Krabs' shirt collar] I want to work for you here at the Krusty Krab! [he and Krabs start crying loudly and hug]

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: I'm sorry, boy! It's all my fault!

speaker: Plankton
line: [pretending to sound genuinely sad] What kind of cold, heartless person would break apart such a loving relationship? [whips out a crowbar] I would! [he jumps up and uses the crowbar to pry SpongeBob off Krabs. SpongeBob goes flying with Mr. Krabs' arms still clung to him]

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: SpongeBob!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Mr. Krabs! [he slams into a cage and Krabs' arms fly off him. Plankton walks over and shuts the door]

speaker: Plankton
line: This is your greatest blunder, Krabs! For 15 years, I've been throwing those card games just waiting for you to slip up! I may not have the precious Krabby Patty formula but I've got the next best thing the guy who makes 'em! [a propeller emerges from the cage] I'm gonna run you out of business, Krabs. [the propeller spins and pilots SpongeBob into the Chum Bucket]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Mr. Krabs!

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: SpongeBob! [he cries] Can I have my arms back? [Plankton walks over and throws the arms on Krabs' head. Cut to the cage hovering over a spotlight and dropping SpongeBob into it]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: What is this place? [the lights turn on and screens with wires and gizmos start starting up. Sponge gasps. A giant boiler turns on. SpongeBob yelps. A light turns on and a calendar entitled "Science!" appears and the photo of the month is some nerd in front of a blackboard. Sponge screams. Plankton bursts open the doors]

speaker: Plankton
line: Ok, I'm ready for my Krabby Patty! [he walks over to SpongeBob]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Actually, uh, Mr. Plankton, sir, I haven't, uh...

speaker: Plankton
line: Perhaps you don't understand. You work for me now [he jumps onto SpongeBob's knee] and as your new boss, I command you to make me a patty this instant, or I'll be forced to remove your brain and implant it in my robot chef! [we see a giant robot that bares a slight resemblance to SpongeBob] So get cooking. [he twangs SpongeBob's nose. Later, SpongeBob is in front of a weird looking grill. He picks up a spatula with a spring end. He puts his fingers to one of the holes in the grill and steam bursts from it. SpongeBob screams. He looks at a digital sign reading "KITCHEN"]

speaker: Plankton
line: What is he doing? All these tears... and the showtunes... Why isn't he making the patties? Forget it. I'm going with plan B, I'll put his brain in the robot chef.

speaker: Karen
line: You know that never works! The answer is obvious to get to the SpongeBob, you must show him compassion and understanding, then he'll give you what you want.

speaker: Plankton
line: Will you be quiet? I'm thinking! I've got it! To get to the SpongeBob, I'll show him compassion and understanding, then he'll give me what I want.

speaker: [We see SpongeBob struggling to make a Krabby Patty with one of Plankton's cooking machines]
SpongeBob
line: [Sound of surprise]

speaker: Plankton
line: Hi!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: I'm sorry Plankton, I've tried my best. I'm not used to cooking this way! Please don't take my brain out!

speaker: Plankton
line: Hold it, SpongeBob, I'm capable of compassion and understanding.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Really?! Then I would like to go back to the Krusty Krab.

speaker: Plankton
line: Let's not get carried away. Now what can I do to make you more comfortable here at the Chum Bucket?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Well, I usually cook on a grill.

speaker: Plankton
line: You got it! [Plankton brings a grill into the Chum Bucket] Well it wasn't easy, but here it is! One old frying grill. How about we try it out?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [gasps] Uh, it's just that I'm used to the grill facing that way.

speaker: Plankton
line: Say no more, I'll take care of everything. [Plankton pushes the grill] How about here?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: A little more to the left.

speaker: Plankton
line: How's this, SpongeBob?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Move it over a little more.

speaker: Plankton
line: Here?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Keep going.

speaker: Plankton
line: Here?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Almost! That's it, just a little more...perfect! Right there! I don't know, it still doesn't feel right. [Plankton gasps]

speaker: Plankton
line: [cut to a blindfolded SpongeBob] Just a few more steps, SpongeBob. Ok, go ahead, take it off! [he removes the blindfold] It's an exact replica of the Krusty Krab kitchen!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: It is an exact replica! Here's the sink, the greasy fryers, the squeaky floorboards, and that thing! One Krabby Patty coming up, Mr. Krabs! [his face turns sad. wailing] Oh...Mr. Krabs!

speaker: Plankton
line: Don't cry, SpongeBob! I'll show you it's much better working for me! Is there anything that old skinflint Krabs wouldn't let you have?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Well...there is one thing I've always wanted... [cut to SpongeBob with some fancy vibrating shoes on] Wow!

speaker: Plankton
line: So now do you have everything you need to make some Krabby Patties?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Well... [cut to SpongeBob in a bubble bath, licking green mint ice cream]

speaker: Plankton
line: You ready to make some patties?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Wait till I finish my ice cream! [cut to SpongeBob riding a toy car, with Plankton pushing him]

speaker: Plankton
line: [while pushing him] How about those patties?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Faster! Faster! [cut to Plankton reading to SpongeBob a baby book]

speaker: Plankton
line: And then the littlest sea-elf said... [drool drops on Plankton. SpongeBob is sleeping. He wakes up] Huh? Steady, Plankton! It's all gonna pay off soon enough. Hey there, sleepy head, what do you say?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: All this preparation is making me hungry.

speaker: Plankton
line: Me too. You know what would really hit the spot? Why don't you whip us up a couple of Krabby Patties?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Mmmm...I'm kind of in the mood for tacos.

speaker: Plankton
line: [laughs] Good one, SpongeBob. But really, why don't you go ahead and make us a patty?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [yawning] No, I don't really feel like it!

speaker: Plankton
line: But I don't understand. [SpongeBob drinks soda from a cup] You have the grill, and the spatula, and the comfy chair. [loses his cool as he exposes his hands with fumes rising out] I rubbed your putrid feet!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Tell you what, half-pint why don't you ask me later!

speaker: Plankton
line: [growls in fury] I command you to make me a patty this instant!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [crossing his arms in refusal] No!

speaker: Plankton
line: Don't back sass me!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [mocking Plankton] Do ba da ma!

speaker: Plankton
line: What!? [SpongeBob blows a raspberry as he moons at him] That's it, mister! You just lost your brain privileges. [cut to Plankton outside of a lab] Finished! SpongeBob, come in here! Or should I say RobotBob Sponge...Chef...Pants... [to the audience] I put the brain in the robot, you know. You shouldn't have been a spoiled brat. You see, I always get what I want, and I want you to make me a Krabby Patty!

speaker: Robot SpongeBob
line: [Beeping] Dee dee, doodle dee di do. Response Why don't you ask me later?

speaker: Plankton
line: [going mad] What? What!?

speaker: Robot SpongeBob
line: Get welded.

speaker: Plankton
line: [pressing the button on the control] Wait! I command you make me a Krabby Patty!

speaker: Robot SpongeBob
line: [reads comics and drinks oil] I don't wanna.

speaker: Plankton
line: [screams out of madness]

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: [cut to the Krusty Krab] Well, old girl, this looks like our final chapter. [holds up an "Out of Business" sign] Huh?

speaker: Plankton
line: [crying] I can't take anymore. You've gotta take that yellow nightmare back! It's not worth it. I'm better off stealing a Krabby Patty fair and square.

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Um...Well... [taking off the "Out of Business" sign off the doors] a deal's a deal, Plankton. He's your headache now.

speaker: Plankton
line: Oh, please, have mercy, Krabs! I'll do anything! I beg of you!

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: How 'bout... you give me fifty bucks, and I'll take him off your hands.

speaker: Plankton
line: It's a deal! I cheated anyway.

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Now, be gone with you, you puny pest! [Mr. Krabs throws Plankton back inside the Chum Bucket]

speaker: Plankton
line: Thank you! [a crashing sound is heard] Ouch.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: My brain and I are glad to be back, Mr. Krabs.

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Glad to have you back, lad. Now get to those patties! The lunch rush is a-comin'!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [Yawns] I don't feel like it! Why don't you ask me later, crabby? [Mr. Krabs stares at him] I mean...I'll work all day for free! My treat! [runs to the kitchen]

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: That's what I thought you said.

speaker: French Narrator
line: Well, well, what is this? Ah, the artist at sea. Let us watch and see the fruits of his struggle. Ah, it seems that inspiration has struck.

speaker: Artist
line: Hmm... ah! [draws some strokes. he hums something. however, he throws his pencil into the sea] My pencil! What?

speaker: French Narrator
line: The artist has learned the first lesson of the sea Always bring a spare pencil.

speaker: Artist
line: Nooo! [with loudly sound. cut to the pencil dropping into the water. cut to SpongeBob and Patrick playing "Rock, Paper, Scissors" with bubbles]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: OK. Ready, Patrick? One...

speaker: Patrick
line: Two...

speaker: Both
line: Three!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Scissors beats paper, Patrick! [laughs] One...

speaker: Both
line: two...

speaker: SpongeBob
line: three! Patrick, how come you always do paper? [the pencil drops and the two scream]

speaker: Patrick
line: What is that thing SpongeBob?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: It looks like a giant pencil.

speaker: Patrick
line: Go touch it.

speaker: [SpongeBob extends his arm and touches the pencil]
SpongeBob
line: It is a giant pencil, Patrick! [SpongeBob grabs the pencil] Let's draw some giant pictures with it.

speaker: Patrick
line: Whatcha drawin'?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Stand back, Patrick! I can't draw with you breathing down my neck!

speaker: Patrick
line: Psh, artists.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: It's a jellyfish.

speaker: Patrick
line: Pretty good, SpongeBob! But it's lacking basic construction, and your perspective leaves a lot to be desired.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Eh, everybody's a critic.

speaker: Patrick
line: SpongeBob, your drawing's coming to life!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Now that's more like it, Mr. Critic!

speaker: Patrick
line: No, I mean it's swimming away!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Do you know what this means, Patrick?

speaker: Patrick
line: Your art can never hang in a museum.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: It means we found a magic pencil!

speaker: Patrick
line: Now all I need is a magic mustache and all my dreams will have come true.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [laughs] Coming right up! [draws mustache on Patrick]

speaker: Patrick
line: Life is good! [the mustache floats away] Easy come, easy go!

speaker: Squidward
line: Squidward, if you had some hair, you'd be the most gorgeous creature in the sea! You've got looks... talent... all you need is a full head of... [the mustache goes on his head] hair!

speaker: Patrick
line: My turn!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Be careful, Patrick! Being an artist is a heavy responsibility. Each work of art is like a child and must be treated as such.

speaker: Patrick
line: Come on! I was just gonna draw a cartoon.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Okay! Why didn't you say so? Hey! Another jellyfish!

speaker: Patrick
line: It's Squidward, silly!

speaker: [The badly drawn Squidward comes to life]
SpongeBob
line: It's kind of creepy looking when it moves.

speaker: Patrick
line: You're right, SpongeBob.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: We can't let it go into town! [Patrick erases it]

speaker: Patrick
line: Poor Squidward.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Hey! My brain just hatched an idea. [he draws a dollar on Squidward's green mat, attached to a string while laughing] This is gonna be classic!

speaker: Squidward
line: [dressed up] I think I fancy a stroll around the park.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [doorbell rings] Oh, Squidward!

speaker: Squidward
line: [opens door] What do you want? Hello, what's this? Someone left me money for a perm. Come to Hairy! [SpongeBob pulls the string] Ow! SpongeBob! Oh, my hair! [it floats away] SpongeBob!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Wait! I've got another idea! This'll be the ultimate prank. I'll draw me, and when Squidward answers the door... it won't be me! Aww, look at him. Ain't he a doll!? All he needs is a tie. [Draws a tie] Ready for action! [Laughing]

speaker: Patrick
line: He's going to the door.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: He's knocking on the door.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Squidward's answering the door and...

speaker: [DoodleBob pounds Squidward's head on the ground]
Squidward
line: Ow! Ow! Ow! Ow! Ow! Ow! Ow!

speaker: Patrick
line: He's beating up Squidward!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: DoodleBob, stop! [he throws Squidward back in his house. DoodleBob is out of control, he steals the magic pencil and then runs away with it]

speaker: Patrick
line: He's got the pencil.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: What have I done? We've got to find him! Where could he possibly be?

speaker: Patrick
line: Maybe he's in that poorly drawn pineapple.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Come on, let's go! [Patrick hides in a bush]

speaker: Patrick
line: I'm not going in there [SpongeBob also hides]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Come on, Patrick. I'm right behind you. Baby steps. Almost there... [DoodleBob draws a hole. They fall into it]

speaker: Patrick
line: What just happened?

speaker: DoodleBob
line: [speaking nonsense] Meahoy, memoyay? Meyoyyoy, ladyonmamoy!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Come on, Patrick. Give me a boost up!

speaker: Patrick
line: Can't we just stay down here where it's safe?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: No way. I created this monster and I've got to stop him. [a wrench falls and hits Patrick on the head]

speaker: DoodleBob
line: Neofineyin!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: See what I mean, Patrick?

speaker: Patrick
line: Where's the leak, ma'am? [DoodleBob draws a bowling ball and rolls it. Patrick's head turns into a bowling pin in surprise] Yurrgh! [Hits Patrick and some pink bowling pins and a "strike" symbol appears. Another "strike" symbol then appears after the bowling ball falls into the hole.]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: You okay, Patrick?

speaker: Patrick
line: Finland!

speaker: DoodleBob
line: [speaking nonsense and more nonsense] Meyaiovah! Mee hoy minoy! Meah froyay! [he runs off in the distance, Bubble transition to a coral rock wall and a field]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: There he is.

speaker: Patrick
line: He's hideous. He makes me sick, just looking at him. Those big bulgy eyes, that square body, those two buck teeth, and that stupid tie!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Eh hem.

speaker: Patrick
line: [blushes] Oh... but it looks good on you, SpongeBob! Heh heh.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: He's putting down the pencil! This is our chance. On the count of three, we'll jump out and surprise him!

speaker: Patrick
line: Oh, boy, a surprise party! Is it his birthday?

speaker: [DoodleBob breaks through the coral rock wall where SpongeBob and Patrick are hiding behind.]
DoodleBob
line: [nonsense] Bawahh bwah bwah wahh! [DoodleBob grabs SpongeBob]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Patrick! Patrick! Do something!

speaker: Patrick
line: Happy birthday!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [DoodleBob throws SpongeBob.] Arrgh!

speaker: Patrick
line: [Gives DoodleBob a rock] Here's your present. [DoodleBob bashes it on his head] You're welcome.

speaker: DoodleBob
line: [nonsense] Dewaaagheaugaaagh! [DoodleBob was about to run for his life until SpongeBob stops him whilst holding the pencil in his face]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Hold it right there, Doodle. I brought you into this world and now I'm gonna take you out. Any last words?

speaker: DoodleBob
line: [speaking nonsense fast] Bee ha, bala hala ba ba!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: I'm sorry, what was that?

speaker: DoodleBob
line: [Slowing gibberish down] Bee ha, bala hala ba ba! [DoodleBob starts to shout more gibberish while SpongeBob erases his face. DoodleBob mutters then he hits a rock]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Hold still, Doodle. This is for your own good. [begins to erase DoodleBob to oblivion] Take that and this and this and that and this that this that... [screaming] I am SpongeBob, destroyer of evil!

speaker: Patrick
line: Take it easy, it's just a drawing.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Well, that takes care of that, eh, Patrick?

speaker: Patrick
line: Done and done.

speaker: [When SpongeBob and Patrick go home, it is soon revealed that one of DoodleBob's arms is still alive]
SpongeBob
line: Gee, Gary, you should have been there! It sure was exciting, but you know, I kind of miss the little doodle. He was like a son to me. But I'm sure glad things are back to normal. Well, goodnight, sweet prince.

speaker: Gary
line: [with a crown on] Meow.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Goodnight, magic pencil. [Falls asleep. DoodleBob's arm goes into SpongeBob's house, it starts going up the stairs and takes a bathroom break, finally he sneaks up to SpongeBob's bed, grabs the pencil, and starts to re-draw himself. He wakes up] Oh hey, Magic Pencil. What are you doing up? Drawing yourself a glass of water? [laughs] [DoodleBob pops up in his bed; SpongeBob screams] DoodleBob! [slightly chuckles] No hard feelings, right? [DoodleBob draws two angry eyebrows on his face and jumps on SpongeBob's bed holding the pencil threatingly] [screams] What do you think you're doing, doodle?!

speaker: DoodleBob
line: You doodle! Me SpongeBob! [SpongeBob screams and jump out of the ways as DoodleBob erases his pillow then part of SpongeBob's house whilst chasing SpongeBob, they chase downstairs. DoodleBob erases a door and the back of SpongeBob's pants, revealing his butt] Huh? [Erases his butt]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [screams] Be careful with that thing! Who knows what will happen? [DoodleBob erases his nose] I nose. [DoodleBob erases some parts of his face and body, DoodleBob laughs at the way he looks now] Very funny, doodle. Now it's my turn. [When SpongeBob and DoodleBob struggle, the pencil breaks into two. SpongeBob has the lead and draws the rest of his face and body back] Well, doodle, it looks like this is a draw. [DoodleBob sharpens the pencil with his mouth. He now has both sides] You've made your point, no matter, I was voted most artistic in high school. [the lead piece flies out of his hand, crashes through the window and hits Squidward]

speaker: Squidward
line: [offscreen] Ow! SpongeBob, you're gonna pay for that!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Or maybe it was most clumsy. [DoodleBob starts to attack him again as SpongeBob hides in a bookshelf, as DoodleBob approaches him he gets his foot stuck in a piece of paper on the floor, DoodleBob sees this and tries to get it off] Huh? [SpongeBob looks in a book] Paper! [DoodleBob tosses the pencil from his hand] Page for Mr. Doodle! [Smashes him with a notebook. SpongeBob watches as DoodleBob is preserved as a drawing, when it's was all over he smiles. The next day, SpongeBob hangs the piece of paper on the wall with a push-pin]

speaker: Patrick
line: Hey, SpongeBob, what's with all the ruckus?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Take a look for yourself, Patrick.

speaker: Patrick
line: [Gasp!] It's the evil doodle!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: No, no, not evil. He was just a two-dimensional creature lost in our three-dimensional aquatic world longing for a purpose.

speaker: Patrick
line: So... he's a drawing?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Exactly! See how happy he is?

speaker: Patrick
line: [He looks at the paper with DoodleBob on it] He still looks kind of creepy.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Oh, great magic pencil, your powers are too mighty for us ocean dwellers. So I will send you back to the magic kingdom from where you came. Are you ready, Patrick?

speaker: Patrick
line: Ready! [SpongeBob jumps on Patrick's belly, and the pencil is launched back to the surface]

speaker: French Narrator
line: We rejoin the artist in a creative slump.

speaker: Artist
line: Huh? What's this? My pencil! [he draws a line, but the pencil breaks]

speaker: French Narrator
line: [As the artist starts to cry] The second most important rule for the artist at sea Always bring a pencil sharpener.

speaker: Artist
line: Nooooo!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [as he runs to Patrick's rock] Patrick! Patrick! Oh, Patrick! Are you ready to go jellyfishing? [Patrick comes out of his rock with a box, doing an acrobatic trick]

speaker: Patrick
line: Oh, boy, am I!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Here's your net. [Patrick glances at his box] Well, come on, Patrick! The jellyfish don't catch themselves.

speaker: Patrick
line: First, I have to put away my secret box.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Secret box? You never told me about your... secret box! [SpongeBob tries to peek in the box, but Patrick pulls it away]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: It's okay, Patrick, I know all about secrets.

speaker: Patrick
line: You do?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: I've got a gazillion secrets!

speaker: Patrick
line: Like what?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Well, it's not a secret that the best thing about a secret is secretly telling someone your secret, thereby secretly adding another secret to their secret collection of secrets. Secretly. [Patrick drools as the top of his head has lightning bolts coming out of it, showing that he couldn't understand the whole sentence]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: You wanna hear one of my secrets?

speaker: Patrick
line: Do I?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Uhh... Let's see... [he runs up to Patrick] Did you know that you're my best friend? [he runs away]

speaker: Patrick
line: No... way. Oh, let's hear another one!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Okay. Uhh... Secretly... I'm a little bit naive.

speaker: Patrick
line: WOW! I'll never look at you the same way again, SpongeBob. Gosh. [SpongeBob clears his throat and taps on Patrick's box] Tell me some more secrets!

speaker: Patrick
line: Gasp. I never would have guessed.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Now will you show me what's inside your secret box?

speaker: Patrick
line: No, SpongeBob! It's for me to know and for you to never find out. You may be an open book SpongeBob, but I'm a bit more complicated than that. The inner machinations of my mind are an enigma. [Patrick imagines a carton of milk spilling itself]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: But, Patrick, I must know the secret!

speaker: Patrick
line: For the last time, SpongeBob, no!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Come on, Patrick, just a peek?

speaker: Patrick
line: Never! [SpongeBob and Patrick strain as they fight over the box. Eventually, SpongeBob's arms pop off and he gasps] So, it's come to this. And to think that we joined the Best Friends Forever Club! [he shows his finger with the ring on it and then the camera zooms in on the ring. He grabs one of SpongeBob's arms and points it at SpongeBob] Listen up, SpongeBob SecretStealerPants! [as he pokes SpongeBob's nose with his arm] If you ever come close to my secret box again, we won't be friends anymore!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: But... we're supposed to be... [his eyes get big and sad] friends forever. [flashback to SpongeBob and Patrick as babies in a crib laughing, then we see them as kids riding on a bike, then as they are now, riding a bike, then as older men in rocking chairs, then we see a shot of two gravestones with their names and we hear SpongeBob and Patrick still laughing, but they are buried. The flashback ends.] I feel so filthy! [he starts to cry] I have soiled our friendship garden! I just couldn't help myself! [he jumps on Patrick] I know it's your secret! I promise to respect that! Oh, please forgive me, Patrick! Please!

speaker: Patrick
line: Well... I guess it's not all your fault. After all, this is a pretty great secret. I mean, how could you resist the greatest secret ever? [we see a close-up of Patrick's box] The most amazing... [as he sticks the box in SpongeBob's eyes, the eyes pop out of him and then back in] mysterious... powerful secret in all Bikini Bottom. [he eyes are glued to the box for a moment, and then goes back to him]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: So, what do you say, buddy? Friends?

speaker: Patrick
line: Friends. [they shake hands. Cuts to a night view of SpongeBob's house, then inside as SpongeBob talks]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: What could be in that box that Patrick doesn't want me to see? Maybe it's the world's only albino jellyfish! [he slides down in his bed] Or maybe Patrick's a master jewel thief and it's full of diamonds. [he sits up] Or maybe Patrick's a deranged maniac who keeps his victim's severed heads in a box. [he hides himself in the blanket and shivers] Or even worse! Maybe it's an embarrassing snapshot of me from the Christmas party! [screams, then jumps onto the bedroom window and talks a little muffled] I've gotta find out what's in that secret box! I'm not gonna rest until I do! [SpongeBob's face pops off and sticks onto his back] That's it! How do you look in a secret box? [he jumps off the window] Secretly, of course! I'll just take the box while Patrick's sleeping, look in that box, and before Patrick even has time to notice, I'll slide it back. [he turns around to show only his nose. He turns back around] Patrick won't know when I'll have my own little secret. Good idea, eh, Gary?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Oh, what do you know, you're a snail! [SpongeBob sneaks to Patrick's house, puts gloves and a ski mask on him, crawls up the rock with his back, and tears him in half and gets both halves under the rock. He then lands and notices Patrick. He then screams gibberish, drools and SpongeBob hides behind the portrait of SpongeBob and Patrick. SpongeBob then peeks and then the wall starts to crack. Patrick mumbles, the wall breaks even more and then the nail falls off. He then grabs the nail with his foot and puts it back.]

speaker: Patrick
line: [as the camera zooms in on the box] Seee... cret.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [thinking] I got to be more quiet. I don't want to wake Patrick up. [slides down the wall from the portrait and makes a loud noise upon touching the floor. Patrick stretches and then goes back to sleep. SpongeBob then lifts his leg and then Patrick makes another noise. He then tosses himself over on the bed. SpongeBob puts his leg down, which makes a loud noise]

speaker: Patrick
line: Duh... who's there? [he mumbles then goes back to sleep.]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [talking to his foot] Shhh! [SpongeBob steps on a potato chip and makes a broken glass sound]

speaker: Patrick
line: EH?! [gibberish] WHO'S THAT?! [Patrick is back asleep. SpongeBob sweeps his sweat drops off him and they land, causing a loud splash sound.] Mmm... water. [he licks his mouth dry, then tosses himself on the bed. SpongeBob takes another step and makes an "AWOOOOGA!" noise. He then steps again, making a loud machine gun noise. Steps again, making the sound of an elephant. He then stretches his leg near the side of the bed, then takes the step, making a very loud crashing noise. He then peeks above Patrick to see the box. He gets ready to reach for the box, but Patrick takes the box before SpongeBob could grab it. He then slides onto Patrick, grabbing the box] Good old secret box. Let's see what's inside. [opens SpongeBob's mouth and pulls out his tongue, then laughs. He lets go of his tongue] Nighty-night, boxie. [he puts SpongeBob on the side of the bed. SpongeBob gets off the bed and then trips on a shoestring, causing him to bounce around Patrick's house, making a lot of loud noises until his head hits the wall, causing the portrait to fall off the wall, hitting him in the head, breaking the portrait half. The box then lands on SpongeBob and makes a loud noise. The scene cuts back to Patrick, who, despite all the noise, continues to sleep]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Gee, Patrick sure is a heavy sleeper. [Patrick wakes up]

speaker: Patrick
line: Huh? Who said that?! Who's there?!

speaker: Patrick
line: It's the Clam Burglar! And he's stealing my secret box! [he runs up to SpongeBob] Hand over the goods, Secret Box Bandit, and prepare for the most unpleasant pillow fight of your life! [he cocks his pillow like a shotgun]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Wait, wait, wait, Patrick! Stop! It's me, SpongeBob!

speaker: Patrick
line: Nice try, burglar, but SpongeBob's my best friend, and he'd never steal from me.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: No, really, Patrick! Look! [Patrick gasps. SpongeBob presses a button on the ring]

speaker: SpongeBob and Patrick BFF Ring
line: It's the Best Friends Forever, Best Friends Forever Ring!

speaker: Patrick
line: Our friendship ring! IT IS YOU! [crying as he covers his face with his pillow] How could you do thi-i-i-i-is?!?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: If it makes you feel any better, I haven't looked inside. [he throws the pillow away and snatches the box out of SpongeBob's hands]

speaker: Patrick
line: [with a tear coming out of his eye] That's it, SpongeBob! You have crossed the line. As of right now, this friendship is OVER!!!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [gasps and tears up] Really?

speaker: Patrick
line: Nahhh, you can look inside it if you really want to.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: OK! Oh, this is one the most exciting moments of my life! Well, here it goes! [he lifts the lid off the box] Huh?

speaker: Patrick
line: Well, didn't I tell ya? [we see a string inside the box] Isn't it great?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: It's just a string.

speaker: Patrick
line: A secret string!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Boy, when you're right, you're right! That's some secret box you've got there! Yeah! Thanks for showing me that! [he puts the lid back on the box] Well, good night, Patrick. See you tomorrow!

speaker: Patrick
line: Good night, SpongeBob! [SpongeBob pops out of Patrick's house]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: I should've known! It was just a piece of string all along! [he laughs] Wait 'till I tell Gary!

speaker: Patrick
line: [laughs menacingly] Good thing he didn't pull the secret string, opening the... [a secret compartment opens] ...secret compartment of my secret box... [he takes out a photo] ...revealing one embarrassing snapshot of SpongeBob at the Christmas Party! [cut to the Bikini Atoll] Merry Christmas, SpongeBob! [laughs as the screen fades to black, ending the episode]

speaker: [ A horrible sound is heard, which turns out to be Squidward playing his clarinet until the doorbell rings. Doctor Forrest is at the door]
Doctor Forrest
line: Yeah, uhh, we're with the pet hospital down the street and I understand that you have a dying animal on the premises. [Squidward slams the door shut. Phone starts to ring.]

speaker: Squidward
line: Hello. You've reached the house of unrecognized talent. Please start after the [plays a clarinet note]

speaker: Squilliam
line: Sounds like you've got a dying animal to attend to, eh ol' chum?

speaker: Squidward
line: [gasp] Squilliam Fancyson from band class?!

speaker: Squilliam
line: I hear you're playing the cash register now.

speaker: Squidward
line: Sometimes. Uh, how's the unibrow?

speaker: Squilliam
line: [Waving his unibrow] It's big and valuable. I'm the leader of a big fancy band now, and we're supposed to play the Bubble Bowl next week.

speaker: Squidward
line: The ba-ba-ba... The ba-ba-ba... The ba-ba-ba?!?!

speaker: Squilliam
line: That's right. I'm living your dreams Squidward. The problem is, I'm busy next week and can't make it. So, I was hoping you and your band could cover for us.

speaker: Squidward
line: Ohh, uhh, I... I, uhh...

speaker: Squilliam
line: I knew it! You don't even have a band! Well, I'll just let you get back to the service industry now.

speaker: Squidward
line: Hold it! It just so happens that I don't sell fast food, I do have a band, and we're gonna play that Bubble Bowl! How do you like that, Fancy Boy?!

speaker: Squilliam
line: Good luck next Tuesday. I hope the audience brings lots of... ibuprofen! [hangs up phone]

speaker: Squidward
line: I gotta drum up a marching band fast! Drum... haha... band humor. [In the following lines, Sandy, Plankton, Mrs. Puff, Mr. Krabs, and Larry are reading from a poster]

speaker: Sandy
line: Looking to add fulfillment to your dull, dull life?

speaker: Plankton
line: Then become part of the greatest musical sensation to ever hit Bikini Bottom.

speaker: Mrs. Puff
line: And be forever adored by thousands of people you don't know.

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Not to mention free refreshments.

speaker: Larry
line: Practice begins tonight. 830 sharp. [Squidward looks at his watch while driving a shell cart]

speaker: Squidward
line: Stupid music rental clerk made me late. That trilobite didn't know an oboe from an elbow. Elbow, heh, more band humor.

speaker: [Cuts to inside the room, everyone is there]
All
line: Blah, blah, blah, blah...

speaker: Squidward
line: People, people, settle down! Ok, now. How many of you have played musical instruments before?

speaker: Plankton
line: Do instruments of torture count?

speaker: Squidward
line: No.

speaker: Patrick
line: Is mayonnaise an instrument?

speaker: Squidward
line: No, Patrick, mayonnaise is not an instrument. [Patrick raises his hand again] Horseradish is not an instrument, either. [Patrick lowers his hand] That's fine. No one has any experience. Fortunately, I have enough talent for all of you. [laughs]

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: So when do we get the free food?

speaker: Squidward
line: Ok, try to repeat after me. [Squidward plays 6 notes] Brass section, go. [brass section repeats badly] Good. Now the wind. [wind section repeats badly] And the drums. [drummers misunderstand what Squidward means, so they blow on their sticks which blow out and stick Squidward to the wall] Too bad that didn't kill me. [Next scene] Let's just try stepping in the rhythm. Now I want everyone to stand in straight rows of five.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Is this the part where we start kicking?

speaker: Squidward
line: No, SpongeBob, that's a chorus line.

speaker: Patrick
line: Kicking? I wanna do some kicking! [Patrick kicks Sandy in the leg]

speaker: Sandy
line: Ow! Why, you...! Why I oughta...! [she jumps on Patrick and starts fighting him until they roll outside and the doors slam shut]

speaker: Patrick
line: [Makes a very long painful scream.] [Everyone pauses and stares at the door, then Patrick sticks his head back in] Whoever is the owner of the white sedan, you left your lights on. [Patrick walks in and it is revealed that Sandy has stuck his body in a trombone. Trombone notes are heard as he walks towards his seat. As he sits down, he makes a sound of his trombone. Makes a loud trombone noise as he opens his mouth. Stares at himself.]

speaker: Narrator
line: Day two. [band walking down a street playing Semper Fidelis badly]

speaker: Squidward
line: Okay, that's perfect everybody. Bubble Bowl here we come. Flag twirlers, really spin those things. Okay, turn. Flag twirlers, let's go. I wanna see some spinning. Flag twirlers let's move! C'mon, move! [Flag twirlers spin so hard that they take off into the sky and crash into a blimp, which causes an explosion. Trumpet player plays taps while everyone mourns, except Squidward, who just lies down on the ground]

speaker: Narrator
line: Day three.

speaker: Squidward
line: How's that harmonica solo coming Plankton?

speaker: Plankton
line: It's tremendous, you wanna see? [Plankton plays the harmonica by running to and from holes, but soon runs out of breath; on his way to the last hole he blows an unsuccessful last raspberry into the harmonica and faints]

speaker: Narrator
line: Day four.

speaker: Squidward
line: Well, this is our last night together before the show. And I know that none of you improved since we began... [Patrick chews on a trumpet] ...but I have a theory. People talk loud when they wanna act smart, right?

speaker: Plankton
line: [loudly] Correct!

speaker: Squidward
line: So, if we play loud, people might think we're good. Everybody ready? And a one, and a two, and a one, two, three, four! [screen cuts to the outside of the music school and a blast of noise ensues, breaking the windows. Cuts back inside music school, where Squidward's face is deformed beyond recognition, his shirt's been ripped and his baton breaks] OK, new theory. Maybe we should play so quietly, no one can hear us.

speaker: Harold
line: Well, maybe we wouldn't sound so bad if some people didn't try to play with big, meaty claws!

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: What did you say, punk?!

speaker: Harold
line: [Shouts loudy] Big... Meaty... claws!

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Well, these claws ain't for just attractin' mates.

speaker: Harold
line: Bring it on, old man! Bring it on!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: No, people. Let's be smart and bring it off.

speaker: Nancy
line: Oh, so now the talking cheese is gonna preach to us.

speaker: Squidward
line: Wait, wait. I know tensions are high... [everyone gets into a fight. Pilar and Larry are yelling at each other. Medley slams a drum at him] There's a deposit on that equipment, people! [everyone uses their instruments as weapons. Mr. Krabs and Harold charge at each other with large woodwinds, but try to screech to a halt, and Mrs. Puff slams them both with her cymbals] Settle down, please! [Sandy and Frank are fighting. Sandy breaks the xylophone keys from Frank and Frank runs away. Patrick kicks Sandy, who growls at him before producing a trumpet with an evil grin. Patrick realizes what's coming and runs away screaming as Sandy chases him with the trumpet. Cuts to the clock which shows 10 o'clock and everyone stops fighting]

speaker: Fred
line: Hey, class is over. [they all walk to the door where Squidward slams it open]

speaker: Squidward
line: Well, you did it. You took my one chance in happiness...and crushed it! Crushed it into little tiny, bite-size pieces. I really expected better of you people. I guess I'm a loser for that, too. Don't bother showing up tomorrow. I'll just tell them you all died in a marching accident. So, thanks. [sobbing] Thanks for nothing! [Leaves]

speaker: Patrick
line: You're welcome.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: What kind of monsters are we? That poor creature came to us in his hour of need, and we failed him. Squidward's always been there for us when it was convenient for him. Evelyn, when your little Jimmy was trapped in a fire, who rescued him?

speaker: Evelyn
line: A fireman.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: And Larry, when your heart gave out from all those tanning pills, who revived you?

speaker: Larry
line: Some guy in an ambulance.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Right. So, if we can all just pretend that Squidward was a fireman, or some guy in an ambulance, then I'm sure that we can all pull together and discover what it truly means to be in a marching band.

speaker: Harold
line: Yeah, for the fireman!

speaker: All
line: Hooray!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Now let's make Squidward proud. A 1, a 2, a skiddly diddly doo.

speaker: Squidward
line: I knew this was gonna happen. They're just gonna have to find another band to play. I just hope that... [zooms out to reveal Squilliam is there] ...Squilliam doesn't find out! Squilliam! [screams] What are you doing here?!

speaker: Squilliam
line: Oh I just came to watch you blow it. So, where's your band?

speaker: Squidward
line: Uh, they couldn't come. They... died.

speaker: Squilliam
line: Then who's that?

speaker: Squidward
line: [screams and his eyes pop out] That would be my band!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: We're ready to perform, Squidward.

speaker: Squilliam
line: Well, Squiddy, this is exactly how I pictured your band would look. [SpongeBob dances]

speaker: Squidward
line: That's his... eager face. [Squilliam laughs while they all go into the Bubble Bowl]

speaker: Squidward
line: [everybody marches to the Bubble Bowl and starts performing] Well, I guess this will be the last time I can show my face in this town.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: That's the spirit, Squidward. [bowl raises above a football field]

speaker: Football Announcer
line: Okay, football fans. Put your hands together for the Bikini Bottom Super Band!

speaker: [A crowd of live-action people is shown.]
Patrick
line: These are some ugly looking fish.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Maybe we're in one of those toxic waste dumps.

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: I think I'm gonna be sick.

speaker: Squidward
line: [Nervously] Alright, everybody. [Glances at Squilliam, who grins and bounces his unibrow] Let's get this over with. 1, 2, 3, 4...

speaker: [Band plays wonderful intro. Squidward opens his eyes. SpongeBob begins singing]
French Narrator
line: Ah, The Krusty Krab. Bikini Bottom's premiere daytime eatery. Where it will be closing time right about...

speaker: Squidward
line: [talks cheerfully as he switched the Open sign to Closed] Now! 800! So long, suckers! I've got a hot date with a little lady, and her name is [pulls out his clarinet] Clarinet. [Tom shows up at the door and knocks on it, causing Squidward to drop his clarinet] What?

speaker: Tom
line: Are you open?

speaker: Squidward
line: [points to sign] Read the sign.

speaker: Tom
line: I'll have a Krabby Patty Deluxe and a double chili kelp fries.

speaker: Squidward
line: No, you won't! I can't hang out here all night! I've got a life.

speaker: Tom
line: Well fine, if you don't want my money!

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: [says cheerfully] Money?! [Mr. Krabs then falls from the ceiling on top of Squidward] You mean, if we stayed open later, you'd give us your money?

speaker: Tom
line: [pulls out cash, Sadie, an anchovy, and an old man appear behind him] Sure!

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Mr. Squidward, [tears up the Closed sign] welcome to the night shift. From now on, the Krusty Krab is open 24 hours a day.

speaker: Squidward
line: What!? [crowd of fish barge in cheering]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Wow! Now we never have to stop working!

speaker: Squidward
line: Mr. Krabs..

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: See ya in the morning, boys! I can't hang out here all night! I've got a life. [leaves]

speaker: Squidward
line: Mr. Krabs?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Isn't this great Squidward?! Just you and me together for hours and hours and hours and then the sun'll come up and it'll be tomorrow and we'll still be working! [gasps] It'll be just like a sleepover! Only we'll be sweaty and covered with grease! [jumps on cash register counter] Are you ready to rock, Squidward?!

speaker: Squidward
line: No.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Good! 'Cause we've got customers!

speaker: Squidward
line: [Sandals walks up to counter; Squidward hands him a baseball bat] Here. Please hit me as hard as you can.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Psst, Squidward. I'm working in the kitchen [laughs] at night!

speaker: Squidward
line: [takes hat off; leans head on counter] Don't hold back.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [cuts to SpongeBob in kitchen] Hey Squidward. Guess what, I'm chopping lettuce...at night. [cuts to SpongeBob in the bathroom wiping it clean with himself] Look at me, I'm swabbing the bathroom...at night. [cuts to SpongeBob at the grill picking up spatula, misses the spatula and hits the grill; screams] I burned my hand!...at night. [cuts to SpongeBob walking on the counter, singing to the tune of Charge] Night, night, night, night, night, night, night, night, night, night, night, night, na-na-na-na-night! Night!

speaker: Squidward
line: Will you please?! Here, [hands SpongeBob a bag of garbage] give me a moment's peace and take out the trash!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: All right! [takes bag from Squidward] Taking out the trash. Taking out the trash...at night. [stops at the door] You mean outside?

speaker: Squidward
line: That's where the dumpster is, yes.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: I don't know, Squidward, [leans face against window] it's kinda dark out there.

speaker: Squidward
line: But I thought you liked the night shift.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: You're right! [lifts bag over his head] For the Krusty Krab! [runs out of the building to the dumpster, screaming and panicking the whole way; reenters the building panting heavily. snaps his fingers and confidently says] Piece of cake!

speaker: Squidward
line: So you're not afraid?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Pfft, nah.

speaker: Squidward
line: Well I am. Especially after, [looks around, gulps] well, you know.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [turns around] What? What do I know?

speaker: Squidward
line: You don't remember? It was all over the news.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Tell me! Tell me!

speaker: Squidward
line: No, no, no, I probably shouldn't. It would ruin the night shift for you. [gives a sympathetic look, then smiles slyly]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [excitedly] What happened, what happened, what happened!?

speaker: Squidward
line: You mean you've never heard the story of the [thinks] "Hash-Slinging Slasher?"

speaker: SpongeBob
line: The Slash-Bringing Hasher?

speaker: Squidward
line: The Hash-Slinging Slasher!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: The Sash-Ringing, the Trash-Singing, Mash-Flinging, The Flash-Springing, Ringing, The Cr-Crash-Dinging, daa.

speaker: Squidward
line: Yes. The Hash-Slinging Slasher. But, most people just call him The Ha [breaks into scream] because that's all they have time to say before he gets them!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [begging] Tell me the story!

speaker: Squidward
line: Years ago at this very restaurant, the Hash-Slinging Slasher used to be a fry cook - just like you - only clumsier. And then, one night, when he was cutting the patties ...it happened.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: He forgot the secret sauce?

speaker: Squidward
line: No.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: He didn't wash his hands?

speaker: Squidward
line: No!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Irregular portions?

speaker: Squidward
line: NO! He cut off his own hand by mistake.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: You mean like this? [pulls one of his arms out of socket, another one grows back in its place] Or like this? [pulls it again, another one grows back] Or this? [does it again] Or this? [does it again] But what about this? Or this, or this, or this, or...

speaker: Squidward
line: [interrupts] Except he wasn't a sponge!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [ask with all his extra hands creating a rainbow-like line] So?

speaker: Squidward
line: So it didn't grow back!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [screams] Oh, no! [all his extra arms lift their hands upwards and run away]

speaker: Squidward
line: And he replaced his hand with a rusty spatula. And then, he got hit by a bus! And...at his funeral, they fired him! So now, every...what day is it?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Tuesday.

speaker: Squidward
line: Tuesday night, his ghost returns to The Krusty Krab to wreak his horrible vengeance.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [gasps] But tonight's Tuesday night!

speaker: Squidward
line: Then he'll be coming.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: How will we know?

speaker: Squidward
line: There are three signs that signal the approach of the Hash-Slinging Slasher. First, the lights will flicker on and off. Next...

speaker: Harold
line: [interrupts] Dude, can I have some ketchup?

speaker: Squidward
line: Oh, here you go. [hands him ketchup] Next, the phone will ring and there will be nobody there. [shows SpongeBob eating his fingernails] And finally, the Hash-Slinging Slasher arrives in the ghost of the bus that ran him over. [shows SpongeBob eating his fingernails, starts eating his arms, the arms regrow and he eats those and then he eats his arms like popcorn] Then he exits the bus and crosses the street without looking both ways because he's already dead! [SpongeBob begins eating his hands like popcorn] Then he taps on the window with his grizzly spatula hand..

speaker: SpongeBob
line: No.

speaker: Squidward
line: He opens the door [pushes his tentacle to SpongeBob's face, making it looking like he's a door that's being opened; while doing this he imitates the sound of a squeaky door opening. leans torwards SpongeBob's face, which sinks in] He slowly approaches the counter ["counter" echoes menacingly] ...and you know what he does next?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: What?

speaker: Squidward
line: You really want to know?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: What?

speaker: Squidward
line: Are you sure you want to know?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: What, what, what does he do?!

speaker: Squidward
line: [sneaks up on SpongeBob, taps him] He gets ya! [SpongeBob now screams repeatedly for about 20 seconds while Squidward is laughing] SpongeBob... [continues screaming] SpongeBob I wa... [screaming continues] I was ju... [SpongeBob's pupils are now screaming too] I was jus... [screaming continues] SpongeBob, I was joking!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: What?

speaker: Squidward
line: It's not true! None of it's true!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: It's not?

speaker: Squidward
line: Of course not. Nobody has a spatula for a hand. It was all a joke.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Ohhhhh. [laughs repeatedly like he did with screaming] [cuts into later in the night. Shows Krusty Krab with a big sign that says 'Open Forever']

speaker: [Squidward is shown at the counter reading a book. Squidward hears spooky noises and feels water dripping on him but he doesn't know what it is.]
SpongeBob
line: [on the ceiling wearing suction cups cleaning] Isn't this great, Squidward? [Squidward screams] There's never time to wash the ceiling during the day.

speaker: Squidward
line: [says to himself] Open 24 hours a day. What a stupid idea! Who wants a Krabby Patty at three in the morning?

speaker: Patrick
line: [Patrick's alarm clock goes off] Oh boy! Three A.M.! [whips out a Krabby Patty and starts to eat it; cuts back to The Krusty Krab]

speaker: Squidward
line: Just look at this place. It's like a ghost town in here! [lights start to flicker on and off] Very funny, SpongeBob.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: What?

speaker: Squidward
line: "And the lights will flicker on and off." Just like the story. I get it. [realizes no one is flickering the light switch and looks shocked]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Hey Squidward, how are you doing that without moving the switch?

speaker: Squidward
line: I'm not doing it. It must be the stupid, faulty wiring in here. This place isn't built to run 24 hours a day! [phone rings, Squidward picks it up] What, what, hello? Hello? Hello?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [walks up to the counter] Nice try, Squidward.

speaker: Squidward
line: Nice try, what?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: "The phone will ring and there will be no one there." [raises eyebrows up and down and giggles] Oh, you crack me up.

speaker: Squidward
line: SpongeBob, I'm not doing this. [hangs up phone] Oh no, calm down, calm down. All right, what was it? There was the lights, [lights flicker on and off] and the phone, [phone rings] and the walls will ooze green slime! [walls start to ooze green slime] No, wait. They always do that. But what was that third thing? [hears a motor, turns his head and opens his eyes wide; a bus pulls up to the Krusty Krab doors]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [walks up to the counter] I didn't know the buses ran this late.

speaker: Squidward
line: They don't! [a man gets out of the bus and the bus pulls away, all Squidward and SpongeBob can see is his spooky outline]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Well they're dropping someone off. [from the outside, the man lifts his spatula]

speaker: Squidward
line: [screams to the point where hair grows from his head and starts wiggling]

speaker: Squidward
line: The SASH-RINGING, FLASH-SINGING, THE BASH-PINGING...

speaker: SpongeBob
line: The Hash-Slinging Slasher! [starts to cry]

speaker: Squidward
line: At last you understand! We're doomed!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: No, that's not it. [wipes tear] I am just so touched that you would go through the trouble to dress up as a ghostly fry cook and stand on the other side of the street, just to entertain me! You must really like me! [cries again]

speaker: Squidward
line: SpongeBob, there are two problems with your theory. One - I hate you. And two - how can that be me when I'm standing right here!? [the man taps on the door with his spatula]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [screams to the point where his eyelashes grow and start wiggling]

speaker: SpongeBob and Squidward
line: THE HASH-SLINGING SLASHER!!! [the guy walks in the door and up to the counter]

speaker: Squidward
line: SpongeBob, no matter what I've said, I've always sort of liked you!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Squidward, I used your clarinet to unclog my toilet!

speaker: Squidward
line: Huh? [a nerdy unnamed guy reaches the counter]

speaker: Hervy
line: Can I have a job application? I brought my own spatula. [holds up spatula] I called here earlier but I hung up 'cause I was nervous.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Do you have references?

speaker: Squidward
line: Wait, if that was you on the phone and you on the bus, then who was flickering the lights? [lights flicker on and off; SpongeBob, Squidward and Hervy look over to see Nosferatu]

speaker: SpongeBob, Squidward and The Unnamed Guy
line: Nosferatu!

speaker: Nosferatu
line: [smiles. light turns off]

speaker: [A normal day at the Krusty Krab. Mr. Krabs stitches a cushion of money, while singing]
Mr. Krabs
line: La da dee. Stitch one per two. Doo da dee doo. Di dee dee da de... [abruptly stops and sniffs the air] What's that smell? [He runs over to the boat in front of the kitchen window] The register! [He smells it repeatedly] $49.0... 8?! That's a penny short! [he starts crying as Squidward walks by]

speaker: Squidward
line: [sarcastically] Oh, no, not a penny. Help, somebody help us. [SpongeBob appears in the boat besides Mr. Krabs, consoling him]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: It's just a penny, sir. [Mr. Krabs stops crying to look at SpongeBob] It doesn't matter.

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Doesn't matter? It's money that makes the world go round, boy! It's money that keeps your pants square! [holds up a right-angled ruler to SpongeBob's pants] It's money that keeps Squidward in frilly soap!

speaker: Squidward
line: [Squidward smells his armpit] Lilac.

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: It's money that paid for all them renovations we did! [Shows the Krusty Krab literally in large-sized bandages] Oh, nothing in all the seven seas could matter more. Not even that... [Something catches his eye] ...scrumptious curvy cutie.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: I see her, Mr. Krabs. [We see a Krabby Patty] A Krabby Patty with cheese. The classic.

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Not the sandwich, boy! The curvy cutie holding the sandwich! [Shows Mrs. Puff eating the Krabby Patty prepared by SpongeBob]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Hey, that's my driving teacher, Mrs. Puff!

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Mrs. Puff? Aw... she's married.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Oh, no, Mr. Krabs. She's single.

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Then what happened to Mr. Puff? [footage of Mr. Puff, now a lamp, being turned on]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: She doesn't like to talk about it.

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Oh, what I wouldn't give to have a lass like that on me claw.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Hey, I know! Why don't I take you over and introduce you?

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Oh, no, no, no, I, I'm, I'm too old, boy. Too hard-shelled for love. Besides, I ain't not properly dressed.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Oh, come on, Mr. Krabs! You look great! [his clothes have grease stains, his pocket is inside-out with mud coloring it, and his zipper is down] You wait here while I go break the ice! [quickly runs off]

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: SpongeBob, no, wait! I'm too nervous! Ooohhh... [At Mrs. Puff's table]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Hi, Mrs. Puff.

speaker: Mrs. Puff
line: [she screams] Hit the brakes, SpongeBob! Watch that tree! Left! Left!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [he snaps his fingers] Wait, Mrs. Puff! We're not driving.

speaker: Mrs. Puff
line: Oh, I'm sorry, SpongeBob. I didn't expect to see you here.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: I work here, Mrs. Puff. Want to meet my boss?

speaker: Mrs. Puff
line: Well, I'm not...

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Don't move! [Mrs. Puff tries to leave, but SpongeBob and Krabs get back to the table too soon]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Mrs. Puff, I'd like to introduce you to Mr... [Mr. Krabs falls forward onto the floor. SpongeBob props him back up]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Mrs. Puff, I'd like to introduce you to my boss, Mr. Krabs.

speaker: Mrs. Puff
line: [Nervously] Uh, hello.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [Mr. Krabs looks shy] Psst, Mr. Krabs, say hello.

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: [unintelligibly] Gla-gloo!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: No, no, Mr. Krabs, just say hello.

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: [makes a choking gasp-type noise]

speaker: Mrs. Puff
line: Hmm, perhaps another time would be...

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: [yelling] No!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Wait, he's trying to tell you something!

speaker: Mrs. Puff
line: Mr. Krabs?

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: [jerking his eyes and moving his arms around weirdly] Dah me nam do um dah um!

speaker: Mrs. Puff
line: I don't understand.

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: [taking to SpongeBob] Bo a blum, uh, do a blugh eh ou a blaugh!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Oh, uh, I think Mr. Krabs is saying that he'd like to... hit you with a rake!

speaker: Mrs. Puff
line: [Scared] Goodness!

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: [yells again] No! [lifts his tall eyes up and down] Gla-goo, meep bo blargh uh hee!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Try to guess your weight!

speaker: Mrs. Puff
line: [Offended] Well!

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: [flails his arms] Rraugh glorg mic floraug!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: No, wait... he wants to take you...

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Ca ca boom a lom!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: ...on a date! [Mr. Krabs gasps happily and falls over]

speaker: Mrs. Puff
line: Is that true, Mr. Krabs? Do you want to take me on a date?

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Aye. What do you say?

speaker: Mrs. Puff
line: What do I say? [starts laughing] I say, you have a way with words, Mr. Krabs. [Laughs and walks away]

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: [chuckles] I still got it. [Scene cuts to Mr. Krabs' house]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Are you ready for your date, Mr. Krabs?

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: I'm always ready when it comes to datin', lad!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [reading a list] Breath spray?

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: [sprays mouth with breath spray] Check!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Lucky hankie?

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Check!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Giant rusty anchor?

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Ye..., anchor? Anchor! I can't find me giant rusty anchor! [SpongeBob throws the list away and laughs]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Relax, Mr. Krabs. Just a little joke. Good luck with you know who. [Makes a circle in the air and moves his eyebrows up and down twice]

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Who's that?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Mrs. Puff.

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Oh, yeah. Well, wish me luck, lad! [We now go to "Fancy!", a restaurant which is a ship in a glass bottle. We see Mr. Krabs and Mrs. Puff there]

speaker: Mrs. Puff
line: Oh, Mr. Krabs, this dinner has been so wonderful. The coral was cooked to perfection. I don't think I could eat another bite.

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Oh, I doubt that, my little shrimp boat.

speaker: Mrs. Puff
line: [laughs] You're spoiling me, Mr. Krabs. I mean, foot rubs between courses... [shows a squid rubbing Mrs. Puff's feet] Caricatures... [Shows Mr. Krabs a picture of her on the beach with an enlarged head] Imported music... [A live-action scuba diver plays the piano on the other side of the room]

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Nothing's too good for you, my prickly peach.

speaker: Mrs. Puff
line: Uh, what I'm trying to tell you, Mr. Krabs, is...

speaker: Waiter
line: Sir? Your fancy pantsy limousine is here.

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Wonderful! Pufflily-pooh, your chariot awaits!

speaker: Mrs. Puff
line: Well...[Two men carry her to the limo and she screams]

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: You'll never have to walk again, my little lobster bib! [He sighs as the waiter approaches him again]

speaker: Waiter
line: Your bill, sir.

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: [he takes the bill] What? $100?! Well, this can't possibly be correct!

speaker: Waiter
line: Oh, my mistake, sir. Thank you for pointing that out. [he hands him a different bill] This is your bill.

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: [his eyes enlarge weirdly] [screaming] [the restaurant starts to shake, the cork pops off and the giant glass bottle breaks. Back at Mr. Krabs' house, SpongeBob is watching him sob on the floor]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: I don't understand, Mr. Krabs. How can you spend $100,000 in one night?

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Oh, SpongeBob! I couldn't help but spend every cent I had on her! I couldn't control myself!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: What are you going to do?

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: I don't know, boy! I've got another date tomorrow! I'm caught in the middle of me two great loves! Sweet Mrs. Puff, and the rest of me money! [resumes sobbing]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: I wish there was some way I could help.

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Perhaps there is, boy! [he hands him his wallet] I'm puttin' you in charge of me money!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: I don't get it, Mr. Krabs.

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: You come with me on the date and don't let me spend any money! [The two walk to Mrs. Puff's metallic pink house]

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Now remember, we keep it cheap by going to the park. And no matter how much I ask you, you don't give me any of me money. Now, give me a dollar.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Nope.

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Good boy! You'll do fine! [Knocks on the door]

speaker: Mrs. Puff
line: Who is it? [Krabs immediately becomes entranced. His eyes turn into hearts]

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: It's me, my beautiful bell buoy!

speaker: Mrs. Puff
line: [giggles] Just a minute!

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Flowers! Flowers, boy! Go get flowers!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: But you said...

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: SpongeBob, you can't call on a classy lady like Mrs. Puff empty-handed! We ain't talking about this... [makes a square] ...or this... [makes a triangle] ...we're talking about this! [makes the circle from before]

speaker: Mrs. Puff
line: Almost ready!

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Hurry, boy! Get the flowers! [SpongeBob runs off as Mrs. Puff comes out]

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Mrs. Puff, you're as beautiful as ever.

speaker: Mrs. Puff
line: [laughs nervously] That's funny, I thought I heard SpongeBob's voice.

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Uh... you did. He'll be right back. He's our personal assistant for the day.

speaker: Mrs. Puff
line: Oh, e-excuse me. I have to call my insurance agent. [Hurries back inside]

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Of course, my beautiful Puff. [Mr. Krabs sighs. SpongeBob returns with the flowers]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Mr. Krabs, I got the flowers you wanted me to buy.

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: What's that?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: I got the flowers. For Mrs. Puff.

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: We had an agreement, boy! You ain't supposed to spend any of me money!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: But you said...

speaker: Mrs. Puff
line: Here I come! [She walks out, and Krabs grabs the flowers, once again hypnotized by his love for Mrs. Puff and gives the flowers to her]

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: For you, Mrs. Puff!

speaker: Mrs. Puff
line: Oh, flowers! Oh, how thoughtful!

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: And here's a box of chocolates! [He holds out an empty claw] SpongeBob, where's the chocolates?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Mr. Krabs, the budget doesn't allow for...

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: SpongeBob, you can't go to Mrs. Puff's house without chocolates! Hurry! Hurry! [SpongeBob runs off. SpongeBob comes back with the heart-shaped box of chocolates]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: I bought the biggest box they had!

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Buy, buy, buy! Spend, spend, spend! Is that all you can think about?!

speaker: Mrs. Puff
line: Oh, Eugene! [Krabs presents the box to Puff]

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Here's those chocolates I bought for you. What are we doing today, Mrs. Puff? Dinner? Dancing? A trip to the moon?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Psst, Mr. Krabs, we're just going for a walk in the park, remember?

speaker: Mrs. Puff
line: Actually, a walk in the park sounds perfect. It's a beautiful day. I'll just need to get a sun hat and...

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Mrs. Puff needs a sun hat, SpongeBob!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Well, I think she...

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: The sun's beatin' down on poor Mrs. Puff's head!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: As your financial advisor, I suggest that...

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: There's no time for suggestions! Go buy a hat!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: But...

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Today! Don't worry, Mrs. Puff! I'll save you! [Places a barrel on Mrs. Puff's head.]

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: SpongeBob, hurry!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [as SpongeBob comes back from the store with a large straw hat] One shady hat.

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Good job, lad. [Puts the hat on Mrs. Puff]

speaker: Mrs. Puff
line: Oh, well thank you. But you didn't need to buy one. I have a hat in the closet.

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Didn't need to buy one? [He turns his head around like an owl to face SpongeBob, still grinning] You hear that, boy? [in high pitch] We didn't need to buy a hat. [angrily] Aren't you supposed saving me money!?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: I'm trying, Mr. Krabs! But you keep telling me to buy things for Mrs. Puff! It's all really confusing.

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: SpongeBob, I'm sorry. This is my fault. I'm not thinking clearly. I'm making a sailor's promise, boy. From this moment on, I won't ask you to buy anything for Mrs. Puff!

speaker: Narrator
line: A few moments later...

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: [happily as hearts float in the background] SpongeBob! Mrs. Puff needs a new fur coat! [After SpongeBob buys one, Krabs is mad and flaming dollars float in the background]

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: You're spending all me money! [happily] Puffy needs a new pair of shoes! [SpongeBob gets the shoes]

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: [angrily] You're breaking me boy! [happily] She needs fine jewelry! [SpongeBob gets the jewelry] Not that fine! [SpongeBob runs back and forth, speeding up, carrying various items as Mr. Krabs keeps yelling his name. He eventually becomes too tired to move] SpongeBob! [SpongeBob comes back with a pink umbrella] SpongeBob! SpongeBob! [SpongeBob comes back with a bicycle] SpongeBob! SpongeBob! [SpongeBob comes back with a purple surfboard] SpongeBob! SpongeBob! [SpongeBob comes back with a grandfather clock] SpongeBob! SpongeBob! [SpongeBob comes back with an anchor barbell] SpongeBob! SpongeBob! [SpongeBob comes back with a TV] SpongeBob! SpongeBob! [SpongeBob comes back and forth with lots of presents] SpongeBob! SpongeBob! SpongeBob! SpongeBob! SpongeBob!

speaker: [his voice echoes, and SpongeBob is seen sitting on the ground, his arms stretched, and he is panting]
Mr. Krabs
line: [runs up, his eyes are shaped like hearts] SpongeBob! I'm glad I caught you. I want you to buy Mrs. Puff...

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Wait! Don't tell me. You want me to run down to the store and buy Mrs. Puff something she doesn't need! Then you want me to run back here so you can say, [imitating Mr. Krabs] "Arrgh, SpongeBob! You're spending all me money!" And then I'll say, "But Mr. Krabs, I'm only doing what you said!" Then you'll say, "We're not talking about this..." [Makes the square] ..."Or this"... [Makes the triangle] ..."we're talking about this!" [He squiggles all over the screen. The screen fades out for a moment. Fades back in to see SpongeBob panting with Mr. Krabs.]

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: But lad, this time's different! Mrs. Puff needs this! [Cut to Mrs. Puff who has many unneeded, expensive items surrounding her]

speaker: Mrs. Puff
line: Are we going to the park soon?

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Please lad, I'm begging you! I'm a lonely old crustacean who's found love! Don't let me lose her! [Starts to cry]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Mr. Krabs, don't. Don't cry, Mr. Krabs! Come on. Ok, I, I'm going to get it, see? [Walks offscreen, and comes back with a washing machine] Cheer up, Mr. Krabs! Here's that washing machine you wanted!

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Cheer up? How can I cheer up... when you're spending all me hard-earned cash?!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: See?! You just did it again!

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Lad, I can't help it if you're loose with other people's money. [SpongeBob gets a blank expression on his face] Do you think Mrs. Puff will need a dryer to go along with that?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Well, Mr. Krabs. Do you want to know what I think? [screams] Arrgh! Regga flebba breeka brecka smullen-ellen Mr. Krabs! Yegga hegga mergin wallet! Dimmy middy spend! Rivy flivy diva shiva Mr. Krabs Wallet! [During SpongeBob's rage, Mrs. Puff looks up these words in the dictionary that Mr. Krabs bought her, and gasps and turns bright red. SpongeBob angrily walks past Mrs. Puff while muttering, and Mr. Krabs' mouth is agape]

speaker: Mrs. Puff
line: I didn't know SpongeBob had such a colorful vocabulary. Actually, there's something I'd like to say too, Mr. Krabs. [Takes off her fur coat, shoes and hat] I'm afraid I just don't feel comfortable accepting all these gifts. I'd rather go Dutch, if you don't mind. [Hands him some money from her purse]

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Uh, OK.

speaker: Mrs. Puff
line: You're a very sweet man, Mr. Krabs. [Mrs. Puff kisses him and his eyes bend into the shape of a heart]

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: [as his eyes make a heart] Aawww...

speaker: Mrs. Puff
line: Ok, class, quiet, quiet. Now get out your pencil and paper and write down the assignment. [class groans]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [leans towards Peterson] Did you hear that? We get an assignment!

speaker: Mrs. Puff
line: Everyone must write an essay on what not to do at a stoplight. [class groans again]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [again leaning towards Peterson] Did you hear that? What not to do at a stoplight?

speaker: Mrs. Puff
line: In no less than 800 words. [squeals and class groans again]

speaker: Peterson
line: [acting like SpongeBob] Did you hear that? 800 words!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Yeah, I know!

speaker: Mrs. Puff
line: Due tomorrow. And remember class work hard and no goofing off.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: OK Gary, no goofing off! I am about to write the greatest essay of all time. Like most great essays, it will be written on paper. Even more important than the paper is [holds up a pencil] the pencil. A pencil as sharp or as dull as I like. Hmm.. funny... as my ideas grow, you shrink. [kisses the pencil as little hearts fly out of it] Well, I couldn't have asked for a more beautiful day to write an essay. [looks at window, it's colorful outside] OK, here we go. What. Not. To do. At. A. Spotlight. Hey this is easy! By SpongeBob SquarePants. Hah! This essay is pure gold! And now pencil, get ready to do your stuff because here we go! [SpongeBob's clock is shown. Several hours pass and has still only written 8 words] Gee, this is harder than I thought... [looks outside. There is a carnival. Squidward is suntanning. A boy is eating ice cream. Jellyfish are playing tennis. Gary is riding on a ball and playing a horn. Patrick is rubbing Sandy with sunscreen]

speaker: Patrick
line: Come on, SpongeBob! [SpongeBob sinks back down out of sight of the window]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: It should be against the law to have to write an essay on such a super sailorific, sunshiny day. Oh! But I must press onward, because with this pencil, and the completion of this essay, I'll be one step closer to my driver's license! [a live-action drag race is shown. a car hits a wall, tumbles and gets back up. cut back to SpongeBob] Oh, yeah. This'll be no problemo. Why, I've got plenty of time. It's only-six o'clock! [cuts to SpongeBob's ticking clock, then back to SpongeBob at his desk] Okay, here we go, here we go. [SpongeBob struggles to write] Bah! I know! I just need to get a little blood pumpin' in the old noodle. How about some calisthenics? [does calisthenics. While doing it, he recites Hup Ho several times. His nose and eyelashes do the same thing.] I can feel those juices pumpin' now! [moves his chair closer to the table. he does it a lot because of the fun noise it makes. He then laughs] Huh? What am I doing?! I've gotta write that paper! [pushes his chair in] Come on pencil, make words.

speaker: Gary
line: Meow.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Gary! Hey hey hey Gary! How's my favorite mollusk? How about you let ol' SpongeBob fix you up something to eat?

speaker: Gary
line: Meow.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: What do you mean you're not hungry?

speaker: Gary
line: Meow.

speaker: Patrick
line: Who is that? [picks up phone] Hello?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Hey, Patrick, whatchya up to?

speaker: Patrick
line: Sleeping.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: That's really fascinating, are you having a good sleep? Any dreams you'd like to discuss, I remember on the...

speaker: Patrick
line: SpongeBob, you and I both know that you're just choosing me as a distraction so you don't have to write your essay.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [gasps] That is-that is not true! I called to have an engaging conversation with you!

speaker: Patrick
line: Well, I'm listening.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Uh...Marco!

speaker: Patrick
line: Polo! [hangs up]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Yeah, well I gotta get going Patrick, got an important essay to write? [hangs up phone] Sheesh, what a chatterbox. Can't he see that I'm busy? [back to his desk with eraser shavings on his paper] I can't write with all these eraser shavings all over my paper! Now they're floating around my thinking space. [blows them away] So long Pesky Particles! [floats back to SpongeBob chokes on one] I swallowed one! I'm choking! Water, water! [goes to the kitchen and drinks water] That was a close one.

speaker: Gary
line: Meow.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: What do you mean 'overly dramatic?' Gary? All that choking sure made me hungry.

speaker: Gary
line: Meow.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: I can't write on an empty stomach Gary, I gotta have my brain food! Now let's see...White or rye bread...or pumpernickel. Gee, I guess it really depends on the meat inside... and the cheese [doorbell rings] A visitor? For me!? [SpongeBob opens the door to meet a mailfish] Hello!

speaker: Mailfish
line: Package for Mr. SquarePants.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Great thanks! So, uh, do you like delivering mail?

speaker: Mailfish
line: It puts bread on the table.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Rye or pumpernickel? [laughs]

speaker: Maifish
line: Oh brother..

speaker: SpongeBob
line: So, do you deliver your own mail or do you have your own mail person? But then who delivers his mail? Is there a never-ending chain of mailmen delivering mail to other mailmen? Well I guess a P.O. box could in theory break the chain...

speaker: Mailfish
line: Don't you have a paper to write? [He walks away]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [gulps and zooms in on his face] How did he know I'm supposed to be writing an essay? [blipping his eyes and slides back into his house]

speaker: Johnny Elaine
line: In other news, local resident SpongeBob SquarePants only has a few hours left to complete his essay, and yet he continues to goof off. [head sticks out TV] When will he learn?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Hi-yah! [karate chops the TV causing a zap and glass breaking. lights a candle]

speaker: Chair
