line: Hey, SpongeBob? Over here! Come on, take a seat, put your feet up and relax.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [gasps and a bell rings and drops the candle that went out and the clock lights up] Oh no! Midnight! [running in the hallway and the alarms ring on the walls] Must.. get... back to desk! [runs to the table, but it has enlarged. he jumps up on the chair] Whew, that was a close call. [his pants are missing] Ah! My pants!

speaker: Pants
line: Yoo hoo! Down here!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: You get up here! I've got to get back to work!

speaker: Pants
line: [runs out of SpongeBob's Pineapple to the door] Freedom!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [runs out the door] Stop Pants, you get back here this instant! Paaants...! [door closes, SpongeBob yelps, then tries to get back in, but it is locked. looks in the window. the candle is still lighting the clock spins and breaks that came to life]

speaker: Clock
line: [ghostly voice] Time's up, SpongeBob...

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [gasps the candle melts]

speaker: Fire Wick
line: Only 799 words to go! [laughs sinisterly and he burns essay and the inside of his pineapple burns]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: No! [as his house burns, he screams] What have I done?! [SpongeBob runs around his house, yelling] Help! Help! My house is on fire! [continues running around his burnt house until it comes to life]

speaker: House
line: SpongeBob, why? Why did you set me on fire, SpongeBob?! Why didn't you just write your essay?! STOP WASTING TIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIME!!!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [wakes up] Where's my essay! Oh, there you are! [laughs] I must have dozed off. [grabs his paper from his head] Lets see where are we? [holding his paper with a word "The" is still there, puts the paper down on the desk] Do I dare look at the clock..? [gasps] It's almost 9 o' clock! Class starts in 5 minutes! How am I going to write this whole paper in 5 minutes? How am I supposed to know what to do at a stoplight?? Feeding your snail is something not to do at a stoplight! [writing] And making a sandwich, and lighting candles, and drinking water, and calling your friends, and karate chopping the TV, and shootin' the breeze with the mailman, and fallin' asleep... [cut to SpongeBob running to the boating school] Mrs. Puff! Mrs. Puff! I'm finished! All 800 words! I'm finished! Here it is! [goes inside, but nobody is there] Huh? Mrs. Puff? Where is everybody?

speaker: Mrs. Puff
line: Oh, there you are SpongeBob.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Here you go, Mrs. Puff! 800 words! All about stoplights and what not to do at 'em.

speaker: Mrs. Puff
line: I'm sorry, SpongeBob. I tried to call you.. I have to go to a teacher's convention!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: But what about my essay?

speaker: Mrs. Puff
line: I decided to cancel the assignment. We're just going to take a field trip to a stoplight instead. See you next week!

speaker: Chair
line: Hey, SpongeBob? Over here! Come on, take a seat, put your feet up and relax.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [gasps and a bell rings and drops the candle that went out and the clock lights up] Oh no! Midnight! [running in the hallway and the alarms ring on the walls] Must.. get... back to desk! [runs to the table, but it has enlarged. he jumps up on the chair] Whew, that was a close call. [his pants are missing] Ah! My pants!

speaker: Pants
line: Yoo hoo! Down here!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: You get up here! I've got to get back to work!

speaker: Pants
line: [runs out of SpongeBob's Pineapple to the door] Freedom!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [runs out the door] Stop Pants, you get back here this instant! Paaants...! [door closes, SpongeBob yelps, then tries to get back in, but it is locked. looks in the window. the candle is still lighting the clock spins and breaks that came to life]

line: [ghostly voice] Time's up, SpongeBob...

line: [gasps the candle melts]

line: Only 799 words to go! [laughs sinisterly and he burns essay and the inside of his pineapple burns]

line: No! [As his house burns, he screams] What have I done?! [SpongeBob runs around his house, yelling] Help! Help! My house is on fire! [continues running around his burnt house until it comes to life]

line: SpongeBob, why? Why did you set me on fire, SpongeBob?! Why didn't you just write your essay?! STOP WASTING TIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIME!!!

line: [wakes up] Where's my essay! Oh, there you are! [laughs] I must have dozed off. [grabs his paper from his head] Lets see where are we? [Writing] And making a sandwich, and lighting candles, and drinking water, and calling your friends, and karate chopping the TV, and shootin' the breeze with the mailman, and fallin' asleep... [cut to SpongeBob running to the boating school] Mrs. Puff! Mrs. Puff! I'm finished! All 800 words! I'm finished! Here it is! [goes inside, but nobody is there] Huh? Mrs. Puff? Where is everybody?

line: But what about my essay?

speaker: [SpongeBob rips his essay. He then rips himself]

line: [leans towards Peterson] Did you hear that? We get an assignment!

line: OK Gary, no goofing off! I am about to write the greatest essay of all time. Like most great essays, it will be written on paper. [kisses the pencil as little hearts fly out of it] Well, I couldn't have asked for a more beautiful day to write an essay. [looks at window, it's colorful outside] OK, here we go. What. Not. To do. At. A. Spotlight. Hey this is easy! By SpongeBob SquarePants. Hah! This essay is pure gold!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [moves his chair closer to the table. he does it a lot because of the fun noise it makes. He then laughs] Huh? What am I doing?! I've gotta write that paper! [pushes his chair in] Come on pencil, make words.

speaker: Gary
line: Meow.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Gary! Hey hey hey Gary! How's my favorite mollusk? How about you let ol' SpongeBob fix you up something to eat?

speaker: Gary
line: Meow.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: What do you mean you're not hungry?

speaker: Gary
line: Meow.

line: Hey, Patrick, whatchya up to?

speaker: Patrick
line: Sleeping.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: That's really fascinating, are you having a good sleep? Any dreams you'd like to discuss, I remember on the...

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [gasps] That is-that is not true! I called to have an engaging conversation with you!

speaker: SpongeBob

[blows them away] So long Pesky Particles! [floats back to SpongeBob chokes on one] I swallowed one! I'm choking! Water, water! [goes to the kitchen and drinks water] That was a close one.

speaker: Gary
line: Meow.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: What do you mean 'overly dramatic?' Gary? All that choking sure made me hungry.

speaker: Gary
line: Meow.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: I can't write on an empty stomach Gary, I gotta have my brain food! Now let's see...White or rye bread...or pumpernickel. Gee, I guess it really depends on the meat inside... and the cheese [doorbell rings] A visitor? For me!? [SpongeBob opens the door to meet a mailfish] Hello!

speaker: Mailfish
line: Package for Mr. SquarePants.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Great thanks! So, uh, do you like delivering mail?

speaker: Mailfish
line: It puts bread on the table.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Rye or pumpernickel? [laughs]

speaker: Maifish
line: Oh brother..

speaker: SpongeBob
line: So, do you deliver your own mail or do you have your own mail person? But then who delivers his mail? Is there a never-ending chain of mailmen delivering mail to other mailmen? Well I guess a P.O. box could in theory break the chain...

speaker: Mailfish
line: Don't you have a paper to write? [He walks away]

line: [Gulps and zooms in on his face] How did he know I'm supposed to be writing an essay? [blipping his eyes and slides back into his house]

Patrick
line: NEED... FURNITURE! [makes a lamp post model out of the sand, then licks it to make it remain in shape; he then makes a sand drawer, television, stool, and a couch. The whole time he is still frantically mumbling]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Patrick, what's with the home improvement? [Patrick barks like a dog and continues to clean] Hey, Patrick!

speaker: Patrick
line: Oooooooh, sweep sweep! [Sweeps around the walls of his house and the air]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Patrick, I came over to see if you wanted to go jellyfishing. But I can see you're busy having an episode.

speaker: Patrick
line: [Stops cleaning. His face turns mad] You know something, SpongeBob? It's just all fun and games for you. Nothing really matters. [imitates SpongeBob] "Oh, let's go jellyfishing! We don't have any work to do! Life is just a big bowl of fancy assorted cashews, and nobody has anything to dust or to clean or to wipe! Or fabricate!"

speaker: SpongeBob
line: But, Patrick, the only thing I've ever seen you clean is your plate.

speaker: Patrick
line: [Patrick snaps out of being angry and starts crying] I don't know what to do, SpongeBob. You gotta to help me!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [gasps] Patrick! You forgot how to eat again! Come on, we'll get the funnel.

speaker: Patrick
line: No, it's not that, SpongeBob; it's worse.

line: Darn, I like the funnel. Well, what is it, then?

speaker: Patrick
line: Look! [Takes out a rolled-up piece of paper from his belly button]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Hey, a note! [A sixteenth note is shown]

speaker: Patrick
line: Yeah, but turn it over, there's a letter! [The letter B is shown]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: You're right!

speaker: Patrick
line: And, I got this message from my parents! [Hands out a smaller letter]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Your parents? [Reads the note out loud] "Dear Patrick, your mom and I are coming out tomorrow for Starfish Day. Please try to remember, but don't try too hard, or you'll hurt yourself like last time. Love, Daddy."

speaker: Patrick
line: SpongeBob, my parents think I'm dumber than a sack of diapers.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: No, they don't, Patrick. Parents just like to push your buttons. Like this! [pushes Patrick's nipples and his eyes elongate] Nauuugh!

speaker: Patrick
line: [Laughing] That always cheers me up. [His eyes go back to normal] But not today.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Patrick, if your parents think you're dumb, then they must not know what dumb really is.

speaker: Patrick
line: But don't they watch television?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: That's what I'm saying, Pat! If your parents got to meet a real dummy, they'd realize what a genius you really are!

speaker: Patrick
line: But don't geniuses live in a lamp? And besides, we don't know any dumb people.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Don't worry, Patrick! I'll be the dummy! When your parents see how dumb I act, they'll think you're the smartest guy ever!

speaker: Patrick
line: Math is power!

speaker: [Bubble transition to the next day. Patrick is in front of his mirror]
Patrick
line: A, B, C, D, E, F, G... [Doorbell rings] Oh! H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O...!

speaker: Janet
line: Should I get the bullhorn again, Marty?

speaker: Patrick
line: W, X, Y and Z! [Marty doesn't realize the door has been opened and knocks on Patrick's head] Hi Mom. Hi Dad.

speaker: Marty
line: Son! You recognized us this time!

speaker: Patrick
line: Why wouldn't I recognize my own parents?

speaker: Marty
line: You never were a bright one. [Patrick groans. Marty laughs] Well, aren't you gonna show us inside?

line: He probably forgot where it is.

line: Well I know where it...

line: Oh, let me lead the way so we don't get lost. [Patrick, Marty and Janet hold hands] Huh? Hold hands now! [Inside the house] Okay, we're almost there! Let go on three. One... two... three! [Marty and Janet let go of Patrick's hands on three]

line: Good job!

line: Pats for Patrick! [Both laugh as Patrick looks annoyed]

line: I'll go get the beverages. [Patrick leaves, then comes back with a tray with three drinks on it]

speaker: Marty
line: Wow, son! You put the drinks in something this time! Ah, son, you must've been working all night to put these together for us.

speaker: Janet and Marty
line: We love you! [Both kiss Patrick as he looks even more annoyed and groans]

line: [Doorbell rings] Hooray, the idiot's here! I mean, I'll get it!

SpongeBob
line: Protective helmet, check.

speaker: Gary
line: Meow.

line: I'm supposed to look stupid, Gary!

line: Meow? [Goes back to SpongeBob's house]

line: What could go wrong? [Patrick's rock opens]

speaker: Patrick
line: What a surprise!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Hi.

line: Mom, Dad, meet my neighbor, SpongeBob!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Hi.

speaker: Marty
line: Hello there!

speaker: Janet
line: How do you do?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Hi. [Walks to Patrick's parents]

speaker: Marty
line: Put 'er there. [SpongeBob puts a doll on his hand]

line: Mama! Mama!

speaker: Patrick
line: He means "shake". [SpongeBob shakes his entire body] No, SpongeBob, no! Shake hands! [SpongeBob shakes both his hands] No, SpongeBob! Grab my dad's hand. [Puts both his hands and his left leg on Marty's hand] Grab it with only one hand! [Puts his left leg and hand down] Good boy! Now move your arm up and down! [He moves his shoulder up and down. Patrick giggles]

speaker: Janet
line: So, SpongeBob. Do you live nearby?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Hi.

speaker: Patrick
line: No, SpongeBob. Show them your house! [SpongeBob pulls up his pants and reveals a blouse] No, not your blouse! Your house! [SpongeBob screams and runs over to his house. He runs into the shell and gets stuck]

speaker: Janet
line: He lives in a fruit?

speaker: Marty
line: That's unhealthy.

speaker: Patrick
line: [Giggling goofily] Hey, SpongeBob! You wanna stay for dinner? [SpongeBob babbles like an idiot. Later, Patrick, Marty and Janet are watching television while eating TV dinners]

speaker: Marty
line: Does he always do that after he eats?

speaker: Patrick
line: Only on Wednesday. [Pan over to SpongeBob pushing his nose to reveal his underwear. When he lets go, his pants pull up by themselves. This is repeated a few times. SpongeBob makes an alarm sound after that. Patrick giggles]

speaker: Marty
line: [Starts giggling with Patrick] Uh, Patrick, I think your friend might be broken.

speaker: Patrick
line: Yeah. And it would take more than some masking tape to fix that guy. [SpongeBob balances on his nose while making a fire truck siren sound. Makes other various sounds, including a cat yowl sound]

speaker: Marty
line: Whoa! Is he gonna be okay?

speaker: Patrick
line: Oh, that's nothing. [Dolphin chirping] You should see him in the morning prancing around yelling "I'm ready! I'm ready! I'm ready!" [Rooster crows] He drives all the neighbors crazy! [Horn] Why, just the other day, our neighbor Squidward was--- [SpongeBob jumps backwards over Patrick, Janet and Marty while making an elephant trumpet sound, then he crashes on the floor]. ---was really no help for him. [SpongeBob makes imprints of his front and back twice on the wall] I mean, look at the way he's dressed. Only somebody with holes drilled in their head would wear that stuff! And how about his shape! I mean, I've heard of barrel-chested, [Shows closeup of SpongeBob's pants] but never box-chested! [Janet, Marty and Patrick laugh. SpongeBob frowns] Hey, SpongeBob do you have any mascara I could borrow? [Makes his eyebrows sound like elastic rubber bands]

speaker: Marty
line: [Chuckles] The boy wears make-up?

speaker: Janet
line: What a card! [Everyone laughs, except SpongeBob, who's now very annoyed]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [Confused] Hey, Patrick! Patrick!

speaker: Patrick
line: Aw, he said my name.

line: Wow, how'd you train him to do that?

speaker: [SpongeBob is mad. He bites Patrick's finger]
Patrick
line: Ow! He bit me!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Patrick, meet me in the kitchen!

speaker: Patrick
line: Oh, I guess the dummy wants to have a private conversation. [Janet and Marty laugh] A dumb one! [They laugh again, as SpongeBob and Patrick enter the kitchen] So, what's on your mind? Oh, wait, I already know the answer. Nothing! [Patrick laughs very hard] See, that's funny. 'Cause your dumb!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Patrick, could you let up on the insults just a little bit?

speaker: Patrick
line: Oh, were those too complicated for you? I'll try dumb-ing them down a bit.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Patrick, I get the feeling that you think I really am dumb! [glances at Patrick's t-shirt, "I'M WITH THE DUMMY" with an arrow pointing towards SpongeBob]

speaker: Patrick
line: That's just what I'd expect you to say. Dumb people are always blissfully unaware of how dumb they really are. [drools]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: I'm only pretending to be dumb! It was our plan, remember?!

speaker: Patrick
line: Oh, SpongeBob, if only you could see how stupid you sound right now, with your talk of imaginary plans. Tell you what. You've caught me at a good mood. I'll humor you. Go on, go out there and act "smart" for everyone.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Ok, I will! [Takes off his helmet]

speaker: Patrick
line: [Puts on helmet] And don't worry, I'll keep this warm for ya!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [In front of Janet and Marty, clears throat] I have a confession to make. I lied about being stupid. I just acted like a fool so you would appreciate Patrick a little bit more. I know how to talk, and eat, and do laundry. I even separate the darks from the lights. So what do you say we start over and try again? Hi! My name is SpongeBob SquarePants. And I am not a dummy.

speaker: Marty
line: [laughs] Amazing! Three minutes in the kitchen and our son has taught him to talk in complete sentences. [Puts his right thumb up] Oh, good work, son!

speaker: Patrick
line: [Puts his left thumb up] It wasn't easy, dad.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [sputtering] But... but, but, but, but, but, but...

speaker: Janet
line: It looks like it's time for your next lesson, young man!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Now, listen to me! I'm not dumb! I have a brain! See, here's a picture of it! [He shows them a small picture of his brain]

speaker: Patrick
line: That must be actual size. [All except SpongeBob laughs]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: No! It's normal size and fully functional, watch. [Writes on Patrick's chalkboard] 2 plus 2 equals 4.

speaker: Marty
line: Hoho, son! You taught him math too!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Noooo!

speaker: Marty
line: And you taught him to sing! [SpongeBob is blabbering and sputtering, then starts tensing up] Oh, now he's short-circuiting! You must have taught him a little too much.

speaker: [SpongeBob imagines them all laughing hard. Marty and Janet look at each other and laugh; then they all do the can-can. He imagines the three popping out of SpongeBob's pores. SpongeBob is inside Janet, who is laughing, inside Marty, who is also laughing, inside Patrick, who is also laughing, inside his eye.]
SpongeBob
line: [Screams at the top of his voice, then starts running towards the wall, crashing through the wall outside, running all the way back home]

speaker: Marty
line: You know, son, I've always known that when it comes to brightness, well, you're about a three-watt. But this guy! He's a wet match in a dark cave. He makes phone operators seem smart! [clears his throat] But more importantly, son, he's shown me what a sharp, quick-witted boy you've become. [Hugs him] Ha! I feel like I'm really meeting you for the first time. Isn't that right, Janet?

speaker: Janet
line: You bet, Marty!

speaker: Patrick
line: [His eyes widen] Janet? Marty? Who are you people?!

speaker: Janet
line: Marty! I'm scared! [Doorbell rings, then the rock opens up. Squidward, Herb and Margie are outside his rock]

speaker: Squidward
line: Excuse me. Does this lovely couple belong to you? They've been standing outside my house saying "Where's Patrick?" all day! It's driving me nuts!

speaker: Patrick
line: Mom! Dad!

speaker: Herb
line: Wow, son! You actually recognized us this time.

speaker: Margie
line: And you remembered to get dressed today! [Patrick, Herb and Margie laugh]

speaker: Marty
line: Oh, that's right, honey. We don't have a son.

speaker: Janet
line: Oh yeah! [Both walk away. Patrick and his parents laugh as their rock closes over them, then the screen fades to black, ending the episode]

line: Well, it's the worst time of the day once again. [cringes as he changes the "Open" sign to "Closed"] Closing time!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Well, see you in the A.M., Mr. Krabs.

line: Hold on there, SpongeBob! [pulls SpongeBob back in a creepy manner] Take that pile of filth out with you. [Squidward holds up a trash bag with flies flying around it]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [gasps] Mr. Krabs, you shouldn't talk about Squidward like that!

speaker: Squidward
line: He means this filth, you loon. [He drops the bag on the floor]

speaker: [SpongeBob goes to the dumpster while bringing the trash bag]
SpongeBob
line: [singing] Takin' out the trash, takin' out the trash.

speaker: [SpongeBob throws the trash in the dumpster and then looks at some writings on the dumpster]
SpongeBob
line: Hmm...dumpster writing! The voice of the people! "Up with bubbles, down with air!" [laughs] "Nematodes are people too!" [laughs] Ha, those Nematodes... Here's one someone didn't finish! Squidward smells. [writes the word "good" after "smells"] Good. [laughs] Hmm, what's this one? Krabs is a... hmm? Krabs is a [dolphin chirp].

line: [Clearly disgusted] Do you kiss your mother with that mouth?

line: Well, sometimes, but not... Recently.

speaker: Patrick
line: Hi, garbage man. Hi, SpongeBob.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Hi, Patrick! Hey, Patrick, do you know what this word means?

speaker: Patrick
line: "Krabs..." Uh, isn't that the red sweaty guy you work for?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [pointing to "Krabs," then the unseen word as they are said] Nah-uh, not that word, that word.

speaker: Patrick
line: Hmm... [dolphin chirp]! Oh, hey! I think I know what that means. That's one of those sentence enhancers.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Sentence enhancers?

line: You use them when you want to talk fancy. You just sprinkle it over anything you say, and Wham-o! You've got yourself a spicy sentence sandwich!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Oh, I get it! Let me try. [clears his throat] Hello, Patrick. Lovely [dolphin chirp] day we're having, isn't it?

speaker: Patrick
line: Why, yes it is, SpongeBob. This [dolphin chirp] day is particularly [dolphin chirp] lovely!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: How [dolphin chirp] right you are, Patrick!

speaker: [The two say the word a couple of times]
SpongeBob
line: Ooh, You're right, Patrick, my lips are tingling from the spiciness of this conversation.

speaker: Patrick
line: Oh, mine too!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: It tingles when I laugh!

SpongeBob
line: Hello, customers, nice [dolphin chirp] day we're having, uh? [The customers stop eating and stare in shock]
