line: [gasps] Did he just say?!

speaker: Pirate Fish
line: Aye, he did.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Hey, Patrick, how the [dolphin chirp] are ya?

speaker: Patrick
line: [sitting at table at the Krusty Krab] Pretty [dolphin chirp] good, SpongeBob.

speaker: Old Man Jenkins
line: I thought this was a restaurant, not a gutter mouth convention.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [taps on the microphone and speaks into it] Attention, customers, today's special is a [dolphin chirp] Krabby Patty served in a greasy [dolphin chirp] sauce and grilled to [dolphin chirp] perfection. [a mother octopus covers her laughing children's ears and puts soda on one since she doesn't have enough hands] And don't forget to ask us to [dolphin chirp] the [dolphin chirp] fries. It will be our [dolphin chirp] pleasure. [Squidward hears the intercom and a giant human ear pops out of his head; he pushes it back in] Hi Squidward, how the [dolphin chirp] are ya?

speaker: Patrick
line: Nice [dolphin chirp] day we're having, isn't it Squidward?

speaker: Tom
line: I don't understand. That guy's talented, he doesn't have to work blue.

speaker: Evelyn
line: Let's go somewhere more family oriented. [Everyone leaves the Krusty Krab, grumbling in frustration]

speaker: Female Fish
line: [chattering (variously and) inaudibly] I'm never eating here again.

speaker: Male Fish
line: [chattering (variously and) inaudibly] Those foul-mouth bottom feeders.

speaker: [The Krusty Krab customer meter is running down. Sirens wail and a red light flashes]
Mr. Krabs
line: [in the bathroom, hears the sirens] Huh? Ah! The Krusty Krab, she's empty! [runs to dining room] All hands on deck! Batten the front doors! Brace the cash register! Break out the happy snacks! Squidward, where have all me money paying customers gone?

speaker: Squidward
line: Apparently, the two barnacle-mouth brothers just learned a new word, and SpongeBob just said it over the intercom.

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Well, what was it? What'd he say?

speaker: Squidward
line: Er...he said...um, well he said...

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Huh? [Squidward whispers it again. Mr. Krabs gasps] SpongeBob and friend! Front and center! Why, I oughta make the two of you paint the Krusty Krab for using such language!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: But Mr. Krabs, we were only using our sentence enhancers.

speaker: Patrick
line: Yeah, it's fancy talk.

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: There ain't nothing fancy about that word!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: You mean [dolphin chirp]?

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Yes, that one! Now quit saying that! It's a bad word!

speaker: SpongeBob and Patrick
line: Bad word?! [both start wiping their tongues]

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Yes sirree, that's bad word number 11. In fact, there are 13 bad words you should never use.

speaker: Squidward
line: Don't you mean there are only 7?

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Not if you're a sailor! [laughs]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Wow, 13!

speaker: Patrick
line: That's a lot of [dolphin chirp] bad words!

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: OK, boys. I want you to promise me you'll never use that word again.

speaker: SpongeBob and Patrick
line: We promise.

speaker: [later at SpongeBob's house, SpongeBob and Patrick are playing Eels and Escalators]
SpongeBob
line: Gee, I'm glad Mr. Krabs told us that word we were using was a bad word!

speaker: Patrick
line: Yeah, me too, because classy sophisticates like us shouldn't stain our lips with cursing.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Yea, verily! Now, let's play a nice, wholesome game of Eels and Escalators.

speaker: Patrick
line: Oh, boy, my favorite! [Flops arms up and down like a seal]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Come on, Gary needs a new pair of shoes! [rolls the dice]

speaker: Patrick
line: Oh, eels. Too bad, SpongeBob, you gotta ride the eel.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Darn. [moves game piece to eel]

speaker: Patrick
line: My turn! [rolls dice] Hooray! Escalators! Yay! [screams] Up, up, up!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Come on, escalators, escalators, escalators! [rolls dice] [sighs] Eels again.

speaker: Patrick
line: My turn! [rolls dice] Escalators!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Escalators, Escalators, Escalators! [throws dice] Eels?

speaker: Patrick
line: [rolls dice] Es-skee-lators!! [moves to escalators] Well, this is your last chance, SpongeBob, or if you get eels again, you lose!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [gets frustrated while rolling the dice] Escalators, escalators, escalators!! [dice is thrown and lands on escalators] Ha! Escalators! [dice turn over to eels]

speaker: Patrick
line: Eels...

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Ah, [dolphin chirp]! [covers his mouth when he realizes his mistake]

speaker: Patrick
line: Ooooh...! You said number 11!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [babbles for Patrick to understand] I didn't mean... you gotta understand, Patrick, I was trying...what I meant to say was...some things just slip out. You gotta understand!

speaker: Patrick
line: Don't worry SpongeBob, I understand. [pause] Mr. Krabs! [runs out the door] Mr. Krabs! Mr. Krabs! Mr. Krabs! [starts running to the Krusty Krab]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [starts running after him] No wait, Patrick! [after SpongeBob catches up to Patrick] Patrick, no, please don't tell!

speaker: Patrick
line: But, you said "[dolphin chirp]"! [Covers his mouth as he realizes his mistake]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Aha! Now I'm gonna tell Mr. Krabs on you!

speaker: Patrick
line: Not if I tell first!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: I can run faster than you! [laughs]

speaker: Patrick
line: [riding in an ice cream truck] See ya at the Krusty Krab! Ha, ha, ha! [the truck goes the wrong way] Oh no!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [laughs] Mr. Krabs, Mr. Krabs, Mr. Krabs!

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: What, what, what?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Patrick, Patrick, Patrick!

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Yes, yes, yes?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: He said, he said, he said!

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Out with it, boy!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [talking fast] Me and Patrick were playing Eels and Escalators, and Patrick was going up-up-up, and I had to ride the eel and then we ran and Patrick, he said some things.

speaker: Mr.Krabs
line: [eyes SpongeBob] What kind of things?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Well, he said...

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Yes?!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Well, uh, let's just say he said a certain word that you said we shouldn't say, and this particular word happens to be number 11 in the 13 words you said shouldn't be said.

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Uh... Right, now what was that part about the, um... Who now?

speaker: Patrick
line: [walks in door of the Krusty Krab and eats an ice cream cone but throws away the cone] Mr. Krabs, Mr. Krabs, Mr. Krabs! [Mr. Krabs sighs]

speaker: SpongeBob and Patrick
line: He said that word that you said we shouldn't say...!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: ...number thirteen...

speaker: [They babble on about the word, as Mr. Krabs stares on disapprovingly, until the two are just pointing at each other and yelling, "Dah-dah-dah-dah-dah-dah-dah-dah-dah-dah!" Mr. Krabs eventually grabs their lips to quiet them.]
SpongeBob and Patrick
line: Mmm-mmm...!

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Now I'm gonna let go of yer lips, and when I do, I want you to calmly tell me what youse need to tell me, understand?

speaker: SpongeBob and Patrick
line: Mmm-hmm... [Mr. Krabs lets go of their lips, which initally deflate, then reinflate; they both point at each other again] He said "[dolphin chirp]"!

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: [gasps] Do my ears deceive me?! You two should be ashamed! Time to take out the trash. [picks SpongeBob and Patrick up by their pants and carries them outside the Krusty Krab] You two need to be taught a lesson. I thought I made it clear. Never, and I mean, never use number 11 or any of the 13 bad words! Now the both of youse wait right here. I'll be back. [walks back in Krusty Krab]

speaker: Patrick
line: What's going to happen to us?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: We'll probably get 40 lashes!

speaker: Patrick
line: Oh, no! [stupidly imagines himself with 40 large, weird eyelashes]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: I'm sorry, Patrick. Mr. Krabs was right. There's no need for words like that.

speaker: Patrick
line: I'm sorry too, SpongeBob.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Let's make a vow, Patrick. From this day forth a foul word shall never pass our lips! We'll be good citizens, just like good ol' Mr.Krabs.

speaker: Patrick
line: [shakes hands with SpongeBob] Agreed!

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: All right, you two foul mouths. As punishment for FOULING the air in me restaurant with yer foul words, you're going to give the Krusty Krab a fresh coat of paint from top to bottom. [jams his foot on a rock then hops on one leg] Ow, Ooh! Ow! My [dolphin chirps] foot! What  [dolphin chirps] genius puts a [dolphin chirps] rock in a [dolphin chirps] path?! Can't you see I got a [boat horn no. 1] foot here?! Oh! [seal bark!. Continues saying a bunch of swear words, censored out by seagulls, foghorns, ship bells, etc.; at this moment, SpongeBob and Patrick count the swear words he uses]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Five, six, seven...

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: ...a whole lotta [old-style foghorn] and with a side of [dolphin chirp], a heapin' helpin' of [ship's bell] and a boatload of [boat horn no. 4] ...

speaker: Patrick
line: Nine...

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: [seal bark, sea gull, and a new-style foghorn]! [cries in pain]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [cuts to SpongeBob with 13 fingers] That's all 13, Patrick!! [gasps] We're gonna tell your mom, Mr. Krabs!

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: [worried] No, please, not me mommy! [SpongeBob and Patrick laugh as they run to Mama Krabs' house, Mr. Krabs runs after them] Wait, please don't tell me mother! I don't think her little old heart can take it!

speaker: SpongeBob and Patrick
line: [repeatedly banging on the door] Mama Krabs, Mama Krabs!

speaker: Mama Krabs
line: Why, hello there!

speaker: [SpongeBob, Patrick and Mr. Krabs all explain the situation at the same time, swearing numerous times as they do so!]
SpongeBob
line: Mama Krabs, he said [dolphin chirp] and then he said [dolphin chirps] again and said [dolphin chirps] and then he screamed at the top of his voice [foghorn blows]! And he--(horn honks)--Mrs. Krabs, he didn't care! Such a stream of [seagull caws, foghorn, ship's bell] I have never heard in my days!

speaker: Mama Krabs
line: [shocked] Oh, dear! My poor old heart. [faints]

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: [gasps] Oh, dear Mother! What have these foul-mouthed heathens done to you? [takes a coin out of her pocket] You two should be ashamed! Making an old lady faint with your sailor talk!

speaker: Mama Krabs
line: [wakes up] You should all be ashamed! And if you're gonna talk like sailors, then you're gonna work like sailors!

speaker: [Then the three are painting her house, Patrick is painting the sand]
Mama Krabs
line: I guess you three scallywags have earned a glass of lemonade! Ah-ga-ga-ga-ga! [laughs like Popeye, then stubs her foot on a rock] Yeeeoww! My [Klaxon horn] foot!

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: [shocked] Mother!

speaker: Mama Krabs
line: What? It's Old Man Jenkins and his jalopy.

speaker: Old Man Jenkins
line: Howdy, Mrs. K! [honks the horn]

speaker: SpongeBob, Patrick, Mr. Krabs, and Mama Krabs
line: [all laugh together]

speaker: Squidward
line: Ah, how I have dreamed of this day. Mr. Tentacles, Professor of Art. What a marvelous opportunity for the people of Bikini Bottom. Bring me your huddle masses of bored house wives and I will shape them into my image. [wife's head turns into Squidward's and the husband notices] And I'll go down in history, someday. And there will be a wing with my name on it in all the museums of the world.

speaker: Janitor
line: Dude, you're teaching art at the Rec Center. Calm down.

speaker: Squidward
line: Uncultured trash urchin. 9am. Time to let the class in. Well, don't want to keep them waiting any longer. [opens door] Welcome to art class!

speaker: Nat
line: Oh, isn't this cooking? Sorry. [everyone leaves except one]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Hi, Squidward! Are you taking this art class, too?

speaker: Squidward
line: SpongeBob? In art class? Wait! This is cooking! Come back! You gotta be kidding.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [laughs] This is great! You and me in school together. So, where's the teacher?

speaker: Squidward
line: You're looking at him.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: You are the teacher? To my pupil? This isn't art class, it's Heaven.

speaker: Squidward
line: Yeah. Grab a little piece of Heaven and let's get with it.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: I'm ready, Mr. Tentacles.

speaker: Squidward
line: So, you wanna be an artist, eh, SpongeBob?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Yes, please.

speaker: Squidward
line: Well, art is not all fun and games. [as he picks up a big stack of books] It's a lot of hard... [he drops the stack, which makes SpongeBob's desk hop in the air] ...work. OK. First, repeat after me I have no talent.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: I have no talent.

speaker: Squidward
line: Mr. Tentacles has all the talent.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Mr. Tentacles has all the talent.

speaker: Squidward
line: If I'm lucky, some of Mr. Tentacles talent will rub off on me.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: If I'm lucky,  Mr. Talent will rub his tentacles on my art. [smiles. The scene cuts to Squidward with a sad look on his face, the camera cuts back to SpongeBob and he is still smiling, the camera again cuts back to Squidward]

speaker: Squidward
line: Whatever. Ok. Since you're telling me you have no prior training, we'll have to start from square one. Or should I say circle one. [draws a crooked circle, then laughs] Am I going too fast for you SpongeBob?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: How's this, Squidward?

speaker: Squidward
line: What the? How the? A perfect circle? Do it again. Show your process.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Well, first I draw this head. [draws an amazing head] Then I erase some of the more detailed features. And one, two, three. A circle, uhh, thingy.

speaker: Squidward
line: Gimme that. [crumples paper] Forget the circles.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Ooh, nice one Squidward. Let me try. [laughs] Looky, Squidward. It's you and me playing leapfrog. That's you on the bottom.

speaker: Squidward
line: Gimme that. [rips up paper] There is nothing artistic about leapfrog. [SpongeBob puts pieces together] What are you doing, now?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: I call it Rippy Bits. You take a bunch of old ripped of paper, and make a new picture out of it. See? You're on top...this...time. [blows paper]

speaker: Squidward
line: Do you want to learn art, or not?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: I'm sorry, Squidward, I'll listen.

speaker: Squidward
line: Alright, SpongeBob, pay close attention. Look at your marble. Visualize the sculpture within. And... [hits marble with tools and it becomes pieces]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [hits marble with tools and it becomes a perfect sculpture] How's this Squidward?

speaker: Squidward
line: [starry-eyed] It's beautiful! [a tear falls from his eyes] I mean, this isn't a sculpture. [SpongeBob's lip starts quivering] A good sculpture takes... more time. You can't just sculpt Willie-Nillie. You've got to go by the book. Follow the rules. [SpongeBob wipes away a tear] Otherwise, you'll never get passed Amateur Hour, here. Besides, you've got the nose wrong. [Squidward puts a nose like his on the sculpture] There, now it's art.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Ohhh, it's so obvious. I would've never thought of that. I'm sorry, Squidward. I came here to learn and I arrogantly shoved your lessons. [falls down and starts crying] I'll never be a great artist like you! I don't deserve your tutoring. I don't deserve to be in your presence. [crawls over to the front door and looks back at Squidward] I don't even deserve to use your doors! [the doors open, hitting SpongeBob out the window into the garbage dumpster head-first]

speaker: Monty
line: Hello, there.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: But I did deserve that. [the dumpster closes on top of him] I deserved that, too. [garbage man takes SpongeBob to dump] And I deserve this!

speaker: Monty
line: Good day, sir.

speaker: Squidward
line: Sorry, class dismissed. You're too late.

speaker: Monty
line: Oh, I beg your pardon, but I've forgotten my manners. My name is Monty P. Moneybags.

speaker: Squidward
line: The world famous art collector?

speaker: Monty
line: The one and only.

speaker: Squidward
line: Well, what are you doing here?

speaker: Monty
line: I'm on a shopping spree. Buying art for my new museum.

speaker: Squidward
line: Your search is over. I am Bikini Bottom's greatest artiste. I call this one "Squidward en repose".

speaker: Monty
line: I, uh, don't think that will fit in with the other pieces in my collection.

speaker: Squidward
line: Why not?

speaker: Monty
line: Because, it's an art collection. [laughs]

speaker: Squidward
line: How about this one? I call it Bold and Brash.

speaker: Monty
line: More like Belongs in the Trash. [laughs]

speaker: Janitor
line: Sorry. I must've missed that one. [grabs the painting and throws it in the trash]

speaker: Monty
line: Maybe I should be... huh? What is that?

speaker: Squidward
line: Wait, wait. That's not uh, uh...

speaker: Monty
line: Angelic form, amazing detail, perfect censorship. This is the work of a true genius. Hello? What this? This is the only flaw. [removes the nose Squidward added on and it lands on Squidward's head] Ah, that's more like it. I simply must find the artist responsible. He shall have fame.

speaker: Squidward
line: Fame. [Squidward imagines himself as popular]

speaker: Monty
line: Fortune.

speaker: Squidward
line: Fortune. [Squidward imagines himself in a tub full of money]

speaker: Monty
line: Anything his heart desires.

speaker: Squidward
line: Anything? [Squidward imagines himself with hair] It's me. It's me. I'm responsible.

speaker: Monty
line: I can see it now. Your name in the world's most prestigious museums. I'm gonna make you, immortal!! Now, uh, help me get this in the car.

speaker: Squidward
line: I could use a little help. [sculptures head falls off and turns into dust] My fame, my fortune, my hair.

speaker: Monty
line: Well, that's a bit a bad luck right there. But, this shouldn't be a problem for an artist of your magnitude. You can whip up another one.

speaker: Squidward
line: Yeah, no problem. You know, between you and me, this isn't my best work. Why don't you come back tomorrow and I'll have something that will really knock your socks off.

speaker: Monty
line: Between you and me, I'm not wearing socks. [laughs]

speaker: Squidward
line: Yeah, no socks. OK, see you tomorrow. Bye. I gotta find SpongeBob!! [at dump] SpongeBob...SpongeBob? SpongeBob!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Go away, Squidward. I don't deserve your kindness.

speaker: Squidward
line: Hey, cheer up. I have decided to give you another chance. Why, with a great teacher like me, anything is possible.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Don't look at me Squidward. Don't look at my shame. [he slides out of the cereal box] These hands weren't meant to create. They only destroy. I can't look at them. [SpongeBob's hands pop off and run into a soup can]

speaker: Squidward
line: Aww, c'mon SpongeBob. You've got yourself a pair of yellow dandies here. With my help, we'll turn them into tools of beauty.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Really?

speaker: Squidward
line: Really!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Really?

speaker: Squidward
line: Really!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Really?

speaker: Squidward
line: Really.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Wow. [pause] Really?

speaker: Squidward
line: Let's go.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [notices a painting in the dump] Squidward, look. It's ol' Bold and Brash!

speaker: Squidward
line: Gimme that. [back at classroom] Ok, SpongeBob. Just do what you did before.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: I... can't!

speaker: Squidward
line: Ah, ah. Wait, wait. Let me help. Let's start with the circle again.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: I did it, Squidward. [draws a crooked circle]

speaker: Squidward
line: Huh? But, but, what about the head...and the erasing, and the, the...

speaker: SpongeBob
line: I don't know, Squidward. That stuff's not in the book.

speaker: Squidward
line: Uhh... [crumples paper] How about this, huh? Remember?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: That's not in the book, either.

speaker: Squidward
line: Forget about the book. [rips book] Ha! Look at all this mess SpongeBob. [he grabs a chair, puts it in front of SpongeBob's desk, and jumps up and down while holding it] What do all these little bits of paper make you want to do?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Wait, I know this. Oh, wait, I think I got it. [puts book back together] Ta-da! [Squidward's nose melts off his face]

speaker: Squidward
line: OK, SpongeBob. Let's just move onto the marble.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: First, an artist must concentrate and visualize his concept.

speaker: Squidward
line: Now you've got it.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: I've gotta embrace the marble!

speaker: Squidward
line: Right.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: I've gotta sniff the marble!

speaker: Squidward
line: Well, uh, ok.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: I've gotta lick the marble!

speaker: Squidward
line: Uhh...

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [washes the marble in a washing machine] I've gotta wash the marble! I've gotta date the marble! [expands himself so that he's the same size as the marble] I've gotta be the marble! I've got it! I have see the sculpture within.

speaker: Squidward
line: Here you go, buddy. [hands him sculpting tools]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: With this tool, I shall give birth to art.

speaker: Squidward
line: Oh, boy. [SpongeBob taps marble with tool and breaks into pieces]

speaker: Monty
line: I'm here for the... what the? Who is responsible for this?

speaker: Squidward
line: As of now, it's his responsibility. [puts hat on janitor's head] Good day to you, sir. [it is revealed that when Squidward smashed all of the marble together, he created an even better sculpture than the first one and left without even seeing it]

speaker: Monty
line: [to janitor] You, sir, are the greatest artist who ever lived!

speaker: French Narrator
line: Ahh, another beautiful day in Bikini Bottom's own Jellyfish Fields. An untamed world of natural order where the little jellyfish jellies roam free across the salty seascape. And where there is jellyfish, there is the Jellyfish Hunter.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: La la la la, la la la la la! [SpongeBob catches it] You're my twelfth catch of the day. I'm gonna call you "Twelvey." [tickles it] Coochie coochie coo! [it sneezes out some jelly] Bye, Twelvey! [Twelvey stings him as it says goodbye and flies away. He sees a blue jellyfish] Oh! It's you! [He mimics the jellyfishes' style of floating, then tries to catch the blue jellyfish but fails] Well it's just you and me again, I've caught and named every jellyfish in Jellyfish Fields at least once. Except you, No Name.

speaker: No Name
line: [buzzes] [caption reads "Bring it on!"]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [yells battle cries and tries to catch it. He runs. He steps on a soda can. He then runs so fast he flies] Gotcha! [he is unsuccessful at catching it] Barnacles! How'd he do that? Someday I'll catch old No Name.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: I'm going on my lunch break, Mr. Krabs.

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: You've got 5 minutes!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Wow! One more minute than yesterday! SpongeBob ready for lunch! [he imitates a rocket launching and lifts his bag into the air] [a jar of jelly and a Krabby Patty fall out of the bag. He puts the jelly on the Krabby Patty and starts eating it.] Yum!

speaker: Fred
line: [Looks behind and stares at SpongeBob in confusion.] Hey, buddy! What the heck is that?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Why, this is a hole, sir. You see, I am a sponge, and...

speaker: Fred
line: No, not that! [points to SpongeBob's jelly patty] That!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: It's just a little ol' Krabby Patty with Jellyfish Jelly! I call it a Krabby Patty with Jellyfish Jelly.

speaker: Fred
line: Could I try some?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Sure! [gives Fred some jellyfish jelly into his Krabby Patty]

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: SpongeBob, who's playing Squidward's records again?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: No-one Mr. Krabs. I was just sharing my jellyfish jelly with the customers. [Showing some fish eating jelly patties happily. Shows love hearts and extremely satisfied customers.] Here you go Mr. Krabs. Send your taste buds on a journey.

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: [sniffs the patty suspiciously] Messing with the patty's formula, that's mutiny! Why I oughta...!

speaker: Fred
line: Sir, this is the greatest thing I've ever eaten! I'm going to come back here for lunch everyday for the rest of my life! [A bill with Fred appears in it] Hey, buddy, you alright?

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: [speechless, mutters incoherently]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: You okay Mr. K?

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: SpongeBob, I got a proposition for ye. How's about you go catch me some of those little moneyfish?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Oh boy. Getting paid to jellyfish. That's my life's dream!

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Well, keep dreaming. [Mr. Krabs gives him a jellyfish net] This'll be on your time.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Aye, aye, sir!

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Now go get me some jellyfish, and make it [SpongeBob holds up a jellyfish in a jar] ...quick. Uhh, SpongeBob? We're gonna need more than one puny jellyfish.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: But, sir, how many jellyfish do you need?

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: SpongeBob, we have a whole ecosystem full of hungry paying customers. [Mr Krabs starts dramatizing depressing emotions] Oh no! Don't tell me! You've stopped caring for the customer!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [gasps] No! Never!

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: [optimistically] Then go out there and get me some more jellies!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Okay, Mr. Krabs. Just make sure the jellyfish are comfortable. They are oh, so sensitive. [leaves]

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: [sinisterly, to himself] Oh, I'll keep 'em comfortable all right, inside me wallet! [chuckles]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [jellyfishing with many nets. He then shows up with three jars] Here you go, Mr. Krabs!

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: [painting a sign saying "Home of the Jelly Patty"] I'm gonna need more than that, boy.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [cuts a rope. Many jellyfish are inside it. He shows up with five jars] More jellies, Mr. Krabs!

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: [painting jellyfish on the walls of the Krusty Krab with the words "I Love Jellyfish" on his shirt] Oh, that'll never do. More!

speaker: [SpongeBob has a mustache on. A sign next to a jellyfish hive reading "FOR RENT" is shown. Jellyfish come in. They are trapped in a large net]
Mr. Krabs
line: [customers are lined up] More, SpongeBob!

speaker: [SpongeBob is driving a large replica of himself. Its hand shows up at the Krusty Krab with a jar full of jellyfish]
Mr. Krabs
line: What don't you understand about... more!

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: More! [SpongeBob catches two jellyfish with a net] More! [SpongeBob catches a jellyfish with a jar] More! [SpongeBob catches some jellyfish with a net while jumping leftwards to the screen] More! [SpongeBob tries to catch some jellyfish with a net by jumping rightwards to the screen] More... [SpongeBob manages to catch some more jellyfish with a net by jumping leftwards to the screen. Mr. Krabs now appears as a hideous caricature, popularly known as "Moar Krabs."] More! [SpongeBob's catching goes wildly fast. Mr. Krabs now appears normal, but continually appearing] More, more, more, more! More, more! More! [Cut to night. A sign reading "Jellyfish Fields. Pop. 0" is seen. "4 Million" is crossed out]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Well, there's no more! Now, that's jellyfishing!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: It feels like somebody... wants to sell me something!

speaker: Businessman
line: [hiding behind rock with another businessman] I told you he was onto us!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [running away] I'm not interested in anything you're selling! [opens the door to his house and gets in] I sure felt like... [laughs] I must be working too hard. [telephone rings] I'll get it, Gary! Hello, SpongeBob's house, SpongeBob speaking. Hello?

speaker: No Name
line: [breathing]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [laughing nervously] Wrong number. [No Name has pliers and cuts the living room fuse and the lights go out. SpongeBob laughs nervously] I guess Gary forgot to pay the electric bill! [door opens and a small, black figure comes in] Gary, is that you? Gary? [the figure goes inside the kitchen] Uh, yeah, good idea, Gary, there's probably some candles in the kitchen. [light shines on a Krabby Patty with blue jellyfish jelly] Hello, what's this? What are you doing here, oh delicious one? A little snack will calm my nerves! Mmm... a Krabby Patty with blue jelly. [gasps] Blue jelly! [No Name shows up] Hey, old No Name? What's happening?

speaker: No Name
line: [buzzing, shows a net and jar]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: No Name, let me out! What are you gonna do with me? Pee-yew! What smells like big business? [No Name shows a factory] Hey, I don't remember that factory! [No Name shows him the inside] Huh? [Jellyfish are inside tubes. They are being sucked of their jelly. The dried out ones are put in trash cans. SpongeBob gasps] What is this horrible place? [a robot is tickling a jellyfish]

speaker: Robot
line: Coochie coochie coo. [jellyfish sneezes the jelly out and dries up]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: What kind of monster is responsible for this horror?

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: [on an exercising machine with headphones] That's it, boys! Keep that gelatinous gold mine flowing! [laughs]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Mr. Krabs? No! Now I know why you brought me here. But what can we do? [Mr. Krabs is listening to the song "Give It All You've Got." SpongeBob breaks in riding on No Name] Mr. Krabs! Stop this madness! Stop it right now!

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Uh... uh... This... This isn't what it looks like, SpongeBob! Why... uh... We're just... uh... having a little tea party!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Oh, boy! A tea party! [No Name touches him] You tricked me, Mr. Krabs! I wouldn't have collected all those jellyfish if I knew that this was their fate! This isn't right! Jellyfish need wide-open space and fresh air!

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Easy boy, what are you doing with that?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [holding an alligator wrench]  Something that should've been done a long time ago!

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: No!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: The squeaky bolt on this door was driving me crazy!

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: [relieved] Whew!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: And now I'm gonna set these jellyfish free! [tries to open it, but is unsuccessful]

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: [laughs] Well, you can't. The door's voice-activated and will only open if I say "open". [Covers his mouth. The sign on the door lights the words "OPEN" and the jellyfish escape]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Freedom! Freedom!

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: You'll never catch me! [He pedals but the exercising machine is bolted to the ground] Blasted exercise craze! [jellyfish sting him and he screams in pain]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [jellyfish escape out the doors] Goodbye, friends!

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: [walks out and is incredibly burned] I'm taking jelly off the menu. [leaves]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: He really got burned on that deal! [laughs] All is as it should be. [brings put his jellyfish net] I promise never to use this jellyfish net for anything but pure sport again. Jellyfish aren't meant to be captured forever! [No Name floats in SpongeBob's net. He gasps] Oh, No Name! I guess I can name you now. I'll call you... "Friend." [reaches his arm out. No Name does, but accidentally stings SpongeBob. He nervously smiles]

speaker: [Scene begins outside of the Fast Food Coliseum]
Johnny
line: Welcome, sports fans, to the 21st annual Bikini Bottom Fry Cook Games.

speaker: [Horns are played as Harold the blue spotted fish runs into the stadium, holding a small torch. He runs up the stairs to a huge hamburger]
Harold
line: I declare these Fry Cook Games... open!

speaker: [A gust of wind blows by and puts out the flame on the torch. "Please Stand By" appears on the screen. The horns blow again and Harold the fish runs back into the stadium, this time shielding the torch with his hand and panting. He runs back up the stairs to the huge hamburger]
Harold
line: I declare these Fry Cook Games...

speaker: Harold
line: ... open!

speaker: Johnny
line: So begin the 21st Fry Cook Games. I'm a realistic Fish Head, and it's a beautiful day here at Bikini Bottom's Fast Food Coliseum.

speaker: [A clip plays showing a woman tossing a large straw into a large plastic cup]
Johnny
line: They come from everywhere microwaves hum.

speaker: [A clip of a woman throwing an uncooked patty onto a grill is shown]
Johnny
line: Patties sizzle.

speaker: [A clip of a fish bouncing on top of a large cube of gelatin and landing on a mat is shown]
Johnny
line: And heat lamps keep the fast food spirit warm... and Soggy. But the real story is the bitter rivalry between former competitors Mr. Krabs of the Krusty Krab and Plankton of the Chum Bucket.

speaker: [Pictures of both Mr. Krabs and Plankton appear. A clip of Mr. Krabs lifting up two barrels of pickles is shown]
Johnny
line: Who could forget the year Mr. Krabs won gold for this five hundred pickle clean-and-jerk?

speaker: [Mr. Krabs is shown on a podium on the number one step, while Plankton is below him on the second]
Johnny
line: Not Plankton.

speaker: [Plankton sprays Mr. Krabs with a hose. A clip of Plankton flipping around while hanging onto two onion rings is shown]
Johnny
line: Or when Plankton won the hearts of millions by performing this perfect onion ring routine... with a broken antenna?

speaker: [A cast is around Plankton's left antenna. Plankton is shown in the number one spot on the podium this time, with Mr. Krabs below him]
Johnny
line: Krabs wasn't moved.

speaker: [Mr. Krabs blows Plankton off the podium]
Johnny
line: And now, late word is that this year, the Krusty Krab will be represented by a new competitor, on what is perhaps the greatest day of his young life. [A picture of a shadowy figure of a body with a question mark over it appears. The figure turns around and is revealed to be SpongeBob, wearing a sweatband and sports uniform. SpongeBob is standing next to Mr. Krabs, who is sitting on a bench staring at a stopwatch, then shows Ernie in a picture]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: This is perhaps the greatest day of my young life, Mr. Krabs.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: I can't believe I'm representing the Krusty Krab in the Fry Cook Games.

speaker: [A spotlight shines down on him and he puts his hand on his heart]
SpongeBob
line: To bring home the gold is to bring honor and glory to the Krusty Krab.

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: And all that free publicity will bring in customers! So don't lose!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Aye, aye, Mr. Krabs!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Krusty Krab! Krusty Krab! Krusty Krab!

speaker: Patrick
line: Hey, SpongeBob.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Hi, Patrick.

speaker: Krusty Krab! Krusty Krab! Krusty Krab!
SpongeBob
line: Come on, Patrick, I'm trying to train for the games.

speaker: Patrick
line: Games? Can I play?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Ah, sorry, Patrick.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: You have to be a fry cook.

speaker: Patrick
line: Be a fry cook? Is that all I gotta do? That'll be easy!

speaker: [SpongeBob tosses his jump rope behind him]
SpongeBob
line: What do you mean easy?

speaker: Patrick
line: How hard can it be?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: They don't let just anybody be a fry cook. We're an elite corp!

speaker: Patrick
line: Oh, come on. You're just flippin' patties.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Hey, flipping is not as easy as it sounds!

speaker: [Patrick flips a rock over with his foot]
Patrick
line: Tssss...

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Why don't you go home Patrick? You can compete in the Laying Under a Rock All Day Games!

speaker: Patrick
line: Well, at least I don't polish my fingernails.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: You take that back!

speaker: [SpongeBob's index finger gleams. Patrick dances around]
Patrick
line: Fingernails! Fingernails! Fingernails!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: You don't even have fingernails.

speaker: Patrick
line: I cannot believe what I am hearing!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: How can you hear it? You don't have ears either!

speaker: Patrick
line: Holes! Holes!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Cone head!

speaker: Patrick
line: Yellow!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Pink!

speaker: Patrick
line: I'm gonna get a job as a fry cook and it'll be easy!

speaker: [Patrick walks off. SpongeBob growls and starts doing pushups again, this time faster]
SpongeBob
line: Fine! Krusty Krab! Krusty Krab! Krusty Krab!

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: What's that smell in the air? I smell Plankton!

speaker: [Camera zooms over to Plankton, who is standing in the entranceway of the stadium. Plankton pulls out a human nose from behind him]
Plankton
line: Oh yeah?! Well, I smell...

speaker: Plankton
line: Pew! He's right.

speaker: [Mr. Krabs runs over, his feet twinkling. Plankton does the same. Mr. Krabs makes a Broadway pose as corresponding music plays. Plankton makes a similar pose, holding a cane and a top hat. Mr. Krabs plays a piano, while Plankton blows into a tuba, messing up the rhythm]
Plankton
line: I love messing things up.

speaker: [Plankton meets up with Mr. Krabs by getting on a small platform and pulling a lever which goes up to Mr. Krabs' height]
Plankton
line: Are you ready to do or die, Krabs?

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Always ready, Plankton. Always ready.

speaker: Plankton
line: Good. Because today, the Chum Bucket is going to kick...

speaker: [Plankton raises his arm and accidentally whacks the lever, causing him to lower again. He raises it back up]
Plankton
line: ...your carapace!

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: That's what you think, but I got me a champion. SpongeBob! Show him!

speaker: [SpongeBob does a karate routine, using two spatulas as nunchucks, then laughs innocently when he finishes]
Mr. Krabs
line: Look at him. In his prime. You ain't got no chance!

speaker: Plankton
line: That's where you're wrong, Krabs, for I too have a champion.

speaker: Plankton
line: Ladies and gentlemen, turn your attention to the southwest corridor!

speaker: [The crowd turns to the southeast corridor]
Plankton
line: Other way! [quietly] Imbeciles.

speaker: [The crowd turns to the southwest corridor]
Plankton
line: And... stop! Perfect.

speaker: [In the entranceway, an extremely large shadow approaches, making loud stomps on the way]
Plankton
line: Representing the Chum Bucket, a creature so fearsome, so terrible, so mind-bendingly large, that those of you with weak constitutions may want to leave the stadium. [Two parents cover up their child's eyes, and he covers theirs. Mr. Krabs' eyes sink into his shell. A muscular fish sits, trembling in the audience. He quickly gets up to leave]

speaker: Muscular Fish
line: I gotta get outta here!

speaker: Plankton
line: Too late! Ready or not, here he comes. Quake with fear, you mortal fools. Bow down before the awesome might of...

speaker: [The wall of the stadium explodes. Fish fly everywhere. When the dust clears up, a huge, purple muscular fish is seen]
Plankton
line: ...this huge guy who is carrying the real contestant...

speaker: [The huge fish turns around, revealing Patrick to be strapped to his back]
Plankton
line: ...Patrick Star!

speaker: [Patrick waves happily. SpongeBob stares in shock. He walks up as Patrick gets down from the huge fish's back]
SpongeBob
line: Patrick, what are you doing here? You're not a fry cook.

speaker: Patrick
line: Oh, yes I am, Mr. SpongeBob SuperiorPants.

speaker: Patrick
line: Check it out!

speaker: [A name tag is stuck to his chest that says, "The Chum Bucket, Patrick."]
Patrick
line: I've been working for the Chum Bucket for almost five minutes.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Well, it doesn't matter anyway 'cause you're gonna eat my dust.

speaker: Patrick
line: Nuh uh. I'm eating my own dust!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Not if I eat it first!

speaker: Patrick
line: Yellow!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Pink!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: I can't believe it, Mr. Krabs. I thought Patrick was my friend.

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Friend? Not in here he ain't.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: What do you mean?

speaker: Plankton
line: He's not really your friend.

speaker: Patrick
line: He's not?

speaker: Plankton
line: He's plotting your downfall right now!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: He is?

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: He's gonna stab you in the back.

speaker: Patrick
line: He wouldn't!

speaker: Plankton
line: Of course he would. Just look at him. Square the shape of evil!

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: He's making a mockery of your profession. Are we gonna let some pretender take away what belongs to the Krusty Krab?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: No!

speaker: Plankton
line: Then get mean!

speaker: Patrick
line: I'm mean!

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Get angry!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: I'm angry!

speaker: Plankton
line: Now get out there!

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: And win...

speaker: Plankton
line: That...

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Medal!

speaker: Patrick
line: [screams]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [screams]

speaker: SpongeBob and Patrick
line: [both scream]

speaker: Huge Fish
line: Ahhh.

speaker: Johnny
line: Our first event, the deep fry pole vault. [A deep fryer labeled "Fry King" sits in front of two high poles. SpongeBob stands in front of Mr. Krabs, holding a long pole]

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Win this one for the Krusty Krab.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: For the Krusty Krab!!! [SpongeBob flips over the poles and the deep fry and splats down on the circle drawn in the ground. The crowd gasps. SpongeBob forms a number one sign and the crowd cheers]

speaker: Plankton
line: Win this one because I told you to.

speaker: Patrick
line: Because you told me to! [Patrick flips over the poles but lands on the handle of the deep fryer, flinging it at the crowd and turning them into fish sticks. A vendor walks up and turns on a heat lamp]

speaker: Vendor
line: Fish sticks! Get your fish sticks here!

speaker: [Scene cuts to the second event. SpongeBob and Patrick are standing in front of a tall ladder that leads to a diving board, perched above a bowl of chocolate syrup]
Johnny
line: The next event the chocolate high dive.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Make way for the real fry cook, Patrick.

speaker: Johnny
line: For his dive, SpongeBob will be attempting a full banana fudge pop with two sticks.

speaker: [SpongeBob holds up two popsicle sticks and sticks them into the top of his head]
Johnny
line: And now, absolute silence.

speaker: [The crowd stops chattering. SpongeBob jumps off the diving board]
SpongeBob
line: I scream for ice cream! [SpongeBob flips around a couple times, then leaps toward the bowl. He lands in the chocolate syrup getting coated in it, then hops out of it and into a sandbox full of toasted almonds]

speaker: Johnny
line: Perfect entry! And toasted almonds? That's unexpected.

speaker: Johnny
line: He stuck it!

speaker: [SpongeBob turns around toward the camera and grins]
Johnny
line: And just look at that even coating.

speaker: [SpongeBob walks upside-down past Patrick, using the popsicle sticks for legs]
SpongeBob
line: Top that, Pinky.

speaker: Plankton
line: Almonds? Curse him, that's good. But perhaps a bit too highbrow for this crowd. He thinks he's better than them!

speaker: Plankton
line: Better than you!

speaker: Plankton
line: Now get up there and show him how the common man prepares his frozen dairy treats!

speaker: [Patrick screams, then hops up onto the diving board with the lower half of his body inside an ice cream cone]
Johnny
line: Patrick will be resurrecting an old favorite. The single scoop strawberry cone with a chocolate dip.

speaker: [Patrick slowly leans off the edge until he falls off the diving board]
Johnny
line: Just look at that concentration.

speaker: [Patrick splashes into the bowl, with chocolate syrup flying everywhere]
Johnny
line: Ooh, a little shaky on that entrance.

speaker: [A live action strawberry cone with a chocolate dip is shown]
Johnny
line: But just look at that form!

speaker: [Patrick hops up to SpongeBob grinning while SB is very angry about losing]
Patrick
line: Take that, yellow boy!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Laugh while you can, Pinky. It's not over yet.

speaker: Patrick
line: That's what you think, but it's not over yet.

speaker: [A clip of highlights from the games is shown, beginning with SpongeBob tossing a patty. Patrick skates on a large grill with butter on his feet. Patrick tosses a large bottle of ketchup up in the air. SpongeBob and Patrick race on a track carrying trays full of food; the two fly up in the air on two large spatulas. They both do a dance wearing colorful outfits and fruit hats. The clip ends. A large arena on top of a hamburger is on screen. The realistic Fish Head is still reporting]
Johnny
line: It's not over yet! With the score tied, we go to our final event! Bun wrestling. Who will take home the gold? Mr. Krabs of the Krusty Krab?

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: [rubbing SpongeBob's shoulders] Don't forget, he called ye yellow.

speaker: [SpongeBob picks up a metal chain and bites off and chews up the middle of it. He bares his teeth, revealing the metal chain to now be attached to them like braces]
Johnny
line: Or Plankton of the Chum Bucket?

speaker: Plankton
line: Don't forget, he called you pink!

speaker: [Plankton hops away. Patrick growls as he picks up a lemon, rips it in half, puts both halves into each of his eyes and screams]

[Heavy metal music plays. The bell rings. SpongeBob tears off his blue robe, showing off his extremely large, muscular body. Patrick rips off his own green robe, underneath which he is wearing a business suit. He tears off the business suit, also revealing an extremely large, muscular body. The two dive at each other, screaming, until they collide. They wrestle and continue to wind up in twisted positions. They spin around and wind up wrestling with themselves. They realize this, and dive back at each other. Patrick sits on top of SpongeBob, holding his foot]
Patrick
line: Forget the Chum Bucket. This is personal.

speaker: [Patrick takes off SpongeBob's shoe and licks his foot slowly. SpongeBob screams in agony. The two wrestle again. SpongeBob sits on Patrick's chest and lifts up a pencil with the eraser side pointing toward Patrick. He slowly brings it down to his name tag and erases the "Pat" in "Patrick", leaving "rick"]
Patrick
line: [screams] Noooo! My name's... not... Rick!

speaker: [Patrick tackles SpongeBob and the two wrestle once more before they stop]
SpongeBob
line: I don't like you!

speaker: Patrick
line: I don't like you more!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: I never liked you!

speaker: Patrick
line: I a thousand times never liked you!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Pink!

speaker: Patrick
line: Yellow!

speaker: [They struggle to push each other until both of their pants rip and fall down. Patrick's underwear is yellow. SpongeBob's underwear is pink]
SpongeBob
line: Yellow?

speaker: Patrick
line: Pink?

speaker: SpongeBob and Patrick
line: You do care!

speaker: [They both start crying and hug each other]
SpongeBob
line: Let's promise never to fight again, buddy.

speaker: Patrick
line: Yeah, pal. Let's go home.

speaker: [The two friends walk off whistling and holding hands. The crowd boos. Mr. Krabs runs up]
Mr. Krabs
line: Hey! Where ya going?

speaker: [Plankton runs up next to Mr. Krabs]
Plankton
line: Get back here and kill each other!

speaker: [SpongeBob and Patrick exit the stadium, arms on each other's backs]
Patrick
line: You're my best friend ever.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: You too, Patrick.

speaker: Patrick
line: You know, these were white when I bought 'em.

speaker: [The episode opens at The Krusty Krab. Mr. Krabs is in his office with an adding machine, singing]
[His eyes bug out at the ticker tape and he gasps]
Mr. Krabs
line: What?! Profits down three dollars from last month! I got to start running a tighter ship around here!

speaker: [Meanwhile, Squidward is helping Martha in his ordering boat at the dining area of the Krusty Krab]
Squidward
line: Thank you for choosing the Krusty Krab. Here's your change.

speaker: [Gives Martha a dollar, and she walks off. Mr. Krabs approaches him]
Mr. Krabs
line: Mr. Squidward!

speaker: Squidward
line: What?

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: What's with all this "change" nonsense?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Over and under, grab the end, put it through here, up and around, round the horn, bring it back home.

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Hmm? SpongeBob! I ain't paying you to play dress up! [Squidward becomes exasperated, and takes a deep breath]

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Breathe on your own time. I don't pay you to breathe.

speaker: Squidward
line: You hardly pay us at all!

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Oh, that reminds me. I got something for you.

speaker: Squidward
line: Ah, yes! Our meager restitution. [He takes the envelope and smells it] Ah, the sweet smell of payday. [He opens it and enclosed is a pair of underwear] Huh?

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Oh, sorry, that's me dry cleaning. [Trades envelopes with him] Here's your check.

speaker: [He gives SpongeBob an envelope as well]
Mr. Krabs
line: And here's yours, SpongeBob.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: I can't accept your money, Mr. Krabs. Grilling is my passion!

speaker: Squidward
line: What is this!?! [He sees that there is a bill instead of a check. It charges Squidward for breathing, talking, standing, existing, lollygagging, and chewing] You're making me pay you to stand at the cash register? What is the meaning of this? Have you gone off the deep end?

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: There's going to be a few changes around here. Every time I catch you two goofing off, I'm gonna charge you for it.

speaker: [SpongeBob walks up to Mr. Krabs, preparing money for him]
SpongeBob
line: 18... 19... and... 20. Here you go, Mr. K. I think this should cover all my nonsense. Oh, and here's an extra fifty cents for when I was tying my shoe. [Mr. Krabs is drooling over SpongeBob's cash, and Squidward pulls SpongeBob towards him]

speaker: Squidward
line: Uh, SpongeBob? What do you think you're doing?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: I'm just giving Mr. Krabs the money I owe him.

speaker: Squidward
line: Well, I'm not paying that cheapskate Krabs one cent, and I suggest you do the same.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Why?

speaker: Squidward
line: We've got to unite as workers and demand the respect we deserve from the boss! In fact, you and I should go on strike!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Wow! You and me go on strike?

speaker: Squidward
line: Sure! After all, you like your job, right?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Right!

speaker: Squidward
line: And you want to keep working here, right?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Right!

speaker: Squidward
line: And while you work here, you expect to be treated fairly, right?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Right!

speaker: Squidward
line: Then let's go on strike!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Yay! A strike!

speaker: [He inadvertently kicks Mr. Krabs in the butt as Krabs sweeps the floor]
SpongeBob
line: Hey, guess what, Mr. Krabs? Me and Squidward are going to go on strike!

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: A strike?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Yeah.

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: You mean you're going to make picket signs?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Yeah.

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: And you're going to make protest speeches?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Yeah, yeah!

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: And you're going to demand me respect?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Yeah! [Cut to SpongeBob sobbing outside of the Krusty Krab] Noo...

speaker: SpongeBob
line: No! Squidward! You didn't tell me I was going to get fired! Without the Krusty Krab, I-I-I... [He cries more] Oh, Squidward, could you hold me? I think I'm going to be sick.

speaker: Squidward
line: SpongeBob!

speaker: [He grabs SpongeBob and pulls him off the door, but his arms and legs stick]
Squidward
line: News flash, SpongeBob! I got fired, too! [SpongeBob is suctioned to the door. Squidward pulls him off again, and this time his face remains pressed against the door] This is exactly why we need to go on strike. [SpongeBob flies back to the door. Squidward pulls him off once more, and this time SpongeBob's front sticks to the door, and we can see his skeleton and internal organs on his other side] He can't treat us like this anymore!

speaker: [SpongeBob goes back to the door and Squidward's eyes become bloodshot]
Squidward
line: He owes us for all the precious, irretrievable moments we've wasted in this trash heap.

speaker: [SpongeBob and Squidward look through the door to see Mr. Krabs blowing dust off his old "Help Wanted" sign]
Squidward
line: Soon, he'll realize he needs us more than we need him. We are workers united!

speaker: Squidward
line: Ahem.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Sorry.

speaker: Squidward
line: Just do exactly as I say, SpongeBob, and in no time you'll have your job back and more.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: And more?

speaker: [He imagines himself in his Krusty Krew uniform hat, except his hat is slightly bigger]
Squidward
line: Alright SpongeBob, now listen up. I'm going to have to teach you how to strike. First, we must get rid of our uniforms, [He takes off his hat] they are a symbol of our oppression. I want you to throw your hat on the ground like so. [Squidward throws it into the ground and stomps on it] Now, stomp it into the dust! Your turn, SpongeBob.

speaker: Squidward
line: That's the idea. Now, throw it on the ground.

speaker: [SpongeBob attempts to do so, but the hat sticks to his hand despite the fact he no longer has any grip on it]
SpongeBob
line: [screams in frustration] I can't do it, Squidward. This hat is my friend! It never oppressed me.

speaker: Squidward
line: SpongeBob, you're pathetic. Look, I threw my hat to the ground.

speaker: [A police fish walks up to Squidward with a ticket in a scene similar to the one in "Bossy Boots"]
Officer John
line: Aha! A confession! Next time, think before you litter.

speaker: [He sticks the ticket to Squidward's forehead and leaves. Later, Squidward and SpongeBob are painting signs]
Squidward
line: Okay, pay attention, SpongeBob. Now we're going to make picket signs. This is a very important part of striking.

speaker: [SpongeBob holds up a picket fence on a stick]
SpongeBob
line: Like this, Squidward?

speaker: Squidward
line: Not a picket fence, you ding-dong. Picket sign!

speaker: [SpongeBob holds up a sign that has a finger picking a nose]
SpongeBob
line: How's this?

speaker: Squidward
line: ...No. [Picks up his] This is a picket sign Krusty Krab Unfair. Short, sweet, and to the point. [SpongeBob holds up his similar one that reads "Krusty Krab Funfair"]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: How's this, Squidward?

speaker: Squidward
line: SpongeBob, it's "unfair," not "funfair"!

speaker: Sandals
line: A funfair? Where? I could go for some fun.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: At the Krusty Krab.

speaker: Sandals
line: Hey everybody! Let's go to the fun fair! [A crowd of fish trample Squidward to get the restaurant. Later, SpongeBob is holding a sign that says "No Fair!" on it]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Krusty Krab is unfair! Mr. Krabs is in there! Standing at the concession! Plotting his oppression!

speaker: [A teenager fish with a cap and braces walks up]
Teenage Fry Cook
line: What the heck does that mean?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: I don't know. Squidward told me to yell it at people.

speaker: Teenage Fry Cook
line: Then you must be SpongeBob SquarePants!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Yep!

speaker: Teenage Fry Cook
line: Dude, you are like a fry cook legend! Will you sign my spatula?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Anything for an aspiring fry cook. [SpongeBob signs the spatula] So, did you come down to help out the cause?

speaker: Teenage Fry Cook
line: No, I came to take your job.

speaker: [SpongeBob is shocked. The fish grabs his spatula and pen and runs into the Krusty Krab to apply for a job]
Teenage Fry Cook
line: Hey, thanks, dude!

speaker: [Squidward walks up and bellows at SpongeBob through the megaphone so loudly that his facial features fall off, and he flies away.]
Squidward
line: Attention, SpongeBob! You are a terrible striker! [SpongeBob inserts his eyes into their sockets] You just let your replacement cross our picket line without so much as a single threat.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: I'm sorry, Squidward. [He holds up a sign reading, "I Heart the Krusty Krab"] How about I try the signs again?

speaker: Squidward
line: [into megaphone] Forget the signs! I've got something for you to do. Go stand over there.

speaker: [SpongeBob stands next to a telephone pole]
SpongeBob
line: Like this, Squidward?

speaker: Squidward
line: Almost. A little more to the right. And... perfect. [We see that SpongeBob is now hidden behind the telephone pole. As Squidward begins to speaks, a crowd gathers] Attention, people of Bikini Bottom! You have been cheated and lied to!

speaker: Miss Shell
line: I knew it!

speaker: Squidward
line: The gentle laborer shall no longer suffer from the noxious greed of Mr. Krabs!

speaker: Archie
line: Hey, what's that guy talking about?

speaker: Francis
line: I don't know, but he's got a megaphone.

speaker: Squidward
line: We will dismantle oppression board by board! We'll saw the foundation of big business in half, even if it takes an eternity!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [From behind pole] Gee, I don't know what Squidward's talking about, but he sure sounds convincing.

speaker: Squidward
line: With your support, we will send the hammer of the people's will crashing through the windows of Mr. Krabs' house of servitude!

speaker: [He speaks into Fred's face, and his eyes shoot into the back of his head. Then, they return to their sockets. Everyone cheers]
Billy (lime fish)
line: Wow, all this supporting is making me hungry.

speaker: Sandals
line: Hey, everybody! Let's go get a Krabby Patty.

speaker: [Everyone cheers and run into the Krusty Krab, once again trampling Squidward]
Squidward
line: Nobody gives a care about the fate of labor as long as they can get their instant gratification.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: That was a great speech, Squidward. You practically had them eating out of your hands.

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: But they didn't, did they, Mr. Squidward? 'Cause they were too busy eating out of mine. I wish you two had gone on strike earlier. Thanks for attracting all these paying customers with all your signage and your sloganeering!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Alright, Mr. Krabs. You've gone too far this time. You can pick on me, but Squidward is a great leader. We are workers united! We're tired of your smelly greed! And we're gonna saw all your tables, and we're gonna smash stuff with the people's hammer. And we're gonna... we're gonna... Squidward, what was that other part?

speaker: Squidward
line: Dismantle your oppressive establishment?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Yeah, that too!

speaker: [Mr. Krabs pretends to yawn and leaves]
SpongeBob
line: And me and Squidward are gonna stay on strike until we get what we deserve! Even if it takes forever!

speaker: [Squidward's eyes become bloodshot. SpongeBob's voice echoes "forever" in Squidward's mind as he opens the door to his house, takes a bath, looks in the mirror, and sits in bed, wide-eyed. He seems to have a case of insomnia as the word haunts him]
Squidward
line: On strike with SpongeBob... forever? [He imagines himself as an old man with a white beard holding a sign reading, "Krusty Still Unfair." Cobwebs branch from him to the ground. An old SpongeBob approaches him, supported by a cane]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Hey, Squidward. I bet old man Krabs is going to break any day. [tugs Squidward's beard] Eh, Squidward? Eh, Squidward? [bonks Squidward on the head with his cane] Eh, Squidward? Eh, Squidward? [floats around Squidward] Eh, Squidward? Eh, Squidward?

speaker: [Squidward sits up in bed and screams]
Squidward
line: I gotta beg Mr. Krabs for my job back and put an end to this nightmare!

speaker: [He runs to the door and opens it, and Krabs is there in his nightclothes, about to knock on it]
Mr. Krabs
line: Oh! Uh, evening, Mr. Squidward. Uh... I was just in the neighborhood and I, uh... thought I'd drop by to... beg you to come back to work! The Krusty Krab is a wreck! I'm ruined without you and the little yellow guy. [He grovels at Squidward's feet] The teenagers I hired is ruining the place! And the worst part is, they won't leave me alone!

speaker: Teenagers
line: Alright, Mr. Krabs!

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: See what I mean? Squidward, please, you got to come back.

speaker: Squidward
line: You'll give us anything we want?

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Yes, anything. So what do you say, Mr. Squidward?

speaker: Squidward
line: Your story breaks my heart, Mr. Krabs. Why don't we take a little walk and, uh... discuss my terms.

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: I got a bad feeling in the pit of me wallet.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Gee, being on strike with Squidward sure is a kick. Squidward's words are still buzzing around in my head like an angry jellyfish. Squidward was right! I can't just sit here, it's time for action! [He kicks open his front door, hammer and saw in hand. He runs to the Krusty Krab and into the dining room] I will restore the working man to his rightful glory. I will dismantle this oppressive establishment board by board! [He pulls up a loose floorboard. He then saws a table in half] I will saw the tables of tyranny in half. Gnaw at the ankles of big business! [He takes a bite out of a wooden column. Mouth full] Squidward will be so proud!

speaker: [Cut to Squidward and Krabs, now fully dressed, walking to the Krab at dawn]
Mr. Krabs
line: Well, Squidward, those were intense negotiations.

speaker: Squidward
line: I'm glad you saw it our way, Mr. Krabs.

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: Now I can fire them teenagers and get me two golden boys back. Well, see you at work!

speaker: [Squidward sees a disassembled Krusty Krab and screams. Krabs seems not to notice and hums as he puts his key where the door used to be, unlocking nothing. SpongeBob peeks out from the mangled sign pole. He runs out, trying to hold in his laughter]
Squidward
line: S-Sp-SpongeBob! W-W-What have you done?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: I did exactly as you said, Squidward. I dismantled the establishment! Now we'll get our jobs back for sure.

speaker: [Krabs walks through the rubble of the Krusty Krab, oblivious, and sits in his chair. Only then does he see the debris. Only the floor and base of the walls remain, so when he looks straight ahead from his chair, he can see Squidward and SpongeBob at the dilapidated door frame. Krabs' arms pop off followed by his eyes. His head slides off his torso and onto the floor where his nose falls out of it. Then his pelvis and legs fall out of his chair]
Mr. Krabs
line: Squidward! SpongeBob!

speaker: [SpongeBob is excited, but Squidward is nervous]
Both
line: Yes, Mr. Krabs?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Here it comes!

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: In order to pay off these damages, you two are going to work for me forever!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Ya-hoo! The strike worked, Squidward! We got our jobs back! Forever!

speaker: ["Forever" once again echoes inside Squidward's mind, and the camera zooms in on his bloodshot eyes]
Narrator
line: One eternity later...

speaker: [We see the Krusty Krab full of dust, but not customers. Cobwebs are everywhere. A skeleton Squidward brushes off the floor, and a skeleton SpongeBob waits in the ordering boat]
French Narrator
line: Ahh, another peaceful evening in Bikini Bottom. Listen to the tropical tranquility. [we see the town of Bikini Bottom; something underground is tunneling and consumes the Bikini Bottom sign] Uh-oh. [the tunneling thing moves on to the rest of Bikini Bottom; a cop is writing a ticket for a car parked near a fire hydrant; the thing, still invisible, makes eating noises; we then see that the car has disappeared, so the cop picks up the fire hydrant, moves it to the adjacent car, and places the ticket on that car, whistling as he walks away; the thing moves on to SpongeBob's house; Gary wakes up, sees the thing, and meows in terror; SpongeBob is still fast asleep]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [mumbling, half-asleep] Trick-or-treat. Thank you. [the thing takes SpongeBob's blanket] You keep the change. [the thing takes SpongeBob's pillow] What? [he wakes up fully and stares fixedly at the thing in terror; camera zooms out to show half of the pineapple house's walls missing; new scene shows SpongeBob talking to a crowd at the Krusty Krab] I saw it! It was big! It was all wiggly! And it ate everything!

speaker: Patrick
line: That's horrible! [gobbles down a whole tray of food, containers and all]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: It was an Alaskan... Bull... Worm! [each of the three words appears on screen; "Alaskan" in an icy form, "Bull" in a furry text, and "Worm!" with different worms forming the word. The crowd murmurs worriedly]

speaker: Fred
line: He ate my wheelbarrow! [he has his wheelbarrow with a bite taken out of it]

speaker: Nancy Suzy Fish
line: He ate my children's homework! [her two kids wink simultaneously and give a big thumbs-up]

speaker: Awesome Fish/Fish 3
line: [has a huge bite taken out of his butt] Do I need to say it?

speaker: Fish 4
line: [crowd murmurs some more] How can we protect ourselves?

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: I've got it! Let's all buy a Krabby Patty! [crowd boos and throws ketchup and mustard bottles at him]

speaker: Fish 5
line: We should lock our doors!

speaker: Mable
line: We should call my nephew!

speaker: Knight Fish
line: We should dig a moat!

speaker: Patrick
line: We should take Bikini Bottom, and push it somewhere else! [crowd immediately quiets down]

speaker: Squidward
line: That idea may just be crazy enough... to get us all killed! [crowd resumes fretting]

speaker: Patrick
line: [Amongst the murmuring] What's wrong with my idea?

speaker: Fish 1
line: Let's get someone to go after it!

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: There ain't no one fool enough to take on an Alaskan Bull Worm! [a horrible screeching noise is heard; the crowd cringes; we see a scary-looking old guy in a raincoat with a hook for a hand, scraping it on the window of the Krusty Krab; he stops]

speaker: Unnamed Sailor
line: You got a bathroom in this place?

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: [looks slightly peeved] In the back.

speaker: Unnamed Sailor
line: [legs wobble] Thanks. [he runs for it]

speaker: Sandy
line: [under a wide-brimmed cowboy hat] I'll catch your worm for ya, that is, if'n you're willing to pay! [tips brim up]

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: No! You'll never get a cent out of me! [runs to block the cash register with his body] Never! I'd rather that worm come in here right now and eat you all alive! [begins foaming at the mouth; the crowd looks at him strangely; he calms down] Sorry.

speaker: Sandy
line: [laughs good-naturedly] Aw shucks. I don't want your money. I was just playing up the drama of the moment, is all. [Mr. Krabs chuckles, which gradually turns into crying; Sandy continues] Nope. I'm gonna take that spineless critter down for nothing, 'cause this is personal. Look. My tail's gone! [she shows them; crowd gasps] Varmint must've got it while I had my back turned, the coward! [crowd sympathizes] I am gonna get back what's mine! [crowd cheers]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [looks alarmed] What? But Sandy, you don't know what you're up against. We're talking about an Alaskan... Bull... Worm! [the three words appear on screen again]

speaker: Sandy
line: Well, I don't know nothing about Alaska, but looky here. [she pulls out a wallet with pictures] Back in Texas I wrangled bulls, and I wrangled worms. [we see pictures of a real-life squirrel with a lasso around a bull, then a lasso around a worm] Far as I'm concerned, doing 'em both together just saves rope. Now I'm gonna go kick me some worm tail! Yee-haw! [she runs to the doors of the Krusty Krab; the crowd goes wild]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: But Sandy, you don't know!

speaker: Sandy
line: Don't worry, SpongeBob. I won't be long. [leaves]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [chases after her] Sandy! Sandy!

speaker: Mr. Krabs
line: [amidst the still-cheering crowd] Go get 'em, Sandy! We have the utmost confidence in you! [crowd stops; Mr. Krabs turns to Patrick] Now, what was that idea of yours?

speaker: Patrick
line: PUSH! [new scene shows all the citizens trying to push the buildings of Bikini Bottom; cuts back to SpongeBob chasing after Sandy]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Wait! Sandy!

speaker: Sandy
line: Hey, SpongeBob, you coming to watch?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Sandy, don't go!

speaker: Sandy
line: Why not?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Sandy, I saw it! It's big... scary... and pink! [each word appears on the screen; "Big" displayed in large text, "Scary" in green drippy text, and "Pink" in a girly pink text]

speaker: Sandy
line: So's Patrick's belly button, but I ain't afraid of that neither!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: You'll get massacred! [collapses into sponge-cubes]

speaker: Sandy
line: SpongeBob, I'm from Texas. What you think is big and what I think is big are two totally different "big"s. Besides, he's got my tail. I can't take that sitting down.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Okay, but what if the worm didn't take your tail?

speaker: Sandy
line: If that worm ain't got my tail, who does?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [unconvincingly] Um, I do?

speaker: Sandy
line: You do? Where?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Um... in my pocket.

speaker: Sandy
line: Well, why didn't you just say so? Give it here! Come on! [SpongeBob looks nervous, pulls something from his pocket, and opens his hand] SpongeBob, that's a paper clip and a piece of string.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [shakes head] No, it's not. This is your tail.

speaker: Sandy
line: [annoyed] SpongeBob!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [defensively] How would you know?! It's always behind you! Oh, don't go, don't go, don't go! [he jumps onto the front of Sandy's air helmet and hugs it]

speaker: Sandy
line: [pulls him off] SpongeBob, what is the matter with you? Now, I'm gonna go give that legless rascal what-for, and there ain't nothing you can say to stop me! [resumes walking]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Oh yeah? What if I said... 'blargen fedibble no-hip'?

speaker: Sandy
line: [stops] Well, I gotta admit, that slowed me down, but I'm still going for him! [continues]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [appears next to Sandy as she strides along] You know, tails are so overrated. Let's just forget about it and go home. [Sandy keeps walking; SpongeBob reappears] I've got ice cream! With nuts... [Sandy continues; SpongeBob appears once more, this time with a goofy squirrel mask on his face] Sandy, this is your pappy speaking, and I forbid you to go after this worm! Y'all come back here, young lady!

speaker: Sandy
line: You ain't my pa!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [stands in front of her with boxing gloves] Sandy, if you want to get to that worm, you're gonna have to go through me! [Sandy pushes through his body as if walking through a pair of swinging doors; he grabs her ankles, crying] Sandy, no! I can't let you! I'm not gonna let you get killed. If you find him, you'll get eaten for sure!

speaker: Sandy
line: Ain't no way some dumb old sea worm's gonna make a meal of me. I'm too Texas tough!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [still crying and holding onto her ankles] No, not tough enough. Not tough enough!

speaker: Sandy
line: SpongeBob, quit your worrying. I can take care of myself. After all, who's the strongest critter in Bikini Bottom? [she grabs an anchor and pulls a boat down from the surface]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: You are.

speaker: Sandy
line: And who put the hi-yah, hi, ho, "K" in karate? [makes a K shape]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [makes a U shape] You did.

speaker: Sandy
line: And who saves your yellow backside from certain destruction on a regular basis?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [his butt has "Property of Sandy Cheeks" printed on it, states it meekly] You do.

speaker: Sandy
line: Right. And I can handle your little bull worm too, 'cause I am the best there is! There ain't nothin' too big or too ornery for me to catch.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Okay.

speaker: Sandy
line: Say it.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: There isn't anything...

speaker: Sandy
line: Ain't nothin'!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [in a high-pitched voice like Sandy] Ain't nothin' [normal voice] too big or too ornery for you to catch. But... [Sandy cuts him off] But... [cuts him off again] And... [cuts him off again] We... [cuts him off again] I... [cuts him off again] Yeah but...

speaker: Sandy
line: No!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: You see...

speaker: Sandy
line: No!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: I... [Sandy cuts him off one last time with a frustrated groan]

speaker: Sandy
line: [picks up some sand from the ground as if tracking an animal and sniffs it] Worm sign. [she holds a small sign in her palm that has "WORM" painted on it; looks up] He's in that cave.

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Sandy, are you sure you...?

speaker: Sandy
line: Course I am! I'm going in, and I ain't coming out 'til I got me a big heaping plate of worm stew. [she walks into the cave; SpongeBob hides behind a rock and shudders; we hear Sandy inside the cave] Aha! There you are, you tail-nabbin' varmint! Hi-yah! [we hear karate noises; Sandy peeks out of the cave] I'm winnin', SpongeBob! [resumes fighting]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Sandy, that's not...! [more fighting noises; Sandy peeks out again]

speaker: Sandy
line: This shouldn't take long. [resumes fighting]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Sandy, that's not...!

speaker: Sandy
line: Almost done!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Sandy!

speaker: Sandy
line: Yee-haw! [comes out riding a pink segmented thing] I got him, SpongeBob! [makes a giant knot and stands on it proudly]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: [still uneasy] Sandy...?

speaker: Sandy
line: Boy, howdy. This critter put up some sort of fight. But I'm from Texas, and as you can see, no worm is a match for me. I even found my tail! [we see that she has tied the fur to the small remainder of her tail]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: That's not the worm.

speaker: Sandy
line: Pardon?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: That's not the worm. That's his tongue. [camera zooms out to show that SpongeBob is right; the opening of the cave is actually the worm's open mouth; his eyes make a squishy blinking noise]

speaker: Sandy
line: Ohhhh. This is the tongue, and... the whole thing... is the... worm. [freaks out] Run for your life! [they sprint away; the worm growls angrily, chomps down, and chases after them]

speaker: SpongeBob
line: So what's the plan, Sandy? [they look back and see that the worm is approaching faster]

speaker: Sandy
line: Run faster!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: I could've thought of that. Hey, wait a minute! I was right, wasn't I?!

speaker: Sandy
line: Later!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Ah, he is too big for you, isn't he?

speaker: Sandy
line: Not now, SpongeBob!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: I wanna hear you say it!

speaker: Sandy
line: Can we talk about this another time?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Say it!

speaker: Sandy
line: SpongeBob!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Say it, or I'll trip you! [he continues running on one foot, the other poised to trip Sandy]

speaker: Sandy
line: No!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Say it!

speaker: Sandy
line: Not now!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Say it!

speaker: Sandy
line: All right! You were right, and I was wrong. I was wrong, wrong, wrong, wrong, wrong! Are you happy now?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: I knew it. [the worm emits another huge growl; prompting the two to run even faster; they run up and down a sand mound, which the worm plows right through; they run past Fish 3, who is leaning over under his car's hood; his butt is bandaged up; the worm passes by and takes another bite out of him]

speaker: Fish 3
line: Not again!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Uh, Sandy?

speaker: Sandy
line: Yeah?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: What do we do now?

speaker: Sandy
line: [is panting and sweating; the worm growls again; Sandy sees the seemingly endless coral trees in front of them] I've got it! SpongeBob, you still got that paper clip and that string?

speaker: SpongeBob
line: I'm way ahead of you, Sandy. [fashions a necklace out of them] Look, it's a necklace! S for "SpongeBob" or S for "Sandy"! That way they can identify our bodies.

speaker: Sandy
line: No, silly! How about S for "save our skins"? [she takes the string and uses the hook of the paper clip to wrap the string around one of the coral trees; she grabs SpongeBob and swings them up and over the branch onto the worm's back] Yee-haw! Now this is what I call a rodeo! We'll be nice and safe up here. [the worm starts to plow off a cliff like a runaway train; Sandy and SpongeBob realize this, scream, and begin running toward the end of worm to the safety of the plateau; they jump off safely as the worm falls off the cliff] We did it!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Yay! He'll never get out of there!

speaker: Sandy
line: We saved the town!

speaker: SpongeBob
line: Yay! Let's go tell everybody! [new scene shows all the citizens still trying to push Bikini Bottom to safety; the city is now in the valley at the bottom of the cliff]

speaker: Patrick
line: PUSH! [citizens push the city] Push! [push one last time]

speaker: Citizens
line: Hooray! [the worm, still falling, lands on the city and smashes it to bits]

speaker: Worm
line: Ouuuuuch.
